original: chos nyan pa de dag sgyu ma lta bu yin nam sems can de dag sprul pa lta bu ste /🔽chos nyan pa de dag sprul pa lta bu yin nam zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu yin par 'chad du gzhug pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir chos nyan pa'i sems can de dag dang /
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag sgyu ma lta bu yin nam sems can de dag sprul pa lta bu ste / chos nyan pa de dag sprul pa lta bu yin nam zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu yin par 'chad du gzhug pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir chos nyan pa'i sems can de dag dang /
translated: Are those who listen to the Dharma like an illusion or are those sentient beings like a magical creation?🔽Are those who listen to the Dharma like a magical creation?”

original: bshad par bya ba'i chos de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu dang sprul pa lta bu yin nam zhes lha'i bu rnams kyis rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i chos de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu dang sprul pa lta bu yin nam zhes lha'i bu rnams kyis rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: The gods asked Subhūti, “Are those sentient beings who listen to the Dharma and the Dharma that is to be explained like an illusion or like a magical creation?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: lha'i bu de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu de de bzhin no //
translated: “Divine princes, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: Those sentient beings are like an illusion.

original: chos nyan pa de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Those who listen to the Dharma are like an illusion.

original: sems can de dag ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: Those sentient beings are like a magical creation.

original: chos nyan pa de dag ni sprul pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gong du lha'i bu rnams kyis dris pa'i don de lta bu yin no zhes rab 'byor gyis lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag ni sprul pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gong du lha'i bu rnams kyis dris pa'i don de lta bu yin no zhes rab 'byor gyis lan btab pa'o //
translated: This is the answer that Subhūti gives to the question asked by the sons of the gods above.

original: lha'i bu dag sems can de dag ni rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag sems can de dag ni rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: “Sons of the gods, those sentient beings are like a dream.

original: lha'i bu dag sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Sons of the gods, those sentient beings are like an illusion.

original: lha'i bu dag gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Sons of the gods, form is like a dream, like an illusion.🔽Sons of the gods, up to perfect complete awakening is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: lha'i bu dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos ston pa dang / nyan pa dang / bshad par bya ba'i chos rnams 'ba' zhig rmi lam lta bu dang sgyu ma lta bu yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos ston pa dang / nyan pa dang / bshad par bya ba'i chos rnams 'ba' zhig rmi lam lta bu dang sgyu ma lta bu yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the teaching of the Dharma, the listening, and the Dharma to be explained like a dream and like an illusion,

original: phung po lnga la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates, and so on, up to and including perfect complete enlightenment, are all mundane and supramundane dharmas, and they are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then those gods said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur bshad na /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur bshad na /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti, you have explained that even enlightenment is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur bshad dam zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu ba la sogs pa kha cig mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yod par 'dzin pa gsal ba'i phyir dris @288b pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur bshad dam zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu ba la sogs pa kha cig mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yod par 'dzin pa gsal ba'i phyir dris @288b pa'o //
translated: Do you also explain that nirvāṇa is like a dream, like an illusion?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Su­bhūti replied,

original: lha'i bu dag bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur smras te /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur smras te /
translated: “Divine princes, I also explain that even nirvāṇa is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bas na gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod pa na yang de la bdag ni rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur smra'o zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba bshad cing brjod
analyzed: de bas na gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod pa na yang de la bdag ni rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur smra'o zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba bshad cing brjod
translated: This explains and expresses what is called “nirvana.”

original: pa ni kun rdzob tu tha snyad tsam du btags par zad kyi /
analyzed: pa ni kun rdzob tu tha snyad tsam du btags par zad kyi /
translated: It is merely a conventional imputation on the conventional level.

original: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dngos po yod par ma gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dngos po yod par ma gyur te /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, nirvana does not exist as a thing.

original: dngos po med pa las yod pa skad du bshad pa ni rmi lam dang sgyu ma lta bur mngon no zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: dngos po med pa las yod pa skad du bshad pa ni rmi lam dang sgyu ma lta bur mngon no zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: The explanation that it exists from the perspective of nonthings is like a dream and an illusion.🔽This is the meaning.

original: / gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod na yang de la bdag ni rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur smra'o zhes bya ba ni la dor ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: / gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod na yang de la bdag ni rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur smra'o zhes bya ba ni la dor ba'i tshig ste /
translated: If there were any other phenomenon superior to nirvana, I would say that it is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan lta med mod kyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan lta med mod kyi /
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that is superior to nirvana.

original: gal te brgya la de lta bu zhig yod na de yang kun rdzob tu yod par btags su zad kyi /
analyzed: gal te brgya la de lta bu zhig yod na de yang kun rdzob tu yod par btags su zad kyi /
translated: If there were such a thing, it would be no more than a conventional designation.

original: don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas de yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu yin na mya ngan las 'das pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas de yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu yin na mya ngan las 'das pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is not established that things exist ultimately, it is like a dream, like an illusion. What need is there to mention nirvana?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ni 'di ltar rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / mya ngan las 'das pa de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dag yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /🔽don dam par dngos po med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / mya ngan las 'das pa de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dag yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /🔽don dam par dngos po med pa yin te /
translated: It is because a dream, an illusion, and nirvana are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de lta bas na rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gsum char yang /
analyzed: de lta bas na rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gsum char yang /
translated: Therefore, dream, illusion, and nirvāṇa

original: dngos po med par ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med par ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: are all three of the same taste in being unreal, and so they are not differentiated.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa mdzod ldan chen po dang / tsha dang ldan pa k'a ty'a'i bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams gang gi bu dang /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa mdzod ldan chen po dang / tsha dang ldan pa k'a ty'a'i bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams gang gi bu dang /
translated: Then the Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the Venerable Mahākauṣṭhila, the Venerable Mahākātyāyana, the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag du mas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag du mas /
translated: the Venerable Mahākāśyapa, and many thousands of bodhisattvas

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is so profound,

original: 'di ltar blta dka' ba /🔽'di ltar rtogs @289a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar blta dka' ba / 'di ltar rtogs @289a * //
translated: so difficult to see,

original: par dka' ba /
analyzed: par dka' ba /
translated: so difficult to realize,

original: 'di ltar zhi ba /🔽'di ltar gsal ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi ba / 'di ltar gsal ba /
translated: so peaceful,🔽so radiant,

original: 'di ltar phra ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar phra ba /
translated: so subtle,

original: 'di ltar bzang ba 'di la su dag yid ches par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bur ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu zab cing rgya che ba 'di kun rdzob tu su dag yid ches par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzang ba 'di la su dag yid ches par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bur ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu zab cing rgya che ba 'di kun rdzob tu su dag yid ches par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Who will have faith in this good teaching?

original: don dam par su yang yid ches par 'gyur ba med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos chen po dgra bcom pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnams kyis rab 'byor la dris pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par su yang yid ches par 'gyur ba med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos chen po dgra bcom pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnams kyis rab 'byor la dris pa ste /
translated: In order to explain in detail the meaning of this, namely, that no one will have faith in this perfection of wisdom, which is so profound and extensive, which teaches that all dharmas are like a dream and like an illusion, either superficially or ultimately, the noble great disciples, the arhats, and the many bodhisattvas ask Subhuti:🔽This perfection of wisdom is so profound.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu ba blo zhan pa dang / mu stegs can bdag tu lta ba'i rtog pa'i rtsing ge ma rnams kyis blos gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu ba blo zhan pa dang / mu stegs can bdag tu lta ba'i rtog pa'i rtsing ge ma rnams kyis blos gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: It is profound because it is difficult for the minds of those of little intelligence, who belong to the Lesser Vehicle, and of the tirthikas, who are coarse in their speculation about the view of self, to fathom.

original: 'di ltar blta dka' ba zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir blta dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar blta dka' ba zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir blta dka' ba'o //
translated: Thus, difficult to see means difficult to see because it is not the object of the five consciousnesses such as the eye.

original: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs par dka'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs par dka'o //
translated: Thus, difficult to realize means difficult to realize because it is not the object of mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: Thus, peaceful means peaceful because all afflictions and secondary afflictions are pacified.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa la mkhas shing gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa la mkhas shing gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gsal ba'o //
translated: Thus, clear means clear because it is the cause of skill and clarity in realizing all dharmas just as they are.

original: 'di ltar phra ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir phra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar phra ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir phra ba'o //
translated: Thus, subtle means subtle because all conceptual elaborations are pacified.

original: 'di ltar bzang ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir bzang ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bzang ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir bzang ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, good means good because all suffering is completely pacified.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to those great hearers and those bodhisattva great beings:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
translated: Venerable ones, irreversible bodhisattva great beings should be known as those who practice this perfection of wisdom, which is so deep,

original: 'di ltar brtag dka' ba /🔽'di ltar brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtag dka' ba / 'di ltar brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
translated: so difficult to fathom,🔽so difficult to see,

original: 'di ltar phra ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar phra ba /
translated: so subtle,

original: 'di ltar gsal ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba /
translated: so clear,

original: 'di ltar blta dka' ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar blta dka' ba /
translated: so difficult to look at,

original: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba /
translated: so difficult to understand,

original: 'di ltar zhi ba /🔽'di ltar bzang ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi ba / 'di ltar bzang ba /
translated: so peaceful,🔽so good,🔽so exalted,🔽so supreme,

original: @289b 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa /
analyzed: @289b 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa /
translated: so pure,🔽and so beyond all conceptual elaborations.

original: 'di ltar mkhas shing shes pas rig par bya ba 'di la yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'di zab cing rgya che ba de la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhas shing shes pas rig par bya ba 'di la yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'di zab cing rgya che ba de la /
translated: Thus, one will have confidence in this, which is to be known through the wisdom of the wise.🔽

original: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, one will have confidence in this which is to be known through the wisdom of the wise. This shows that the bodhisattvas who are irreversible from the eighth stage will have confidence in this profound and extensive meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: zab pa dang / phra ba dang / gsal ba dang / blta dka' ba dang / rtogs par dka' ba dang / zhi ba dang bzang ba'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zab pa dang / phra ba dang / gsal ba dang / blta dka' ba dang / rtogs par dka' ba dang / zhi ba dang bzang ba'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of profound, subtle, clear, difficult to see, difficult to understand, peaceful, and excellent is as explained above.

original: 'di ltar brtag dka' ba zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir brtag dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar brtag dka' ba zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir brtag dka' ba'o //
translated: As for thus, difficult to investigate, it is difficult to investigate because it is to be known by individual self-realization.

original: 'di ltar brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bsam pas thog tu mi phebs pa'i phyir brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bsam pas thog tu mi phebs pa'i phyir brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: As for thus, not the domain of investigation, it is not the domain of investigation because it is not reached by the mind's thought.

original: 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gnas kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir shin tu 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gnas kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir shin tu 'phags pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is called “extremely exalted” because it is the supreme basis for realizing the supramundane dharmas.

original: 'di ltar mkhas shing shes pas rig par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar 'dzin cing rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhas shing shes pas rig par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar 'dzin cing rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is called “to be known by the wise and the learned” because it is not to be known by those who apprehend signs and are conceptual.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa mkhas shing shes pa rnams kyis thog tu phebs shing rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mkhas shing shes pas rig par bya bya yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa mkhas shing shes pa rnams kyis thog tu phebs shing rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mkhas shing shes pas rig par bya bya yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is to be known by the wise and the learned because it is to be known by the wise and the learned, such as irreversible bodhisattvas, who have arrived at the truth. This is the meaning of “to be known by the wise and the learned.”

original: de lta bur zab cing rgya che ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la yid ches pa med pa ma yin gyi phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams de la yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur zab cing rgya che ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la yid ches pa med pa ma yin gyi phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams de la yid ches par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is not that there is no confidence in that perfection of wisdom which is so profound and vast, but it is taught that irreversible bodhisattvas have confidence in it.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag pa'am /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag pa'am /
translated: Or a person who has seen the truth,

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'am zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos kyi nang na yang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang / 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa /

original: bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa /
translated: whose duties are done,

original: khur bor ba rnams las kyang kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab cing rgya che ba 'di la yid ches par 'gyur ba dag yod do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: khur bor ba rnams las kyang kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab cing rgya che ba 'di la yid ches par 'gyur ba dag yod do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa'i sems can sangs rgyas bye ba mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed bskyed @290a * //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa'i sems can sangs rgyas bye ba mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed bskyed @290a * //
translated: It is said that there are sentient beings who have served the victors of the past, who have repeatedly planted roots of virtue with many tens of millions of buddhas,

original: pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i nang na yang tshe rabs snga ma la sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas shing /
analyzed: pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i nang na yang tshe rabs snga ma la sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas shing /
translated: The phrase “and pure” means that even among ordinary beings there are some who have served many buddhas in their previous lives and have the continuity of listening to the profound and extensive teachings.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i chos nyan pa'i 'phro yod pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab cing rgya che ba 'di la yid ches nas dad cing nyams su len pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: The meaning is that there are also some who, having gained confidence in this profound and extensive perfection of wisdom, have faith in it and practice it.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa gang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i nang nas kha cig sngon gyi sangs rgyas la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i las kyi 'phro med kyang tshe 'di nyid la
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa gang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i nang nas kha cig sngon gyi sangs rgyas la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i las kyi 'phro med kyang tshe 'di nyid la
translated: The phrase “those sons of good family and daughters of good family who are assisted by a spiritual friend” means that even among ordinary beings there are some who, although they do not have the continuity of the roots of virtue that they have generated in relation to previous buddhas, in this very life

translated: The following passage shows that there are those who, by the virtue of relying on a spiritual friend, will have confidence in and practice this perfection of wisdom, which is so profound and hard to investigate:🔽They will not conceive of form as empty,

analyzed: de dag ni gzugs stong zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur /

original: stong pa nyid gzugs zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang bden pa mthong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang so so'i skye bo sngon gyi bsod nams kyi 'phro yod pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang bden pa mthong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang so so'i skye bo sngon gyi bsod nams kyi 'phro yod pa dang /
translated: And so on.

original: so so'i skye bo dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab cing brtag dka' ba la dad cing yid ches par 'gyur ba yang kun rdzob tu dad cing yid ches bar 'gyur du zad kyi
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab cing brtag dka' ba la dad cing yid ches par 'gyur ba yang kun rdzob tu dad cing yid ches bar 'gyur du zad kyi
translated: Those ordinary beings who are guided by spiritual friends will have faith and confidence in this perfection of wisdom, which is so profound and difficult to fathom, but only in a conventional sense.

original: / don dam par ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang la yang dngos por 'dzin cing rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: / don dam par ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang la yang dngos por 'dzin cing rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught that ultimately there is no grasping at or conceptualizing any phenomena such as form as real entities.

original: skabs 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben par rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur la /

translated: In this context, one does not conceptualize the five aggregates such as form as emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, nonarising, noncessation, peace, or seclusion.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa yin par rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /

translated: The five aggregates beginning with form are not imagined to be emptiness and so on, and emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness,

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / dben pa rnams kyang gzugs la sogs pa yin par rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba ni don dam par de dag thams cad dngos po med pa'i @290b phyir ro //🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / dben pa rnams kyang gzugs la sogs pa yin par rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba ni don dam par de dag thams cad dngos po med pa'i @290b phyir ro // gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la /
translated: nonproduction, noncessation, and voidness are not imagined to be the five aggregates beginning with form, because ultimately all of them are unreal.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos bdun dang sbyar te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos bdun dang sbyar te /

original: ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / reg pa las byung ba'i chor ba drug dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / reg pa las byung ba'i chor ba drug dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang /
translated: Just as it was explained, the twelve inner and outer bases beginning with the eye, the six consciousnesses, the six contacts, the six feelings that arise from contact, and the six elements beginning with the earth element,

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang /

translated: the twelve links of dependent origination beginning with ignorance, the six perfections, the eighteen emptinesses, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment such as the four close mindfulnesses,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /

translated: the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial absorptions, the three doors of liberation,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa bco brgyad dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang byang chub dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang /

translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the four fruits such as stream enterer, the awakening of a pratyekabuddha, the knowledge of path aspects, the knowledge of all aspects,

analyzed: de ltar brtag tu mi rung ba'i spyod yul /

original: de ltar phra ba /
analyzed: de ltar phra ba /

analyzed: de ltar gsal ba /

translated: This is to say, since one does not conceptualize any phenomena in this way, one consumes the perfection of wisdom, which is difficult to fathom.

original: de la thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang dran pa phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa'i tshe don dang tshig gnyi ga la thags thogs med pa'o //

translated: The expression unimpeded eloquence means that when one teaches the Dharma with the perfection of wisdom and perfect mindfulness, one is not impeded in either the meaning or the words.

original: rgyun chad pa med pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa'o //🔽mnyam par gzhag pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyams pa med cing 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la g-yeng ba med par chos ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽rigs pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar chos ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa med pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa'o // mnyam par gzhag pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyams pa med cing 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la g-yeng ba med par chos ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o // rigs pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar chos ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The expression uninterrupted eloquence means that one is not interrupted by such things as Mara.🔽The expression composed eloquence means that one has eloquence in teaching the Dharma without loss of mindfulness and without distraction by such things as passion.🔽The expression logical eloquence means that one has eloquence in teaching the Dharma without contradicting valid cognition.

original: 'brel pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang mi 'gal zhing don dang tshig snga phyi 'brel bar chos ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang mi 'gal zhing don dang tshig snga phyi 'brel bar chos ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The expression relevant eloquence means that one has eloquence in teaching the Dharma without contradicting the scriptures and with a relevant meaning and sequence of words.

original: don dang ldan pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur @292a * //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur @292a * //
translated: Meaningful eloquence is the attainment of the result of the noble path.🔽

original: ba'i don dang ldan par chos ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i don dang ldan par chos ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one called eloquence endowed with meaning is the eloquence endowed with the teaching of the Dharma endowed with the meaning that will attain the fruit of the noble path.

original: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam las 'phags shing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam khyad par can ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam las 'phags shing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam khyad par can ston pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one called eloquence that is exalted and distinguished above all worlds is the eloquence endowed with the teaching of the special supramundane path that is exalted above the mundane path.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin no ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin no ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is so, it is just as you say. In this perfection of wisdom, the three vehicles—the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,

analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa'i spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /

original: sh'a ri'i bus gong du dris pa'i chos de dag thams cad rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas chos de dag gzhung las bshad pa ni bden na kun  rdzob  tu bstan pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni chos de dag thams cad dmigs su med de
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gong du dris pa'i chos de dag thams cad rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas chos de dag gzhung las bshad pa ni bden na kun  rdzob  tu bstan pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni chos de dag thams cad dmigs su med de
translated: Up to this point, Subhūti has repeated all the dharmas that Śāriputra asked about above. The explanation in the text is true, but it is merely taught conventionally. Ultimately, all those dharmas are unobservable.

original: / de ltar don dam par dmigs su med pa las kun rdzob tu sgro btags te bshad pa ni yang dag par brjod pa'am bshad pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //

original: gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis she na /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis she na /

translated: For the sake of benefiting bodhisattvas, the teachings of the Dharma from the first level up to the tenth level are revealed, the Dharma of the bodhisattva path from the six perfections up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par rtse ba dang / rdzus te skye bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su nyams pa med pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong ba dang /

translated: The qualities of the bodhisattvas are revealed, their higher perceptions, their play with their magical powers, their being reborn miraculously, their being endowed with the qualities of never losing their higher perceptions, their going from buddhafield to buddhafield,

original: rtag tu sems mnyam par gzhag pa dang / spobs pa thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dag nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa bco brgyad re re dang sbyar te /

analyzed: de ltar stong pa'i phyir chos de dag mi @293a * //
translated: In this way, because they are empty, those dharmas are taught by way of nonapprehending.

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan to zhes mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'o //

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /

analyzed: de la bdag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: mngon par gtor bar bya'o //

analyzed: gtor bar bya'o //

analyzed: rab tu gtor bar bya'o zhes lan gsum smos pa ni dad pa'i shugs kyis me tog lan gsum du bzlas te gtor bar bstan pa'o //
translated: They should scatter it well. The repetition three times indicates that the flowers should be scattered three times with the force of faith.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams kyis de ltar sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu lha rdzas kyi me tog man d'a ra ba mang po mngon par sprul te mchod pa byas pa bstan pa ste /🔽de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pa skyes nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa dang / nyan pa la mchod pa bya ba bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi skye bo rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams kyis de ltar sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu lha rdzas kyi me tog man d'a ra ba mang po mngon par sprul te mchod pa byas pa bstan pa ste / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pa skyes nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa dang / nyan pa la mchod pa bya ba bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi skye bo rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Then, the lord of the gods, Indra, and the gods of the Catur­maharajakayika realm of the great trichiliocosm, etc., indicate that after generating the Thought in that way, the lord of the gods, Indra, and the gods of the desire realm and the form realm emanated many divine flowers and made offerings.🔽Thus, after generating faith in the perfection of wisdom, it is taught that one should make offerings to the teacher of the perfection of wisdom and to the listener, and in order to cause beings of the future to generate the perfection of wisdom

original: de ston cing nyan @293b pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ston cing nyan @293b pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and to make offerings and service to the teacher and listener,

original: me tog de dag gis gtor ma thag tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di gzhi me tog gis khengs par gyur nas /🔽steng gi bar snang la yang me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam mdangs dga' zhing yid du 'ong ba kun nas gnas par gyur to zhes bya ba ni de ltar lha rnams dad pa skyes nas me tog
analyzed: me tog de dag gis gtor ma thag tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di gzhi me tog gis khengs par gyur nas / steng gi bar snang la yang me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam mdangs dga' zhing yid du 'ong ba kun nas gnas par gyur to zhes bya ba ni de ltar lha rnams dad pa skyes nas me tog
translated: As soon as they had scattered the flowers, this great trichiliocosm was covered with flowers.🔽And in the sky above there appeared a delightful and beautiful flower mansion the size of this great trichiliocosm.🔽This shows that the gods, having given rise to faith, offered emanated flowers.

original: sprul pa phul ba sems la sgyu med cing bsam pa dag pas phul ba'i rtags su stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzhi me tog gis khengs par gyur pa dang / steng ge bar snang la me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du gyur par bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyi rlabs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa phul ba sems la sgyu med cing bsam pa dag pas phul ba'i rtags su stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzhi me tog gis khengs par gyur pa dang / steng ge bar snang la me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du gyur par bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyi rlabs bstan pa ste /
translated: The sign of their offering with an undeceiving and pure intention was that the Blessed One manifested the great trichiliocosm being covered with flowers and a flower mansion in the sky above the size of this great trichiliocosm.

original: da ltar bstan pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de ston pa dang nyan pa la mchod pa byas pa don med par mi 'gyur ba'i rtags bstan pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar bstan pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de ston pa dang nyan pa la mchod pa byas pa don med par mi 'gyur ba'i rtags bstan pa'o //
translated: The present teaching is also the perfection of wisdom, and the worship of the teacher and the listener is not meaningless.🔽Then the elder Subhuti thought thus, etc.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di snyam du sems par gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar lha rnams kyis mngon par sprul pa'i me tog de rnams de ltar rgya che zhing grangs mang la bzang ba 'jig rten na yod pa mi srid de
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di snyam du sems par gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar lha rnams kyis mngon par sprul pa'i me tog de rnams de ltar rgya che zhing grangs mang la bzang ba 'jig rten na yod pa mi srid de
translated: The thought of Subhuti, etc., is as follows: Those flowers manifested by the gods are so vast in number and good that they are not possible in the world.

original: / me tog de dag ldum bu las skyes pa'am chu dang thang las skyes pa ni ma yin gyi sprul pa ste /
analyzed: / me tog de dag ldum bu las skyes pa'am chu dang thang las skyes pa ni ma yin gyi sprul pa ste /
translated: Those flowers are not born from bushes or born from water or land, but are emanations.

original: yid las byung ba yin no snyam du sems par gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yid las byung ba yin no snyam du sems par gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: They are mental creations.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then the lord of the gods, Sakra,

original: gnas brtan 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gnas brtan 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to the elder Subhuti:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor me tog 'di dag ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor me tog 'di dag ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Venerable Subhuti, these flowers are not real,

original: me tog 'di dag yid las byung ba ma yin no //🔽ldum bu las byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis me tog 'di dag bzang la dkon pa bsngags pa'i phyir sprul pa ste /
analyzed: me tog 'di dag yid las byung ba ma yin no // ldum bu las byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis me tog 'di dag bzang la dkon pa bsngags pa'i phyir sprul pa ste /
translated: They are not born from a plant.

original: yid las byung ba yin par bsngags pa brgya byin gyis don dam pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yid las byung ba yin par bsngags pa brgya byin gyis don dam pa dang sbyar te /
translated: This is because Subhūti previously praised the beauty and rarity of these flowers, so Śakra, in order to praise them as being mind-made, applied the ultimate truth to them,

original: me tog de dag ni yang dag par ma byung bas yid las byung ba yang ma yin na ldum bu las byung ba ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: me tog de dag ni yang dag par ma byung bas yid las byung ba yang ma yin na ldum bu las byung ba ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: teaching that “those flowers are not even mind-made, since they are not real, so what need is there to mention that they are not born from a plant?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka de skad du me tog 'di dag ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de skad du me tog 'di dag ma skyes pa ste /
translated: “Kauśika, you say that these flowers are unborn,

original: me tog 'di dag yid las byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: me tog 'di dag yid las byung ba ma yin /
translated: that these flowers are not mind-made,

original: ldum bu las byung ba ma yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ldum bu las byung ba ma yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: and that they are not born from a plant.

original: koo shi ka @294a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka @294a * //
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar ma skyes pa ni me tog kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyis don dam par me tog de dag ma skyes bar bstan pas kyang lhag par za'  ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma skyes pa ni me tog kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyis don dam par me tog de dag ma skyes bar bstan pas kyang lhag par za'  ba bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, what is not produced is not a flower means that even by demonstrating that those flowers are not produced ultimately, Indra demonstrates the superiority of the gift.

original: de ltar ma skyes pa yin na ma skyes pa ni dngos po med pa yin pas me tog kyang ma yin pa zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma skyes pa yin na ma skyes pa ni dngos po med pa yin pas me tog kyang ma yin pa zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If they are not produced in that way, since what is not produced is a non-entity, he demonstrates that they are not even a flower.

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Indra said:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor me tog 'di dag nyi tshe ma byung bar zad dam /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor me tog 'di dag nyi tshe ma byung bar zad dam /
translated: Venerable Subhuti, are only these flowers non-arisen,

original: 'on tam gzugs kyang ma byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ma byung zhing dngos po med par bstan pa'i gleng bslang pa'i phyir de skad ces dris pa'o //
analyzed: 'on tam gzugs kyang ma byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ma byung zhing dngos po med par bstan pa'i gleng bslang pa'i phyir de skad ces dris pa'o //
translated: or is form also non-arisen? and so on. He asked this in order to initiate the teaching that all phenomena such as form are non-arisen and non-entities.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhuti said:

original: koo shi ka 'di dag nyi tshe ma byung bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di dag nyi tshe ma byung bar ma zad kyi /
translated: Kausika, not only are these non-arisen,

original: koo shi ka gzugs kyang ma byung ba ste gang ma byung ba de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas de bzhin gshegs pa la thug gi bar gyi chos ming gis smos pa de dag thams🔽cad kyang don dam par ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs kyang ma byung ba ste gang ma byung ba de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas de bzhin gshegs pa la thug gi bar gyi chos ming gis smos pa de dag thams cad kyang don dam par ma byung ba ste /
translated: This and so forth teaches that all phenomena from the five aggregates of form and so on up to the tathāgatas, which are mentioned by name, are ultimately non-arisen.

original: ma byung ba gang yin pa de ni don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba gang yin pa de ni don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: What is non-arisen is not the nature of phenomena such as form in the ultimate.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, thought this:

original: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di de ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal /
analyzed: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di de ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal /
translated: “Oh! The elder Subhūti does not contradict designations🔽and teaches the intrinsic nature. He is said to have profound wisdom.”

original: chos nyid kyang ston pa de ni shes rab zab po zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes par bstan nas /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston pa de ni shes rab zab po zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes par bstan nas /
translated: This is because above, Subhūti taught that all phenomena are non-arisen and unborn.

original: ma byung ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don brgya byin gyis rtogs nas rab 'byor de ltar shes rab zab pa ngo mtshar du gyur ba bstan pa ste /🔽btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
analyzed: ma byung ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don brgya byin gyis rtogs nas rab 'byor de ltar shes rab zab pa ngo mtshar du gyur ba bstan pa ste / btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
translated: He taught the profundity of wisdom, which is amazing.🔽He taught without contradicting designations and also taught reality.

original: chos nyid kyang ston zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang yang mi 'gal bar ston la /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang yang mi 'gal bar ston la /
translated: He taught without contradicting the characteristics of all phenomena in the conventional,

original: don dam par chos de dag ma byung ma skyes shing dngos po med par bstan pa ni chos nyid kyang ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos de dag ma byung ma skyes shing dngos po med par bstan pa ni chos nyid kyang ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and he taught that ultimately those phenomena are not arisen, not born, and are not entities. This is called “he taught reality.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to Śatakratu, Lord of the Gods,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “It is just so.

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: Kauśika, it is just so.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa ste /
translated: This elder Subhūti is endowed with profound wisdom.🔽He teaches without contradicting designations

original: de ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
analyzed: de ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
translated: and also teaches reality.

original: chos nyid kyang ston to zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyis bsam pa'i don de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //🔽de nas lha'i @294b dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston to zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyis bsam pa'i don de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o // de nas lha'i @294b dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He also teaches the Dharma-nature means that the Blessed One said, The meaning that Śatakratu is thinking is true.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
translated: Then Śatakratu, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, how is it that this elder Subhūti does not contradict designations,

original: chos nyid kyang ston pa lags zhes bya ba ni btags pa dang yang me 'gal la chos nyid kyang ston pa'i don 'khor thams cad kyis shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston pa lags zhes bya ba ni btags pa dang yang me 'gal la chos nyid kyang ston pa'i don 'khor thams cad kyis shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and also teaches the Dharma-nature? means that in order to make the entire assembly understand the meaning of not contradicting designations and also teaching the Dharma-nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'o //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'o // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: he asked the Blessed One.

original: koo shi ka gzugs ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: Having said that, the Blessed One said to Śatakratu, Lord of the Gods, Kauśika, form is merely a designation.

original: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid de /
translated: What is merely a designation is the Dharma-nature.

original: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad kun rdzob tu tha snyad du btags pa tsam du zad la /
analyzed: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad kun rdzob tu tha snyad du btags pa tsam du zad la /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: All phenomena, from the five aggregates up to the perfect buddhas, are merely nominally imputed in the conventional sense.

original: tha snyad tsam du btags pa gang yin pa de don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad tsam du btags pa gang yin pa de don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is merely nominally imputed does not ultimately exist as a thing.

original: de ltar don dam par dngos pa med pa de nyid chos rnams kyi chos nyid yin pas yang dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar don dam par dngos pa med pa de nyid chos rnams kyi chos nyid yin pas yang dag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since that very nonexistence of a thing ultimately is the reality of phenomena, it is the real.

original: de lta bu'i yang dag pa nyid dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yang dag pa nyid dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “taught without contradicting such reality” is “taught without superimposition or denigration.”

original: koo shi ka de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Kauśika, why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni mi 'gal rnam par mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni dngos po zhig yod na ni dngos po de gnyis mtshan nyid mi mthun pas phan tshun du 'gal ba yang srid na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni mi 'gal rnam par mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni dngos po zhig yod na ni dngos po de gnyis mtshan nyid mi mthun pas phan tshun du 'gal ba yang srid na /
translated: This teaches that if there were an existent thing, then because those two things would have incompatible characteristics, it would be possible that they would be mutually contradictory.

original: don dam par chos de dag dngos po med par ro gcig pas phan tshun du 'gal ba dang rnam par 'gal ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos de dag dngos po med par ro gcig pas phan tshun du 'gal ba dang rnam par 'gal ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But ultimately, because those phenomena are of one taste in being unreal, they are not mutually contradictory or non-contradictory.🔽Whatever is not contradictory and is not non-contradictory, that is taught by the elder Subhūti, and there is no contradiction.

original: gang mi 'gal rnam par mi 'gal ba de gnas brtan 'byor gyis bstan te 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis phan tshun mi 'gal bar chos bstan pa dang / don dam par yang 'gal ba'i dngos po med do zhes bstan pa'o //🔽koo shi ka de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni btags pa dang yang 'gal bar mi byed la /
analyzed: gang mi 'gal rnam par mi 'gal ba de gnas brtan 'byor gyis bstan te 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis phan tshun mi 'gal bar chos bstan pa dang / don dam par yang 'gal ba'i dngos po med do zhes bstan pa'o //🔽koo shi ka de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni btags pa dang yang 'gal bar mi byed la /
translated: This teaches that the elder Subhūti teaches the Dharma in such a way that the conventional and the ultimate are not mutually contradictory, and that ultimately there are no things that are contradictory.

original: chos nyid kyang ston to zhes bya ba ni de ltar rab 'byor gyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis kyi tshul 'gal ba med par bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //🔽de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @295a * //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston to zhes bya ba ni de ltar rab 'byor gyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis kyi tshul 'gal ba med par bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o // de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @295a * //
translated: And the reality of phenomena is also taught means that in this way Subhūti has explained the non-contradiction of the two modes of the conventional and the ultimate, and the meaning of that is summarized and taught.🔽Thus, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva abide in the perfection of wisdom?

original: chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya zhes dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya zhes dris pa'i lan du /
translated: In response to this question,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya ba nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya ba nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin pa bstan nas /
translated: it is taught that the very non-abiding in all phenomena such as form by way of non-apprehending is the abiding in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bya zhes dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bya zhes dris pa'i lan du /
translated: After that, in response to the question How should one train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bya ba'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bya ba'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain in detail the meaning of how to train in the perfection of wisdom,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: then the venerable Subhūti,

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te /🔽koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te / koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord of the Gods, Sakra, said to him, It is so, Subhuti, it is so.🔽Kausika, it is just as you have said.

analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang de ltar chos thams cad btags pa tsam du rig par bya ste /

translated: It means that ultimately all phenomena are non-existent, and conventionally they are mere designations in the world.

original: de dag la dngos por mi lta zhing ma chags par byas la /
analyzed: de dag la dngos por mi lta zhing ma chags par byas la /
translated: One should know this and not view them as real entities, and not be attached.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that one should train in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni gzugs la mi slob ste /
translated: Kauśika, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who trains like this does not train in form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because he does not see that form in which he should train.

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i gzugs de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs @295b pa ni de ltar chos thams cad btags pa tsam du rig par byas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa'i

translated: This and so on teaches that having understood in that way that all phenomena are mere imputations, the bodhisattva who trains in the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' des gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med par rtogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med par rtogs te /
translated: realizes that all phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are ultimately non-existent.

original: dngos po yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag la dngos por 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis mi slob pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag la dngos por 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis mi slob pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because he does not see them as real entities, he does not train in those phenomena such as form by way of grasping them as real entities. This is the teaching that it is the training in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ci'i phyir na gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du ci'i phyir yang dag par
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so // btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ci'i phyir na gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du ci'i phyir yang dag par
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the elder Subhūti,🔽“Venerable monk Subhūti, why do bodhisattva great beings not see form, and so on?”

original: rjes su mi mthong ba'i gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mi mthong ba'i gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
translated: This is a question about the reasons why they do not see form, and so on, up to “why do they not see the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par chos de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir yang dag
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa / koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par chos de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir yang dag
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“Kauśika, it is because form is empty of form, and so on.

original: par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that ultimately, phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are not seen because those phenomena are empty of their own intrinsic reality.

original: koo shi ka gzugs stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa mthong bar bya ba dang / mthong bar byed pa gnyi ga rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //🔽koo shi ka de ltar gang stong pa nyid 'di la mi slob pa de ni stong pa nyid gnyis su med pas stong pa nyid la slob ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa mthong bar bya ba dang / mthong bar byed pa gnyi ga rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o // koo shi ka de ltar gang stong pa nyid 'di la mi slob pa de ni stong pa nyid gnyis su med pas stong pa nyid la slob ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: “Kauśika, the emptiness of form does not see the emptiness of form” and so forth teaches that because both the seeing of form and so on and the seer are empty of essence, they do not see.🔽“Kauśika, thus, one who does not train in this emptiness trains in emptiness, because emptiness is nondual” teaches that all phenomena such as form have the nature of emptiness.

original: don dam par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas dngos por 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis mi slob pa nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la slob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas dngos por 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis mi slob pa nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la slob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because they do not see them ultimately, they do not train in them by way of grasping things. This is the training in the emptiness that is the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: de gnyis su byar med par gzugs stong pa nyid la slob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag la mtshan ma dang / dngos po yod par lta zhing mi slob pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid la slob pa yin no zhes bstan @296a * //
analyzed: de gnyis su byar med par gzugs stong pa nyid la slob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag la mtshan ma dang / dngos po yod par lta zhing mi slob pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid la slob pa yin no zhes bstan @296a * //
translated: The passage beginning “They train in the emptiness of form” and so on teaches that those who do not train in the emptiness of form and so on, who view those phenomena from form up to omniscience as having signs and as real entities, are not training.

original: pa'o // koo shi ka gzugs stong pa nyid la gang gnyis su byar med par slob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams stong pa nyid la gnyis su med
analyzed: pa'o // koo shi ka gzugs stong pa nyid la gang gnyis su byar med par slob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams stong pa nyid la gnyis su med
translated: The passage beginning “Kauśika, those who train in the emptiness of form without making it dual” and so on teaches that those who train in the emptiness of form and so on without making it dual up to omniscience are training in the perfection of wisdom.

original: par slob pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la gnyis su byar med cing 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas slob pa yin
analyzed: par slob pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la gnyis su byar med cing 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas slob pa yin
translated: That which is training in the perfection of wisdom is training in all the phenomena of purification, from the six perfections up to omniscience, without making any distinctions, and with the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gnyis su byar med par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gang slob pa dang zhes bya ba nas /🔽de ni gnyis su byar med par sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med tshad med pa la slob bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la
analyzed: gnyis su byar med par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gang slob pa dang zhes bya ba nas / de ni gnyis su byar med par sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med tshad med pa la slob bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la
translated: That which is training in the perfection of giving without making any distinctions, up to🔽that which is training in the perfection of wisdom without making any distinctions, up to

analyzed: / gnyis su byar med par slob pa gang yin pa de'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: that which is training in the immeasurable and innumerable qualities of a Buddha without making any distinctions, is the explanation of the benefits of that training in all phenomena, from the six perfections up to omniscience, without making any distinctions.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams la de ltar gnyis su byar med par bslabs na de las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po tshad med grangs med pa rnams la yang bslab par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams la de ltar gnyis su byar med par bslabs na de las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po tshad med grangs med pa rnams la yang bslab par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: If one trains in that way, without making a duality in the dharmas of generosity and so on that are mentioned by name, one will train in the immeasurable, innumerable, vast dharmas of the Buddha, other than those.

original: chos rgya chen po de dag rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos rgya chen po de dag rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one will realize those vast dharmas.🔽One who trains in the immeasurable, innumerable dharmas of the Buddha without making a duality does not train in order to increase or decrease form, and so on.

original: gnyis su byar med par sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med grangs med pa la gang slob pa de ni gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po tshad med grangs med pa la gnyis su byar med par slob pa gang yin pa des ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig
analyzed: gnyis su byar med par sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med grangs med pa la gang slob pa de ni gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po tshad med grangs med pa la gnyis su byar med par slob pa gang yin pa des ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig
translated: One who trains in that way, without making a duality in the immeasurable, innumerable, vast dharmas of the Buddha, does not train in order to increase or decrease form, and so on.

original: cing / gnyis su dbyer med par rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la yang dkar po'i phyogs 'phel bar bya ba dang / nag po'i phyogs 'grib par bya ba'i phyir dngos por dmigs shing mi slob bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: cing / gnyis su dbyer med par rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la yang dkar po'i phyogs 'phel bar bya ba dang / nag po'i phyogs 'grib par bya ba'i phyir dngos por dmigs shing mi slob bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and the two are not divided, and so he does not train in the objective genitive, in order to increase the bright side and decrease the dark side, of all dharmas up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ltar na gang gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob pa dang zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams yongs su gzung ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad 'phel ba dang / @296b 'grib pa med par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad blang dor med par rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams las bzang po rnams ni yongs su gzung zhing blang ba
translated: “Up to the knowledge of all aspects, one does not train in order to take up or to abandon phenomena.”🔽This teaches that the realization that all phenomena are neither increased nor decreased is the realization that all phenomena are without acceptance or rejection.

analyzed: dang / ngan pa rnams spang zhing med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one does not train in order to take up the good and to abandon the bad among phenomena, from form up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni 'di ltar gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni 'di ltar gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med de /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is like this: there is no grasping of form.🔽Because of the emptiness of external and internal phenomena, form does not grasp form.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob pa'i gtan tshigs rab 'byor gyis bshad pa ste /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob pa'i gtan tshigs rab 'byor gyis bshad pa ste /
translated: And so on up to:

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug @297a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug @297a * //
translated: Because of the emptiness of external and internal phenomena, omniscience does not grasp omniscience.

original: gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par phyi nang gnyis ka rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par phyi nang gnyis ka rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: All these phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are ultimately empty of both the internal and the external.

original: gzung ba'i rang bzhin kyang med la /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rang bzhin kyang med la /
translated: They do not have the nature of being apprehended,

original: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin kyang med pas yongs su gzung ba dang med par bya ba'i phyir de ltar mi slob bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin kyang med pas yongs su gzung ba dang med par bya ba'i phyir de ltar mi slob bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and they do not have the nature of apprehending. Therefore, they are not trained in for the sake of being apprehended or for the sake of being released.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, in this way, bodhisattva great beings emerge in the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending any phenomena at all.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because all phenomena are empty of inherent nature,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par rtogs pas chos gang la yang mtshan mas mi 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'dzin pa med pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par rtogs pas chos gang la yang mtshan mas mi 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'dzin pa med pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefit of non-apprehension is taught: “The bodhisattva who, by realizing the absence of apprehended object and apprehending subject, does not apprehend any dharma with signs, will attain the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
translated: Śāriputra then asks: “Venerable Subhūti, is it the case that the bodhisattva great being who trains in that way trains in the perfection of wisdom and will emerge into the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba yin nam zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes 'dzin pa med pa'i phan yon bstan pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba yin nam zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes 'dzin pa med pa'i phan yon bstan pa /
translated: This is a question by Śāriputra asking whether it is the case that the benefit of non-apprehension taught by Subhūti above, “will emerge into the knowledge of all aspects,”

original: 'khor rnams bstan pa 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir de ltar yin nam zhes sh'a ri'i bus dris pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnams bstan pa 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir de ltar yin nam zhes sh'a ri'i bus dris pa'o //
translated: is in order to cause the retinue to take up the teaching.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replies:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
