translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, bodhisattva great beings who train in that way train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom,🔽and they will attain omniscience through the method of not apprehending any phenomena.”

original: chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba yin nam zhes dris pa'i
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba yin nam zhes dris pa'i
translated: This is the answer to Śāriputra’s question, “Are bodhisattvas who train in that way attaining omniscience?”

original: lan du / de ltar slob pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan du / de ltar slob pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Those who train in that way will attain omniscience.

original: de yang mtshan mar yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis ni ma yin pa zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mtshan mar yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis ni ma yin pa zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: However, they do not do so through the method of apprehending signs.”

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba dang med par bya ba med pa'i phyir bslabs shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba dang med par bya ba med pa'i phyir bslabs shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, how will bodhisattva great beings who train like that emerge into the state of omniscience, since all phenomena are not to be grasped and cannot be made nonexistent?”

original: bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med par bslabs pa'i phan yon @297b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba de thabs ji ltar 'gyur zhes gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med par bslabs pa'i phan yon @297b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba de thabs ji ltar 'gyur zhes gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
translated: This is a question about the reason: “How will the benefit of training in all phenomena without grasping or fixation come about, and how will the state of omniscience be attained?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, here bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs kyi skye ba mi mthong 'gag pa mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba mi mthong 'gag pa mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement “one does not see the arising of form, one does not see the cessation of form” and so on, teaches the reason for the occurrence of the knowledge of all things.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas /
translated: Since all phenomena such as form and so on are ultimately unreal,

original: dngos po med pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / sogs pa dang / bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba yang med pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa yod par mi lta zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / sogs pa dang / bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba yang med pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa yod par mi lta zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
translated: one does not see the existence of arising and cessation, taking up and putting down, defilement and purification, and so on, increase and decrease, in the unreal. One does not grasp at signs.

original: de dag gang la yang ma chags pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o//
analyzed: de dag gang la yang ma chags pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o//
translated: Because one is not attached to any of them, one will occur as the knowledge of all things.

original: de la gzugs kyi skye ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs dngos po med pas skye ba yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi skye ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs dngos po med pas skye ba yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one does not see the arising of form means that, ultimately, form does not exist as a thing and, therefore, its arising is also impossible.

original: 'gag pa mi mthong zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas 'gag pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa mi mthong zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas 'gag pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one does not see its cessation means that, since there is no arising, there is also no cessation.

original: blang ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs kyi dngos po med pas blang ba'am thob par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blang ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs kyi dngos po med pas blang ba'am thob par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one does not see it as something to be taken up means that, ultimately, form does not exist as a thing and, therefore, it is not something that can be taken up or obtained.

original: dor ba mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar blang ba med pas blang ba'i zlas 'grub pa'i dor ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dor ba mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar blang ba med pas blang ba'i zlas 'grub pa'i dor ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one does not see it as something to be put down means that, since there is no taking up, there is also no putting down, which is established in relation to taking up.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mthong zhes bya ba ni de ltar dor ba med pas skyon dang bcas pa'i dngos po kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin can spang bar bya ba med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mthong zhes bya ba ni de ltar dor ba med pas skyon dang bcas pa'i dngos po kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin can spang bar bya ba med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The phrase one does not see it as afflicted means that, since there is no putting down, there is also no abandonment of a thing that has the nature of being afflicted and that possesses faults.

original: rnam par byang ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas de'i zlas 'grub pa'i rnam par byang ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas de'i zlas 'grub pa'i rnam par byang ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not see purification” means that, since there is no defilement in this way, there is also no purification, which is the opposite of that.

original: sogs pa mi mthong zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs kyi dngos po med pas rdul phra rab la sogs pa bsags shing brtsegs pa las phung por 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa mi mthong zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs kyi dngos po med pas rdul phra rab la sogs pa bsags shing brtsegs pa las phung por 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not see accumulation” means that, since form does not exist ultimately, there is no aggregation or collection of atoms, etc.

original: 'bri ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni de ltar sogs pa med pas de'i zlas 'grub pa'i 'bri ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bri ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni de ltar sogs pa med pas de'i zlas 'grub pa'i 'bri ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not see diminution” means that, since there is no accumulation in this way, there is also no diminution, which is the opposite of that.

original: 'grib pa mi mthong zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gzugs kyi dngos po med pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis yon tan la sogs pa 'grib cing @298a * //
analyzed: 'grib pa mi mthong zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gzugs kyi dngos po med pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis yon tan la sogs pa 'grib cing @298a * //
translated: “He does not see decrease” means that, since there is no form that has the nature of defilement, there is no decrease or diminution of qualities, etc.

original: nyams par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: due to the power of defilement.

original: 'phel ba mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par byang ba'i dngos po med pas yon tan la sogs pa 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel ba mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par byang ba'i dngos po med pas yon tan la sogs pa 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One does not see an increase” means that ultimately, since there is no entity of purification, there is also no increase and expansion of qualities and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: “Form is not form’s own nature; it is not apprehended.” This teaches the reason for the nonexistence of the origination and cessation of form and so on.

original: don dam par gzugs kyi rang bzhin med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par gzugs kyi rang bzhin med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that ultimately form does not exist and is not apprehended, because form does not exist and is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply this to feeling and so on up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /🔽rnam par byang ba med pa dang / sogs pa med pa dang / 'bri ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med pa'i phyir mi slob mi 'byung ba'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni gong du chos kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa mi mthong
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / sogs pa med pa dang / 'bri ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med pa'i phyir mi slob mi 'byung ba'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni gong du chos kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa mi mthong
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, it is in this way that great bodhisattva beings, without training and without arising, train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom and attain omniscience, because all phenomena are non-arising, unceasing, unapprehended, unabandoned, uncontaminated,🔽unpurified, neither increased nor decreased, and so on.”

original: zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage is a concluding summary of the explanation that if one does not see the arising and cessation of phenomena and so on, and does not apprehend them as signs, one will attain omniscience.

original: de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis med cing /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis med cing /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are essentially nonexistent.

original: mi dmigs pa'i chos de dag skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i chos de dag skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
translated: Those phenomena, which are not perceived, are understood to be without arising, without ceasing, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang don dam par bslabs pa dang / 'byung ba gnyi ga mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang don dam par bslabs pa dang / 'byung ba gnyi ga mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that they are trained in the perfection of wisdom and will emerge in omniscience, both the training and the emergence being in terms of the ultimate, and in terms of the non-apprehension of both.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang nas btsal bar bya zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang nas btsal bar bya zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, where should bodhisattva great beings seek the perfection of wisdom?”

original: nyid du 'byung ngo zhes gong du bshad pa'i don brgya byin gyis rtogs na de ltar @298b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bu gang nas btsal bar bya zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: nyid du 'byung ngo zhes gong du bshad pa'i don brgya byin gyis rtogs na de ltar @298b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bu gang nas btsal bar bya zhes dris pa'o //
translated: If Śakra understands the meaning explained above, “it arises from itself,” then he asks, “Where should one search for that perfection of wisdom by which one would attain omniscience in that way?”

original: sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāradvatīputra said,

original: lha'i dbang po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: “Devendra, the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: should be sought in the chapter of Subhūti.”

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bring du bshad pa thams cad la rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bring du bshad pa thams cad la rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: The chapter of Subhūti is called the chapter of Subhūti because it is the entire explanation of the middle-length perfection of wisdom.

original: gong du rab 'byor gyi le'u de las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bshad pa'i phyir rab 'byor gyi le'u de las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa btsal bar bya'o zhes
analyzed: gong du rab 'byor gyi le'u de las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bshad pa'i phyir rab 'byor gyi le'u de las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa btsal bar bya'o zhes
translated: In the above, the chapter of Subhūti is to be sought for the explanation of the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom which leads to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.

original: bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ni der brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ni der brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be investigated there.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor 'phags pa sha ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad du /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor 'phags pa sha ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad du /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, the noble son Śāradvatīputra has said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes smras te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes smras te /
translated: ‘The perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is to be sought in the chapter of Subhūti.’

original: de ni khyod kyi mthu'o //
analyzed: de ni khyod kyi mthu'o //
translated: That is your power.

original: khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes smras pa de /
analyzed: khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes smras pa de /
translated: The words it is your blessing mean that Shariputra said, The perfection of wisdom should be sought in the chapter of Subhuti's perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bring du bshad pa'i don /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bring du bshad pa'i don /
translated: The meaning of the medium explanation of the perfection of wisdom by Subhuti,

original: sh'a ri'i bus rtogs nas khungs der bstan pa ni rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don sh'a ri'i bu la legs par bshad pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis sh'a ri'i bus de skad smras so zhes rab 'byor la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus rtogs nas khungs der bstan pa ni rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don sh'a ri'i bu la legs par bshad pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis sh'a ri'i bus de skad smras so zhes rab 'byor la bstod pa'o //
translated: was realized by Shariputra. The teaching in that source is the praise of Subhuti, saying that Shariputra spoke those words by the power and blessing of Subhuti's good explanation of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom to Shariputra.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhuti said,

original: koo shi ka de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: Kausika, that is the power of the Tathagata.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bshad pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bshad pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the blessing of the Tathagata means that the explanation of the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom is also explained by the power and blessing of the Tathagata.

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor chos thams cad byin gyi rlabs med na /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor chos thams cad byin gyi rlabs med na /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, if all phenomena are without blessing,

original: ci'i phyir de skad du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: why do you say, This is the power of the Tathāgata,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs so @299a * //🔽zhes smras zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs so @299a * // zhes smras zhes bya ba la /
translated: this is the blessing of the Tathāgata?

original: mthu dang byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na de'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis chos bshad pa la sogs pa 'byung na /
analyzed: mthu dang byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na de'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis chos bshad pa la sogs pa 'byung na /
translated: Here, power and blessing refer to the arising of explanations of the Dharma, etc. through the power and blessing of that [power] if some entity exists.

original: chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med cing /
translated: However, all phenomena are ultimately without entity,

original: byin gyi rlabs kyang dngos po med na ci'i phyir de skad smra zhes brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la smras pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyang dngos po med na ci'i phyir de skad smra zhes brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la smras pa'o //
translated: Śatakratu then asks, “If there is no transformation, why do you say that?”

original: byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi dmigs la zhes bya ba ni don dam par byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gnyi ga yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi dmigs la zhes bya ba ni don dam par byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gnyi ga yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The passage that begins with “Kauśika, apart from the reality that is devoid of transformation, the Tathāgata is not apprehended as existing” and concludes with “apart from the Tathāgata, the reality that is devoid of transformation is not apprehended as existing” teaches that ultimately the reality that is devoid of transformation and the Tathāgata are both empty and are of a single nature.

original: de bzhin nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par chos thams cad tha dad du dbyer med pa nyid de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par chos thams cad tha dad du dbyer med pa nyid de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The passage that begins with “apart from suchness, the Tathāgata is not apprehended as existing” and concludes with “apart from the Tathāgata, suchness is not apprehended as existing” teaches that ultimately all phenomena are of a single nature, which is the nature of suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is also of the nature of suchness.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: Kauśika, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa mi dmigs la /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa mi dmigs la /
translated: It is just so.🔽Apart from the reality of non-metamorphosis, the Tathagata is not perceived.

original: de bzhin nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: Apart from reality, the Tathagata is not perceived.

original: tha dad du dbyer med pa'i don brgya byin gyis bshad pa de bzhin no zhes smras pa'o //🔽byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs la /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la yang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tha dad du dbyer med pa'i don brgya byin gyis bshad pa de bzhin no zhes smras pa'o // byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs la / de bzhin gshegs pa la yang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement by Indra:🔽“The reality of non-metamorphosis, reality, and the Tathagatas are ultimately of one taste in emptiness.🔽They are not differentiated.”🔽The Tathagata is not perceived in the reality of non-metamorphosis.🔽The reality of non-metamorphosis is not perceived in the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The Tathagata is not perceived in reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang de bzhin nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tha mi dad pa yang gcig la gcig gnas dang rten pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /🔽stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i tshul gyis tha mi dad do zhes bstan pa'o //🔽gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid mi @299b dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang de bzhin nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tha mi dad pa yang gcig la gcig gnas dang rten pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi / stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i tshul gyis tha mi dad do zhes bstan pa'o // gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid mi @299b dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang /
translated: The phrase “the thusness of the tathāgatas is not apprehended” refers to the fact that the reality that is not a transformation and the thusness of the tathāgatas are not apprehended as being mutually established or supported.🔽The phrase “the thusness of the tathāgatas is not apprehended” refers to the fact that the reality that is not a transformation and the thusness of the tathāgatas are not apprehended as being mutually established or supported.🔽The phrase “the thusness of the tathāgatas is not apprehended” refers to the fact that the reality that is not a transformation and the thusness of the tathāgatas are not apprehended as being mutually established or supported.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang gcig la gcig gnas pa dang rten pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang gcig la gcig gnas pa dang rten pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “the thusness of the tathāgatas is not apprehended” refers to the fact that the reality that is not a transformation and the thusness of the tathāgatas are not apprehended as being mutually established or supported.

original: de bzhin nyid dang chos nyid kyi tshul gyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang chos nyid kyi tshul gyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: It is the same taste in emptiness by way of suchness and the reality of phenomena.

original: tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not different.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained for the five aggregates beginning with form, so it is to be understood up to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Kauśika, the Tathāgata is not conjoined with the suchness of form, nor is he disjoined.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no zhes gzugs kyi chos nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no zhes gzugs kyi chos nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: He is not conjoined with the suchness of form, nor is he disjoined.🔽He is not conjoined with the reality of form, nor is he disjoined.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: He is not conjoined with the suchness of form, nor is he disjoined.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is not conjoined with the reality of form, nor is he disjoined.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid la bya ste /
translated: The so-called “tathāgata” is the ultimate nature of the body of truth.

original: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos por dmigs su med la /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos por dmigs su med la /
translated: The nature of the body of truth is not observed as a thing.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzugs kyi chos nyid dang / dngos po med pa la bya ba'i phyir de dag tha dad du dbyer med pas ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzugs kyi chos nyid dang / dngos po med pa la bya ba'i phyir de dag tha dad du dbyer med pas ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Because it is the suchness of form, the reality of form, and non-entity, they are not differentiated, and therefore they are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin pa dang / gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin pa dang / gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba yang /
translated: That which is not the suchness of form is neither conjoined nor disjoined with anything else, and that which is not the reality of form is neither conjoined nor disjoined with anything else.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The so-called “tathāgata” is the nature of the body of truth.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan pa'i chos lta don dam par med mod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan pa'i chos lta don dam par med mod kyi /
translated: Since it is the nature of non-entityness, it is not the suchness of form, nor is it the reality of form, nor is it any other phenomenon.

original: brgya la de lta bu zhig yod du zin na yang de dang yang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: brgya la de lta bu zhig yod du zin na yang de dang yang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Even if it were to exist in that way, it would not be possessed,

original: bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: nor would it be separated.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained for form, it should be applied up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka 'di ni gang chos 'di dag thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin pa de'i mthu ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di ni gang chos 'di dag thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin pa de'i mthu ste /
translated: Kauśika, this is the power of one who is neither possessed nor separated from all these phenomena.

original: byin gyi rlabs med pa de'i tshul gyis de'i byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba ni gong du 'di lta bu'i @300a * //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs med pa de'i tshul gyis de'i byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba ni gong du 'di lta bu'i @300a * //
translated: By the method of being without consecration, it is the consecration.

original: chos zab mo bshad pa de dag gi mthu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos zab mo bshad pa de dag gi mthu ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the power of those profound phenomena that were explained above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs yin no zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de yang don dam par de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs yin no zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de yang don dam par de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The Tathagata is the one who explains that this is the Tathagata's power and transformative ability.🔽🔽The Tathagata is also the nature of suchness and the dharmakaya in the ultimate.

original: chos gang dang yang tha mi dad cing ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa de'i mthu dang de'i byin gyi rlabs yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽koo shi ka gang yang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang nas btsal bar bya zhes zer ba ni koo shi ka gzugs las kyang btsal bar mi bya /
analyzed: chos gang dang yang tha mi dad cing ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa de'i mthu dang de'i byin gyi rlabs yin no zhes bstan pa'o // koo shi ka gang yang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang nas btsal bar bya zhes zer ba ni koo shi ka gzugs las kyang btsal bar mi bya /
translated: The Tathagata is the nature of suchness and the Dharma body, and the power and the blessing of the Tathagata are the power and the blessing of that which is not different from any dharma, and which is neither conjoined with nor disjoined from any dharma.🔽Kausika, when you ask, Where should a Bodhisattva search for the perfection of wisdom? you should not search for it in form, nor should you search for it apart from form.

original: gzugs las gzhan du yang btsal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang nas btsal bar bya zhes dris pa'i lan /
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan du yang btsal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang nas btsal bar bya zhes dris pa'i lan /
translated: This is the answer to the question asked by Sakra, Where should the perfection of wisdom be searched for?

original: sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes khungs bstan pa'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes khungs bstan pa'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the passage should be sought in the chapter of Subhuti is the detailed explanation by Subhuti.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab la bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab la bya ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom refers to nonconceptual wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab de yang don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pas gzugs la sogs pa las btsal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab de yang don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pas gzugs la sogs pa las btsal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That nonconceptual wisdom is not to be sought in form and so on, because ultimately it does not exist as a thing. This is the teaching.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs gang yin pa dang / chor ba gang yin pa dang / 'du shes gang yin pa dang / 'du byed gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs gang yin pa dang / chor ba gang yin pa dang / 'du shes gang yin pa dang / 'du byed gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang /
translated: Kausika, it is because whatever form there is, whatever feeling there is, whatever perception there is, whatever volitional factors there are, whatever consciousness there is, whatever bodhisattva there is,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / btsal ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / btsal ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: All those phenomena, whatever they may be, that are the perfection of wisdom and the search, are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: They are formless,

original: bltar med pa /
analyzed: bltar med pa /
translated: cannot be pointed out,

original: thogs pa med pa mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: are unimpeded, and have one characteristic in that they are without characteristic.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa las btsal du med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa las btsal du med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the reason that the perfection of wisdom is not to be searched for in form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang / tshol bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / btsal bar bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos de dag thams cad dngos po med pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang / tshol bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / btsal bar bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos de dag thams cad dngos po med pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Because the five aggregates beginning with form, the bodhisattva who searches, the perfection of wisdom that is to be searched for, and all those phenomena are all unreal, they are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa /🔽bltar med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa / bltar med pa /
translated: They are formless,🔽cannot be pointed out,

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: are unimpeded,

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: and have one characteristic in that they are without characteristic.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes @300b bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes @300b bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said to be without defining characteristics.

original: de la ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos de dag don dam par dngos po med pas gzhi dang rten pa'i tshul du mi gnas pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos de dag don dam par dngos po med pas gzhi dang rten pa'i tshul du mi gnas pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: “ It is not associated” means that, since those phenomena are ultimately unreal, they do not exist in the manner of a basis and something based on it.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ It is not non-associated” means that

original: de ltar dngos po med pas ldan pa'i zlas 'grub pa'i mi ldan pa med pa'i phyir mi lan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pas ldan pa'i zlas 'grub pa'i mi ldan pa med pa'i phyir mi lan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: since they are unreal in that way, there is no non-association that is established in contrast to association.

original: gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par dngos po med pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par dngos po med pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'o //
translated: “ It is formless” means that, since it is ultimately unreal in that way, it is formless because it is not associated with the defining characteristics of form.

original: bltar med pa zhes bya ba ni de ni 'di yin no zhes bstan du mi rung ba'i phyir bltar med pa'o //
analyzed: bltar med pa zhes bya ba ni de ni 'di yin no zhes bstan du mi rung ba'i phyir bltar med pa'o //
translated: “ It is invisible” means that it is invisible because it is not suitable to be shown as “It is this.”

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ It is unimpeded” means that it is not the defining characteristic of form.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: “ It has a single defining characteristic” means that

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos de dag don dam par rang bzhin med par ro gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos de dag don dam par rang bzhin med par ro gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, they are without defining characteristics means that those phenomena are of one taste in ultimate reality, which is the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are of one defining characteristic in the absence of defining characteristics.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained in relation to the five aggregates beginning with form, so it should be applied up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa bstan pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa bstan pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
translated: Kauśika, it is because form is not the perfection of wisdom, etc. This explains the reason why it was taught above that phenomena beginning with form are neither conjoined nor disjoined, etc.

original: don dam par gzugs dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga dngos po yod par ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa
analyzed: don dam par gzugs dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga dngos po yod par ma grub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa
translated: In the ultimate sense, since neither form nor the perfection of wisdom are established as existent things, the so-called perfection of wisdom is neither conjoined with all those phenomena such as form, nor

original: yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: is it disjoined from them.

original: de la gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therein, form is not the perfection of wisdom means that the so-called perfection of wisdom is not the nature of imagined form.

original: gzugs las gud na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par de gnyis dngos po med par ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs las gud na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par de gnyis dngos po med par ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not elsewhere than form means that ultimately those two are of one taste in being unreal, and thus they are also taught to be undifferentiable.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yang shes @301a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yang shes @301a * //
translated: The suchness of form is not the perfection of wisdom. This means that the perfected characteristic of form is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga yang don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga yang don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Nor is there a perfection of wisdom apart from the suchness of form. This teaches that neither the suchness of form nor the perfection of wisdom are different, since ultimately they are of one taste in emptiness.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reality of form is not the perfection of wisdom. This means that the emptiness nature of the reality of form is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid las gud na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid las gud na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not other than the reality of form.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid ces bya ba stong pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid ces bya ba stong pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The reality of form, i.e., emptiness, and the perfection of wisdom are of one taste in emptiness, and so are not differentiated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to feeling, etc., up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Kausika, it is because all those dharmas are non-existent and not apprehended.

original: de ltar chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs pas na gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin gzugs las gud na yang
analyzed: de ltar chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs pas na gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin gzugs las gud na yang
translated: Since all those dharmas are non-existent and not apprehended, form is not the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa ci'i phyir de skad du bstan pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa ci'i phyir de skad du bstan pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
translated: The reason for teaching that is as follows:

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzugs kyi chos nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad don dam par med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzugs kyi chos nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad don dam par med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
translated: Form, the suchness of form, the reality of form, the perfection of wisdom, and so on, all those phenomena, ultimately do not exist and are not observed. Therefore, form is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs las gud na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du gong du smos pa'i tshig rnams bzlas te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs las gud na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du gong du smos pa'i tshig rnams bzlas te bstan pa'o //
translated: Apart from form, there is also no perfection of wisdom. Thus, the words mentioned above are repeated up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la chos de dag med cing zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag gi rang bzhin yod par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chos de dag med cing zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag gi rang bzhin yod par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, “those phenomena do not exist” means that ultimately the nature of those phenomena such as form is not established as existent.

original: mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa drug gis dmigs par bya ba'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa drug gis dmigs par bya ba'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Not apprehended” means that it is not an object apprehended by the six consciousnesses.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the elder Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @301b chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni che ba ste /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @301b chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni che ba ste /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is the great one,🔽namely the perfection of wisdom.” And so on.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de don dam par gang nas kyang btsal du med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de don dam par gang nas kyang btsal du med la /
translated: As explained above, that perfection of wisdom is ultimately not to be sought anywhere.

original: chos gang gi dngos po yang ma yin du zin kyang kun rdzob tu de la bslabs nas dus gsum gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so'i 'bras bu khyad par can thob par 'gyur bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rgya che ba dang /
analyzed: chos gang gi dngos po yang ma yin du zin kyang kun rdzob tu de la bslabs nas dus gsum gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so'i 'bras bu khyad par can thob par 'gyur bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rgya che ba dang /
translated: Therefore, this perfection of wisdom is vast,🔽immeasurable, and infinite.

original: tshad med pa dang / mtha' yas pa yin no zhes ngo mtshar du bzang ba'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / mtha' yas pa yin no zhes ngo mtshar du bzang ba'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the excellent qualities of the marvel.

original: de la bslabs shing rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la bslabs shing rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo 'thob bo //
translated: Those who have trained in it and have attained the result of stream enterer have attained, will attain, and are attaining the result of stream enterer.🔽Those who have attained the result of once-returner have attained, will attain, and are attaining the result of once-returner.🔽Those who have attained the result of nonreturner have attained, will attain, and are attaining the result of nonreturner.

original: thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Those who have attained the state of a worthy one have attained, will attain, and are attaining the state of a worthy one.🔽Those who have attained a pratyekabuddha’s awakening have attained, will attain, and are attaining a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Those who have attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening have attained, will attain, and are attaining unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum gyi 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs na so so'i 'bras bu khyad par can rnams thob par 'gyur ba'i yon tan bstan pa'o//
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum gyi 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs na so so'i 'bras bu khyad par can rnams thob par 'gyur ba'i yon tan bstan pa'o//
translated: Up to “will fully awaken” teaches the qualities that the noble hearers, solitary realizers, and bodhisattvas of the three times will attain by training in this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That is so!

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Up to “will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni brgya byin gyis bshad pa'i don dang tshig rnams 'khor rnams yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni brgya byin gyis bshad pa'i don dang tshig rnams 'khor rnams yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Up to “will fully awaken” teaches the meaning and words explained by Śatakratu in order to bring conviction to the retinue.

original: rab 'byor gyis bzlas te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rgya che ba dang / tshang med pa dang / mtha' yas pa'o zhes zer ba de bden no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis bzlas te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rgya che ba dang / tshang med pa dang / mtha' yas pa'o zhes zer ba de bden no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: unbounded, and infinite.

original: koo shi ka gzugs rgya che ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya che ba yin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs rgya che ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya che ba yin te /
translated: Kauśika, the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is extensive because form is extensive.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, it is because the prior limit of form is not observed, its later limit is not observed, and its middle is not observed.

original: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rgya che ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, because of this one of many explanations, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is extensive.

original: 'di ltar @302a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar @302a * //
translated: It is🔽this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya che ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya che ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the reason why the perfection of wisdom is extensive.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas dngos po med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas dngos po med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus mi dmigs te /
translated: Since phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are not ultimately established as existent things, they are not things.

original: gang de ltar mtha' dang dbus mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig cing tha mi dad pas gzugs la sogs pa la dus gsum dmigs su med cing yongs su chad pa med de /
analyzed: gang de ltar mtha' dang dbus mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig cing tha mi dad pas gzugs la sogs pa la dus gsum dmigs su med cing yongs su chad pa med de /
translated: Since the non-apprehension of an end and a middle and the middle of phenomena that are like that and the perfection of wisdom are ultimately of one taste in emptiness and are not different, form and so on are not apprehended in the three times and are not terminated.

original: rgya che ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dus gsum dmigs su med pa'i phyir rgya che ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dus gsum dmigs su med pa'i phyir rgya che ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as it is extensive, since the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended in the three times, it is extensive.

original: koo shi ka gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshad med pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshad med pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, because form is immeasurable, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable.

original: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni tshad med pa ste /
translated: Kauśika, by this approach, that perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable.🔽Kauśika, it is thus that the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.”

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to this point, the explanation of the reason why the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable is presented.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas de dag gi tshad 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung du med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas de dag gi tshad 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung du med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: Since phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are not ultimately established as existent things, their measure cannot be apprehended as “it is this much.”

original: pa yang don dam par chos de dag dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir dpe nam mkha' las blangs te tshad med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa yang don dam par chos de dag dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir dpe nam mkha' las blangs te tshad med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Also, because ultimately those phenomena are not different, the example is taken from space and it is taught that they are limitless.

original: koo shi ka gzugs mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, because form is limitless, this perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is limitless, and so on up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtha' yas pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtha' yas pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: because the knowledge of all aspects is limitless, it is limitless.

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, up to this is the perfection of wisdom, it teaches the reason why the perfection of wisdom is limitless.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas de dag la skye ba'i mtha' dang / 'gag pa'i mtha' yang med la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas de dag la skye ba'i mtha' dang / 'gag pa'i mtha' yang med la /
translated: Because phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are ultimately not established as existent things, they have no limit of arising and no limit of cessation.

original: mtha' gnyis ma grub pas dbus kyang dmigs su med @302b pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par chos de dag dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis ma grub pas dbus kyang dmigs su med @302b pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par chos de dag dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as the middle is not apprehended because the two extremes are not established, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom is also infinite because ultimately it is not different from those phenomena.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang dmigs yas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang dmigs yas pa'i phyir /
translated: Kauśika, moreover, because of the infinity of objects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste /🔽de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa dang /
translated: this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is infinite.🔽As for thus it is the perfection of wisdom, and so on, it teaches that the perfection of wisdom is infinite because of the infinity of objects of the knowledge of all aspects, the infinity of objects of the dharma-dhātu, the infinity of objects of suchness,

original: sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: and the infinity of sentient beings.

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor de rnam pa gang gis na dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor de rnam pa gang gis na dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, by what aspect is this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings infinite because of infinite objects?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhes bya /
translated: Why is it said to be the perfection of wisdom?”

original: zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa'o zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa'o zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti’s question about the reason why the perfection of wisdom is infinite because of infinite objects.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of infinite objects, the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom. This is the teaching of the reason why the perfection of wisdom is infinite because of the infinity of the objective support.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid don dam par dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid don dam par dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The object of observation of the bodhisattvas, the knowledge of all aspects, is ultimately the nature of non-entityness.

original: de la skye ba'i mtha'am /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i mtha'am /
translated: There is no limit of origination

original: 'gag pa'i mtha' med pas mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i mtha' med pas mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: or limit of cessation, and therefore it is infinite.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is also infinite because ultimately it is not different from that.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang chos dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 4'di mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang chos dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 4'di mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, for bodhisattva great beings, this perfection is infinite because of the infinity of the objective support of phenomena.

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu @303a * //🔽phyin pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu @303a * // phyin pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that the perfection of wisdom is infinite because the objective support of the dharmadhatu is infinite.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa de ni don dam par dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de la skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtha' med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa de ni don dam par dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de la skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtha' med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol
translated: The objective domain of the bodhisattvas, the nonconceptual dharmadhatu, is ultimately the nature of nonentity, and therefore it is without the extremes of origination and cessation.

original: tu phyin pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tu phyin pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is also infinite because it is not different from that.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang de bzhin nyid dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang de bzhin nyid dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Kausika, this perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is infinite because suchness, the objective support, is infinite.

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: As for the passage beginning “It is thus that the perfection of wisdom is infinite,” it shows that the perfection of wisdom is infinite because the object of observation that is thusness is infinite.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul de bzhin nyid ces bya ba de don dam par dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul de bzhin nyid ces bya ba de don dam par dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: The object of observation of the bodhisattvas, called “thusness,” is ultimately the nature that is not an entity.

original: de la skye ba'i mtha' dang 'gag pa'i mtha' med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i mtha' dang 'gag pa'i mtha' med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since it has no limit of origination and no limit of cessation, the perfection of wisdom is also taught to be infinite because it is not different from that.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is infinite because sentient beings are infinite.”

original: sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Because sentient beings are infinite, the perfection of wisdom is taught to be infinite.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gang gi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba'i sems can de dag thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas de la sngon gyi mtha'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gang gi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba'i sems can de dag thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas de la sngon gyi mtha'am /
translated: Because all those sentient beings for whose sake the bodhisattvas practice the perfection of wisdom are ultimately unreal, they have no prior limit or

original: phyi ma'i mtha' med de mtha' yas pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' med de mtha' yas pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o zhes bstan te /
translated: posterior limit, and are infinite. In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is ultimately infinite because it is the nature of unreality.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Kauśika, what do you think?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sems can sems can zhes bya ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dags yin zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems can dngos po med pa'i gtan tshigs 'chad du gzhug pa'i phyir brgya byin la dris pa'o //
analyzed: sems can sems can zhes bya ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dags yin zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems can dngos po med pa'i gtan tshigs 'chad du gzhug pa'i phyir brgya byin la dris pa'o //
