translated: The question What is the term for any existent thing called 'sentient being'? is asked of Śatakratu in order to introduce the argument that ultimately sentient beings are unreal.

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śatakratu replied:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni chos kyi tshig bla dags kyang ma yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni chos kyi tshig bla dags kyang ma yin /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, it is not the term for a dharma,

original: chos ma yin pa'i tshig bla dags kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i tshig bla dags kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it the term for a non-dharma.

original: 'di ltar sems can sems can zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can sems can zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa /
translated: It is like this: 'sentient being, sentient being' is a name that is suddenly given,

original: @303b dngos po med par ming du btags pa /
analyzed: @303b dngos po med par ming du btags pa /
translated: a name given to what is unreal,🔽a name given to what is unobservable.

original: dmigs pa med par ming du btags pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ming du btags pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the argument of infinitude because ultimately sentient beings are unreal.

original: chos zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na chos de'i tshig bla dags so zhes byar yang rung na /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na chos de'i tshig bla dags so zhes byar yang rung na /
translated: If there were some existent thing called a dharma, it would be suitable to say that it is the term for that dharma.

original: don dam par chos zhes bya ba'i dngos po gang yang med pas sems can 'di dag chos de'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes byar yang mi rung la /
analyzed: don dam par chos zhes bya ba'i dngos po gang yang med pas sems can 'di dag chos de'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes byar yang mi rung la /
translated: Since ultimately there is no thing called a phenomenon, it is not suitable to say that these sentient beings are a designation for that phenomenon.

original: de ltar chos yod par ma grub pas de'i zlas 'grub pa chos ma yin pa yang med pa'i phyir chos ma yin pa'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos yod par ma grub pas de'i zlas 'grub pa chos ma yin pa yang med pa'i phyir chos ma yin pa'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: Since the phenomenon is not established as existent in that way, the non-phenomenon that is established by contrast is also nonexistent. Therefore, it is not suitable to say that they are a designation for a non-phenomenon.

original: de bas na sems can zhes bya ba 'di dag ni don dam par dngos po med cing dmigs su med pa las /
analyzed: de bas na sems can zhes bya ba 'di dag ni don dam par dngos po med cing dmigs su med pa las /
translated: Therefore, these so-called sentient beings are ultimately things that do not exist and are not apprehended.

original: kun rdzob tu glo bur du ming du btags pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu glo bur du ming du btags pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They are merely adventitiously designated by names on the conventional level.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Kauśika, what do you think?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las sems can du bshad pa gang yang yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las kyang don dam par sems can yod par ma bshad do zhes bya ba'i don🔽to // rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽koo shi ka gang la sems can du bshad pa gang yang med pa de la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las sems can du bshad pa gang yang yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las kyang don dam par sems can yod par ma bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to // rab 'byor gyis smras pa / koo shi ka gang la sems can du bshad pa gang yang med pa de la /
translated: From this perfection of wisdom it is explained that there are no sentient beings at all.🔽Subhūti said, Kauśika, in that which is explained as sentient beings, there are no sentient beings at all.

original: sems can mtha' yas pa yod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las sems can dngos po yod par ma bshad pa nyid dngos po med pa yin pas mtha' yas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa yod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las sems can dngos po yod par ma bshad pa nyid dngos po med pa yin pas mtha' yas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Kauśika, in that which is explained as sentient beings, there are infinite sentient beings.

original: koo shi ka gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bzhugs te /
analyzed: koo shi ka gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bzhugs te /
translated: Kauśika, if the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One were to remain for an eon or the remainder of an eon, and were to explain to beings with his naturally melodious voice that sentient beings, sentient beings,

original: sems can sems can zhes gsung du brjod na koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /🔽de la sems can gang yang skye ba'am 'gag par 'gyur ba yod dam zhes bya ba ni sems can zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu tshig tu brjod pa tsam gyis yang dag par dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can sems can zhes gsung du brjod na koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems / de la sems can gang yang skye ba'am 'gag par 'gyur ba yod dam zhes bya ba ni sems can zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu tshig tu brjod pa tsam gyis yang dag par dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Kauśika, what do you think?🔽Are there any sentient beings who are born or cease to exist?

original: brgya byin la dris pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin la dris pa'o //
translated: This is a question to Śakra that is asked in order to teach the meaning of the non-existence of things as real entities, by the mere conventional verbal expression of sentient beings as a conventional term.

original: smras pa btsun pa rab 'byor de ni med de /
analyzed: smras pa btsun pa rab 'byor de ni med de /
translated: Śakra said, Venerable Subhūti, they do not.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sems can thog ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems can rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / sems can thog ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems can rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Why is that?🔽 Because sentient beings are primordially pure.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni thog ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir skyes pa'am 'gag par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni thog ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir skyes pa'am 'gag par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that ultimately sentient beings are empty of intrinsic nature, and that which is empty of intrinsic nature has no birth or cessation because it is primordially pure.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: @304a * // koo shi ka de ltar rnam grangs des na sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems can dngos po med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtha' gnyis kyang med de
analyzed: @304a * // koo shi ka de ltar rnam grangs des na sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems can dngos po med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtha' gnyis kyang med de
translated: Kauśika, for this reason, too, you should know that the perfection of wisdom is infinite because of the infinity of sentient beings.🔽 Thus, because sentient beings are unreal, the two extremes of origination and cessation do not exist.

original: / de ltar sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dngos po med pa yin pas mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes /
analyzed: / de ltar sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dngos po med pa yin pas mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes /
translated: Thus, because of the infinity of sentient beings, the perfection of wisdom is also unreal and should be known as infinite.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the summary of the meaning of the infinity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bshad pa lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa chos 'chad pa'i 'khor na 'khod pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyis don dang tshig rnams rtogs nas dad pa skyes shing ngam ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis rab 'byor gyis chos zab mo bshad pa de legs par bshad
analyzed: de nas dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bshad pa lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa chos 'chad pa'i 'khor na 'khod pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyis don dang tshig rnams rtogs nas dad pa skyes shing ngam ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis rab 'byor gyis chos zab mo bshad pa de legs par bshad
translated: Then, the gods together with Indra, the gods together with Brahma, and so on, means that the lord of the gods, Indra, and Brahma, and so on, who are in the assembly listening to the Dharma, having understood the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, are delighted and, through the power and blessing of the Tathagata, exclaim, Well spoken, Subhuti, well spoken, is the profound teaching of the Dharma by Subhuti.

original: do zhes ched du brjod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: do zhes ched du brjod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the exclamation.

original: ched du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni mgu ches nas ngam ste /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni mgu ches nas ngam ste /
translated: As for the term exclamation, it means to be so delighted as to exclaim.

original: sus kyang smrar ma bcug par dga' zhing mgu ba'i shugs kyis tshig tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sus kyang smrar ma bcug par dga' zhing mgu ba'i shugs kyis tshig tu brjod pa'o //
translated: Without being prompted by anyone, one speaks words out of the force of joy and delight.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo thos shing rtogs pa las de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽bshad cing brjod de bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo thos shing rtogs pa las de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro // bshad cing brjod de bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the sake of the appearance of the Tathagata means that the Tathagata himself appears from hearing and understanding the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom.🔽It is explained, expressed, and taught means

original: bshad pa ni mdor bshad pa'o //🔽brjod pa ni 'bring du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni mdor bshad pa'o // brjod pa ni 'bring du bshad pa'o //
translated: that it is explained in brief,🔽expressed in medium detail,

original: bstan pa ni rgya cher bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni rgya cher bshad pa'o //
translated: and taught in great detail.

original: chos 'di ni kye ma legs par bshad do //
analyzed: chos 'di ni kye ma legs par bshad do //
translated: This Dharma is well-spoken,

original: kye ma chos 'di ni legs par bshad do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo sde 'di'i tshig gi rang bzhin gyi chos 'di legs par bshad do zhes mgu ba'i shugs kyis lan gnyis su bzlas te smras pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma chos 'di ni legs par bshad do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo sde 'di'i tshig gi rang bzhin gyi chos 'di legs par bshad do zhes mgu ba'i shugs kyis lan gnyis su bzlas te smras pa'o //
translated: this Dharma is well-spoken indeed means that the nature of the Dharma of this perfection of wisdom sutra is well-spoken. This is said twice with the force of delight.

original: kye ma chos kyi chos nyid ni legs par bshad do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don de bzhin nyid legs par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽bcom ldan 'das bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar zab cing rgya che ba'i shes rab
analyzed: kye ma chos kyi chos nyid ni legs par bshad do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don de bzhin nyid legs par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to // bcom ldan 'das bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar zab cing rgya che ba'i shes rab
translated: “Oh, the reality of phenomena has been well explained” means the suchness of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom has been well explained.🔽“Blessed One, I should hold those bodhisattva great beings who are not separated from this perfection of wisdom as being the very Tathāgata” means those bodhisattvas who are not separated from this perfection of wisdom that is so profound and vast

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di @304b mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis don rtogs pa'i sgo nas ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni gdon mi za bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya'o zhes dbang po la sogs pa'i lha
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di @304b mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis don rtogs pa'i sgo nas ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni gdon mi za bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya'o zhes dbang po la sogs pa'i lha
translated: through the wisdom that comes from listening, contemplating, and meditating on its meaning should be held as being the very Tathāgata because they will undoubtedly attain the state of a tathāgata.

original: dang mi rnams kyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: dang mi rnams kyis smras pa'o //
translated: and the people said.

original: chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis te /
analyzed: chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis te /
translated: No dharma is apprehended,

original: gzugs sam tshor ba'am zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs sam tshor ba'am zhes bya ba nas /
translated: whether form, feeling, and so on,🔽up to🔽the arrangement of the three vehicles exists.

original: theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa mchis te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di thabs dang shes rab du ldan pas legs par bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa mchis te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di thabs dang shes rab du ldan pas legs par bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to this point, Subhuti has taught the reason why the perfection of wisdom is well-taught, by combining skillful means and wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par dmigs su med par rtogs kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyis gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par dmigs su med par rtogs kyang /
translated: By wisdom, one realizes that all dharmas from form up to omniscience are ultimately unapprehendable,

original: thabs kyis kun rdzob tu theg pa gsum sems can gyi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa legs par bshad do zhes dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyis kun rdzob tu theg pa gsum sems can gyi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa legs par bshad do zhes dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis smras pa'o //
translated: and by skillful means, one explains the three vehicles in accordance with the minds of sentient beings on the conventional level. This is well-taught, as stated by the gods with Indra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i bu dbang po dang bcas pa rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i bu dbang po dang bcas pa rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the gods with Indra:

original: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //
translated: The gods said, “It is so, divine princes!

original: ji ltar smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /🔽chos gang yang mi dmigs mod kyi theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis smras pa'i tshig rnams 'khor thams cad kyi yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig de
analyzed: ji ltar smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas / chos gang yang mi dmigs mod kyi theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis smras pa'i tshig rnams 'khor thams cad kyi yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig de
translated: It is just as you have said, up to🔽‘although no phenomenon is apprehended, the three vehicles are still taught.’🔽The Bhagavān repeated those words

original: dag nyid bzlas te /
analyzed: dag nyid bzlas te /
translated: of the gods together with their retinues in order to make everyone believe them.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: He said, “It is so, divine princes!

original: lha'i bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de ni /
translated: Divine princes, bodhisattva great beings who are not separated from this perfection of wisdom, by way of not apprehending anything,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du lha rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de ni bdag cag gis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du lha rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de ni bdag cag gis /
translated: One should hold that to be the Tathagata himself.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya'o zhes smras pa'i don 'khor thams cad kyi yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig de nyid bzlas te bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya'o zhes smras pa'i don 'khor thams cad kyi yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig de nyid bzlas te bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: The phrase should be apprehended as a Tathagata refers to the fact that the Lord repeats the statement made by the retinue, We should apprehend that Bodhisattva, that great being, who is not separated from this perfection of wisdom as a Tathagata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan te zhes bya ba ni /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de @305a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan te zhes bya ba ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de @305a * //
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are revealed in detail.

original: bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase that Bodhisattva, that great being, who is not separated from this perfection of wisdom indicates the reason why he should be apprehended as a Tathagata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan pa 'di lta bu dang ma bral na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de dag de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan pa 'di lta bu dang ma bral na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de dag de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar
translated: Because if they do not lack this perfection of wisdom, which teaches extensively the three vehicles in this way, they will undoubtedly become Tathagatas, the Bodhisattvas should be considered as Tathagatas.

original: bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Tathagata is not apprehended as other than the perfection of giving, and so on up to:🔽The Tathagata is not apprehended as other than the knowledge of all modes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang don dam par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang don dam par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la
translated: The Bodhisattvas who are to be considered as Tathagatas, in the ultimate sense, are not apprehended as other than the six perfections.

original: sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ming gis smos pa de rnams dang tha mi dad de /
analyzed: sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ming gis smos pa de rnams dang tha mi dad de /
translated: The above-mentioned qualities of the Buddha, from the ten powers up to omniscience, are not different from the dharmadhatu.

original: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos de rnams las gzhan du btsal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos de rnams las gzhan du btsal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include all the names of the qualities of a Buddha up to and including the knowledge of all things. They are not different from suchness, because they are of one taste with suchness. Therefore, it is taught that they are not to be sought anywhere else than in the qualities of a Buddha.

original: lha'i bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos 'di dag thams cad la slob ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos 'di dag thams cad la slob ste /
translated: “Divine princes, the bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in all these dharmas.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob bo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob bo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He trains in the perfection of generosity, and so on.

original: lha'i bu dag de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang mi 'bral bar spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya ste zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang mi 'bral bar spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya ste zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu
translated: Divine princes, therefore the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices without being separated from this perfection of wisdom is called a tathāgata.”

original: phyin pa dang ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las gzhan du mi dmigs so zhes gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phyin pa dang ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las gzhan du mi dmigs so zhes gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who are not separated from the perfection of wisdom should be regarded as tathagatas, and that tathagata is not apprehended as other than the qualities of a buddha.🔽This teaches the reason explained above.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ming gis smos pa rnams la slob pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma🔽bral ba yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ming gis smos pa rnams la slob pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma🔽bral ba yin la /
translated: Those bodhisattvas are not separated from the perfection of wisdom because they train in the qualities of a buddha, which are mentioned by name from the perfection of generosity up to omniscience.

original: don dam par sangs rgyas kyi chos de rnams dang de la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de bzhin nyid du ro gcig ste tha mi dad pas chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par sangs rgyas kyi chos de rnams dang de la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de bzhin nyid du ro gcig ste tha mi dad pas chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Ultimately, those qualities of a buddha and the bodhisattvas who train in them are of one taste in suchness, they are not different. Therefore, they should be known as the tathagatas who are the nature of dharmakaya.

original: lha'i bu dag gang gi tshe nga de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @305b sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi zha 'bring byed cing rgyal po'i khab pad mo yod pa'i nang gi tshong 'dus kyi dbus na 'dug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gang gi tshe nga de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @305b sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi zha 'bring byed cing rgyal po'i khab pad mo yod pa'i nang gi tshong 'dus kyi dbus na 'dug pa'i tshe /
translated: “O sons of the gods, when I was the attendant of the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Dipankara, and I was sitting in the middle of the marketplace in the lotus of Rajagriha,🔽I was not separated from the perfection of generosity.”

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar ma gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos la gsar du slob cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar ma gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos la gsar du slob cing /
translated: The bodhisattva is newly training in the qualities of a buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba rnams kyang gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis /🔽sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa sngon bram ze'i khye'u mdzad pa'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ma bral bar gyur pa gzigs nas lung bstan pa'i dpe bshad pa ste ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba rnams kyang gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis / sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa sngon bram ze'i khye'u mdzad pa'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ma bral bar gyur pa gzigs nas lung bstan pa'i dpe bshad pa ste ;
translated: The Tathagata Dipankara saw that the Buddha Shakyamuni, when he was the brahman boy Shrivardhana, was never separated from the paramita of generosity and the other qualities of the Buddha. He therefore gave the prediction.

original: nga sngon bram ze'i khye'u byed pa'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mnyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom pa'i sgo nas ma bral bar de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis gzigs nas /
analyzed: nga sngon bram ze'i khye'u byed pa'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mnyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom pa'i sgo nas ma bral bar de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis gzigs nas /
translated: The Buddha said, “When I was the brahman boy Shrivardhana, I never failed to listen to the paramita of generosity and the other qualities of the Buddha, to reflect on them, and to meditate on them. The Tathagata Dipankara saw this and gave me the prediction.

original: nga la khye'u khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bskal pa grangs med pa na sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: nga la khye'u khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bskal pa grangs med pa na sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: When this is applied to the prophecy In the future, in a countless eon, you will become the Tathagata named Shakyamuni,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de yang gdon mi za bar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung ba'i rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang ma bral ba de yang gdon mi za bar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung ba'i rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the bodhisattva who is not separated from this perfection of wisdom will certainly become a Tathagata.

original: de la bskal ba bzang po zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe bskal pa bzang po 'di la bya'o //
analyzed: de la bskal ba bzang po zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe bskal pa bzang po 'di la bya'o //
translated: Regarding the fortunate eon, it refers to the time when Shakyamuni Buddha attained perfect enlightenment in this fortunate eon.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid la bya'o //
translated: Regarding in this very world system, it refers to this very Saha world system.

original: sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i rigs las byung zhing mi rigs pa mi byed par thub pa la bya'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i rigs las byung zhing mi rigs pa mi byed par thub pa la bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas /
translated: The one called Shakyamuni is so called because he was born in the Shakya clan and because he is a sage who does not engage in improper conduct.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu gshegs shing phyin pa de bzhin du gshegs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu gshegs shing phyin pa de bzhin du gshegs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The one called Tathagata is so called because he has gone and reached unsurpassed enlightenment in the same way that the Buddhas of the past knew the suchness, the nature of all phenomena, just as it is.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one called Arhat is so called because he has destroyed the enemies, the afflictions.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi gnyid las sangs te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi gnyid las sangs te /
translated: The one called Perfectly Enlightened One is so called because he has awakened from the sleep of delusion,

original: blo rgyas pas chos thams cad ma lus par thugs su chud pa la bya'o //
analyzed: blo rgyas pas chos thams cad ma lus par thugs su chud pa la bya'o //
translated: and because his mind has expanded and he has fully realized all phenomena.

original: mkhyen pa dang rkang par ldan pa zhes bya ba la mkhyen pa ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin @306a * //
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang rkang par ldan pa zhes bya ba la mkhyen pa ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin @306a * //
translated: He is called “endowed with knowledge and feet” because he has knowledge and feet.

original: du mkhyen pa lhag pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: du mkhyen pa lhag pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the possession of superior wisdom, which is the correct understanding of all phenomena just as they are.

original: rkang pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin lhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rkang pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin lhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa la bya ste /
translated: Feet are the possession of superior mind, which is the nature of superior morality and meditative concentration.

original: shes rab kyi mig gis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong nas tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rkang pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu phyin par byed pa'i phyir mkhyen pa dang rkang par ldan pa zhes bya'o //🔽bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i lam bde bar zhugs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong nas tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rkang pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu phyin par byed pa'i phyir mkhyen pa dang rkang par ldan pa zhes bya'o // bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i lam bde bar zhugs te /
translated: He is called “endowed with knowledge and feet” because, having seen all phenomena with the eye of wisdom just as they are, he proceeds to unsurpassed enlightenment by means of the feet of morality and meditative concentration.🔽He is called “one who has gone to bliss” because he has entered the path that leads to the attainment of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul du gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul du gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who has gone to bliss” because he has gone in a manner that is irreversible.

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams la gzigs shing skal pa yod pa dang / skal ba med pa dang / 'dul ba'i dus la bab ma bab mkhyen nas sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa thog tu bab par mkhyen pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams la gzigs shing skal pa yod pa dang / skal ba med pa dang / 'dul ba'i dus la bab ma bab mkhyen nas sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa thog tu bab par mkhyen pa la bya'o //
translated: The expression knower of the world means that he knows who among the worldly beings have the fortune to be tamed and who do not, and he knows whether the time to tame them has come or not. He is called knower of the world because he knows when the time is right to act for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: Unsurpassed

original: skyes bu 'dul ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba /
translated: Tamer of beings

original: kha lo sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni sems can 'dod chags kyi shas che ba dang / zhe sdang gi shas che ba dang / gti mug gi shas che ba rta rgod dang 'dra ba gdul dka' ba rnams thabs bzang zhing sla bas so so'i thabs thabs bzhin du btul nas don du bsgrub pa'i mchog mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par kha lo sgyur zhing 'jog pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: kha lo sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni sems can 'dod chags kyi shas che ba dang / zhe sdang gi shas che ba dang / gti mug gi shas che ba rta rgod dang 'dra ba gdul dka' ba rnams thabs bzang zhing sla bas so so'i thabs thabs bzhin du btul nas don du bsgrub pa'i mchog mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par kha lo sgyur zhing 'jog pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir
translated: The expression tamer of beings means that he is the supreme guide who tames beings who are difficult to tame, such as those with a predominance of attachment, anger, or ignorance, who are like wild horses, by means of excellent and easy methods, and establishes them in the supreme goal of nirvana.

original: ro // lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi rnams la yang dag pa'i chos ston cing /
analyzed: ro // lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi rnams la yang dag pa'i chos ston cing /
translated: Teacher of gods and humans

original: lha dang mi rnams kyis kyang ston pa'am mkhan por gzung ba'i phyir ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom zhing gzugs dang grags pa dang / dbang phyug dang / dpal dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyis kyang ston pa'am mkhan por gzung ba'i phyir ro // bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom zhing gzugs dang grags pa dang / dbang phyug dang / dpal dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus te /
translated: because gods and men regard him as a teacher or preceptor.🔽The Blessed One: the four demons are destroyed, and he is endowed with these six excellences:

original: legs pa 'di drug dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: legs pa 'di drug dang ldan pa la /
translated: form, fame, sovereignty, glory, knowledge, and effort.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ston pa rnams kyi yon tan thams cad las 'phags shing 'das pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ston pa rnams kyi yon tan thams cad las 'phags shing 'das pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the Blessed One because he is superior to all the mundane teachers and because he has transcended them.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis /
translated: Then those sons of gods

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar gzugs mi len mi 'dor ba'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar gzugs mi len mi 'dor ba'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is thus: it does not take up form, it does not lay it aside, and so on up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi len mi 'dor @306b ba'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab🔽kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi len mi 'dor @306b ba'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings’ concordant complete acceptance of the knowledge of all aspects by way of not taking up and not discarding the knowledge of all aspects is amazing.”🔽Up to this point, the gods have heard that the bodhisattva great beings are not separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa lha'i bu rnams kyis thos nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa lha'i bu rnams kyis thos nas /
translated: and they have heard that the bodhisattva great beings are prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don rtogs na don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad blang dor med par yang rtogs la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don rtogs na don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad blang dor med par yang rtogs la /
translated: If they understand the meaning of this perfection of wisdom, they will also understand that ultimately all phenomena, such as form, are not to be taken up or discarded,

original: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin cing 'thob par 'gyur ba ngo mtshar che'o zhes lha'i bu rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin cing 'thob par 'gyur ba ngo mtshar che'o zhes lha'i bu rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod pa'o //
translated: and that conventionally they will completely accept and attain the knowledge of all aspects. It is amazing. The gods praise the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Then, the Bhagavat said to the fourfold retinue of monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen, and so forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan cing bsgom pa la sogs pa'i phan yon bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan cing bsgom pa la sogs pa'i phan yon bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the benefit of listening to and meditating on this perfection of wisdom and so forth cannot be obstructed by demons and so forth.

original: de la 'dzin pa ni gzhan las mnyan te /
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni gzhan las mnyan te /
translated: Therein, holding is listening to it from another.

original: don dang tshig rnams ma brjed par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: don dang tshig rnams ma brjed par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is holding the meaning and the words without forgetting them.

original: 'chang ba ni glegs bam du bris te mchod cing 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba ni glegs bam du bris te mchod cing 'chang ba'o //
translated: Keeping it is writing it out in a book and keeping it as an object of worship.

original: klog pa ni glegs bam du bris pa la klog pa'o//🔽kun chub par byed pa ni bsams pa'i shes rab kyis don rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: klog pa ni glegs bam du bris pa la klog pa'o// kun chub par byed pa ni bsams pa'i shes rab kyis don rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Reading it is reading it from what has been written out in a book.🔽Mastering it is realizing the meaning with the wisdom of reflection.

original: bsgom pa ni sgom pa'i shes rab kyis yang dang yang du goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni sgom pa'i shes rab kyis yang dang yang du goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Cultivating it is familiarizing with it again and again with the wisdom of meditation.

original: gzhan rgya cher 'chad pa ni dam pa'i chos mi nub cing yun ring du gnas pa dang / rgya cher 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir don dang tshig zhib tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rgya cher 'chad pa ni dam pa'i chos mi nub cing yun ring du gnas pa dang / rgya cher 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir don dang tshig zhib tu bshad pa'o //
translated: The extensive explanation for others is the detailed explanation of the meaning and the words in order to prevent the holy Dharma from disappearing and to make it last a long time and to make it spread widely.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bsam pa ngan pa dang ma 'dres shing /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bsam pa ngan pa dang ma 'dres shing /
translated: Proper mental attention is mental attention that is not mixed with bad thoughts that are adverse factors,

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang mthun par yid la byed pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang ma bral ba ni de ltar mnyan pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pa'i longs spyod pa dang / theg pa dman par mi bsngo bar /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang mthun par yid la byed pa'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang ma bral ba ni de ltar mnyan pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pa'i longs spyod pa dang / theg pa dman par mi bsngo bar /
translated: and that is in accord with the noble path.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: Not being separated from the thought of complete knowing is the dedication of the results of listening, reflection, and so on, to unsurpassed enlightenment, without dedicating them to mundane enjoyments or to the Lesser Vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis gzugs stong pa nyid shin tu byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bdud @307a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis gzugs stong pa nyid shin tu byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bdud @307a * //
translated: The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.🔽The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.🔽The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.

original: kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /🔽glags btsal bar bya ba dang / glags tshol bar byed pa gnyis ka yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga las gud na med de /
analyzed: kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste / glags btsal bar bya ba dang / glags tshol bar byed pa gnyis ka yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga las gud na med de /
translated: The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.🔽The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.🔽The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.🔽The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.

original: phung po lnga po de dag stong pa nyid du shin du goms par byas pa'i phyir glags btsal ba dang / glags tshol ba gnyis ka mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid la glags mi rnyed /
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag stong pa nyid du shin du goms par byas pa'i phyir glags btsal ba dang / glags tshol ba gnyis ka mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid la glags mi rnyed /
translated: The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.🔽The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.🔽The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.

original: mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma med pa la glags mi rnyed /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma med pa la glags mi rnyed /
translated: The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.🔽The passage beginning Because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have well-ascended the emptiness of form, etc. indicates the reason why Mara does not find an opportunity.

original: smon pa med pas smon pa med pa la glags mi rnyed do zhes bya ba ni glags btsal ba dang / glags tshol ba gnyis ka stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig pa'i phyir de ltar glags btsal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pas smon pa med pa la glags mi rnyed do zhes bya ba ni glags btsal ba dang / glags tshol ba gnyis ka stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig pa'i phyir de ltar glags btsal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching that there is no opportunity to be found because the search for an opportunity and the opportunity itself are of one taste in the nature of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it was explained in regard to the five aggregates beginning with form, so it should be applied in the same way to the six inner sense-spheres beginning with the eye, up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang gis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang / gang du glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang / gang la glags rnyed par 'gyur ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni glags btsal ba dang glags tshol ba dang /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang gis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang / gang du glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang / gang la glags rnyed par 'gyur ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni glags btsal ba dang glags tshol ba dang /
translated: Because the nature of that which would find an opportunity, that in which it would be found, and that in which it would be found, does not exist.

original: glags btsal ba'i gnas gsum char don dam par dngos po med par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: glags btsal ba'i gnas gsum char don dam par dngos po med par bstan pa ste /
translated: The three topics of the occasion of finding an opportunity are shown to be ultimately unreal.

original: gang gis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i las dang / bdud nyid dngos po med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i las dang / bdud nyid dngos po med par bstan pa'o //
translated: By whom there would be an occasion of finding an opportunity refers to the activity of finding an occasion of Mara, and the unreality of Mara himself.

original: gang du glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni lha yul lam mi yul gyi gnas gang du bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i gnas de yang dngos po med do zhes bstan pa'o //

analyzed: gang la glags rnyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /

translated: It is because those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have thoroughly cultivated love, compassion, joy, and equanimity toward all sentient beings in a way that does not apprehend anything.”

analyzed: bu'i tshal lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The section beginning with “in the forest of Banyan Grove”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyams su len pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams las yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyams su len pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams las yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches that the bodhisattva who practices this perfection of wisdom through listening, contemplating, and so forth has qualities that are especially exalted compared to the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: This completes the seventeenth chapter in the detailed explanation of the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: // / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang phan yon tshe 'di la thob par 'gyur ba brgya byin gyis 'khor rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang phan yon tshe 'di la thob par 'gyur ba brgya byin gyis 'khor rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir bstan pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One, in that way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind, and so on, is taught by Śakra to encourage the assembly to listen to, contemplate, and so on, this perfection of wisdom, the qualities and benefits that will be attained in this life.

original: de yang tshe 'di nyid la sems can yongs su smin par bya nus pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya nus pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro nus pa dang /
analyzed: de yang tshe 'di nyid la sems can yongs su smin par bya nus pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya nus pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro nus pa dang /
translated: Moreover, in this very life, he is able to ripen sentient beings, he is able to purify a buddhafield, he is able to go from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to serve the blessed buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la /
translated: and he is able to see those blessed buddhas,

original: rim gro dang bkur sti bya nus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos pa yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du brjed par mi 'gyur ba dang rigs phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rim gro dang bkur sti bya nus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos pa yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du brjed par mi 'gyur ba dang rigs phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The excellence of roots of virtue is the ability to perform service and honor. The excellence of hearing the Dharma from those Buddhas is that one does not forget it until one is enlightened. The excellence of lineage, etc. is being endowed with a perfect lineage, etc.

original: de la rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba la sogs pa'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba la sogs pa'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therein, the excellence of lineage is being born into a family of high caste, such as a royal family.

original: skye ba phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yum mchog dam pa'i lhums nas skye ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yum mchog dam pa'i lhums nas skye ba ste /
translated: The excellence of birth is being born from the womb of a supreme, holy mother of a Bodhisattva.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i yum sgyu ma'i lha mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i yum sgyu ma'i lha mo lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Bhagavat Sakyamuni was born from the womb of Maya Devi.

original: tshe phun sum tshogs pa ni tshe ring zhing glo bur du tshe mi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: tshe phun sum tshogs pa ni tshe ring zhing glo bur du tshe mi 'pho ba'o //
translated: The excellence of life span is having a long life and not dying an untimely death.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'khor dam pa'i chos la phyogs shing zhi ba dang dul ba sha stag ste /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'khor dam pa'i chos la phyogs shing zhi ba dang dul ba sha stag ste /
translated: The excellence of retinue is that the retinue of such a bodhisattva is exclusively made up of holy beings who are oriented toward the holy Dharma and are peaceful and disciplined.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'khor 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'khor 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the retinue of the Bhagavat Sakyamuni was made up of noble beings such as Ananda.

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'o /
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'o /
translated: The excellence of marks is being endowed with the thirty two marks of a great being.

original: 'od phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'od phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: The excellence of light is

original: dper na @309b bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'od 'dom gang ba dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na @309b bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'od 'dom gang ba dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the Bhagavat Sakyamuni being endowed with a fathom wide aura.

original: mig phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mig phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The excellence of eye is being endowed with the five eyes of a tathagata.

original: dbyangs phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung dbyangs kyi yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung dbyangs kyi yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The excellence of voice is being endowed with the sixty branches of melodious speech of a tathagata.

original: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of samadhi is to be endowed with the samadhi of the Heroic Way and so forth.

original: gzungs phun sum tshogs pa ni don dang tshig mi brjed pa'i dran pa dang shes rab kyi gzungs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs phun sum tshogs pa ni don dang tshig mi brjed pa'i dran pa dang shes rab kyi gzungs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of retention is to be endowed with the retention of the mindfulness and wisdom that does not forget the meaning and the words.

original: thabs mkhas pas bdag kyang sangs rgyas kyi skur mngon par sprul cing /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas bdag kyang sangs rgyas kyi skur mngon par sprul cing /
translated: By means of skill in means, one emanates the body of a Buddha and

original: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su mchi pa dang / gang du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams skye zhing 'byung bar ma gyur ba de dang / de dag tu mchis shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan brjod pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su mchi pa dang / gang du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams skye zhing 'byung bar ma gyur ba de dang / de dag tu mchis shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan brjod pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: goes from world system to world system, and in those places where the Bhagavat Buddhas have not been born and have not appeared, one goes there and praises the qualities of the perfection of generosity, and so forth up to

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / sems can rnams nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa gsum la 'dul ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thabs mkhas pas sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su song zhing /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / sems can rnams nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa gsum la 'dul ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thabs mkhas pas sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su song zhing /
translated: And it is wonderful that, by skillful means, you teach the Dharma to sentient beings, and that you discipline sentient beings in the three vehicles—the vehicle of the śrāvakas, the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas, and the vehicle of the buddhas.”

original: sems can rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad ston nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad ston nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to here, it shows the benefit of being able to go to worlds where there are no buddhas by skillful means and to teach sentient beings all the purifying dharmas such as the six perfections.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin  gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin  gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Lord, if one takes up this perfection of wisdom, one takes up all six perfections, and all the dharmas of the Buddha, up to and including the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba yang ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyan cing bsam pa la sogs pa'i nan tan byas na rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba yang ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyan cing bsam pa la sogs pa'i nan tan byas na rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la
translated: Up to “it is also amazing that the knowledge of all aspects will be taken up” is the teaching of the benefit of practicing all the purified dharmas

original: nan tan byas shing yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nan tan byas shing yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: if one practices listening to and contemplating the perfection of wisdom and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ni brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi @310a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ni brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi @310a * //
translated: The Bhagavān said to Śatakratu, Lord of the Gods, as he had said, up to “the knowledge of all aspects will be taken up.”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i phan yon bsngags pa'i 'khor rnams brtan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i phan yon bsngags pa'i 'khor rnams brtan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Śatakratu, in order to stabilize the assembly’s praise of the benefits of the perfection of wisdom,

original: de de bzhin no zhes bzlas te bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bzlas te bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: repeated “it is so” and said, “It is so, Bhagavān.”

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba ste /
translated: Furthermore, Kausika, this perfection of wisdom, when it is taken up,

original: yongs su bzung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nan tan byed pa dang / bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas tshe 'di la bar chad bya mi nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nan tan byed pa dang / bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas tshe 'di la bar chad bya mi nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: When it is taken up, etc. shows the benefit that, by listening to, taking to heart, etc. this perfection of wisdom, and by making efforts, Mara, the tirthikas, etc. cannot create obstacles in this very life.

original: brgal ba zhes bya ba ni dmag 'gyed cing 'thab mong rgol ba'o //
analyzed: brgal ba zhes bya ba ni dmag 'gyed cing 'thab mong rgol ba'o //
translated: To dispute means to fight and to quarrel.

original: bral ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod yul du mi ster cing bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod yul du mi ster cing bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: To separate means to not give this perfection of wisdom a chance, to separate oneself from it.

original: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi gzhung la brten nas shags su rgol ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi gzhung la brten nas shags su rgol ba'o //
translated: To argue means to argue in debate, relying on the scriptures of the tirthikas.

original: brgal bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gal dang skyon 'dzin cing sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: brgal bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gal dang skyon 'dzin cing sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: To wish to dispute means to find fault with and to criticize the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yun ring por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa'i rgyu🔽bstan pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yun ring por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa'i rgyu bstan pa ste /
translated: Kauśika, it is because bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of generosity for a long time, and so on. This teaches the reason why Māra, tīrthikas, and so on are unable to create obstacles.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des yun ring por pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des yun ring por pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom practice the six perfections for a long time,

original: sems can rnams kyi don du sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / shag su 'gyur ba'i phyi nang gi chos rnams yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / shag su 'gyur ba'i phyi nang gi chos rnams yongs su btang ste /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings they give away all outer and inner phenomena that are discordant with the six perfections, such as generosity, which are the causes of quarreling, disputes, conflict, and contention.

original: sems can thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir de lta bu'i bar chad byed pa rnams mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir de lta bu'i bar chad byed pa rnams mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In order to establish all sentient beings in the perfections, such obstacles do not occur.

original: koo shi ka gang gi don du sems can de dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang gi don du sems can de dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Kauśika, for the sake of those sentient beings,

original: bag la nyal ba dang kun nas ldang bas 'khor ba na 'khor bar gyur ba'i bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang ba de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam par bcil te /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba dang kun nas ldang bas 'khor ba na 'khor bar gyur ba'i bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang ba de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam par bcil te /
translated: those latent tendencies and the afflictive emotions that cause them to revolve in cyclic existence, those latent tendencies and afflictive emotions are eliminated by bodhisattva great beings,

original: sems can de dag bsam gtan bzhi la yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can de dag bsam gtan bzhi la yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and those sentient beings are inspired to the four concentrations, up to🔽inspired to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @310b la ;
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @310b la ;
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas practicing this perfection of wisdom

original: bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas bar chad byed mi nus pa'i phan yon gyi rgyu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas bar chad byed mi nus pa'i phan yon gyi rgyu bstan pa ste /
translated: The benefits of being unable to be harmed by demons, tīrthikas, and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des sems can rnams la 'thab cing rtsod par 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi ldang bar bcil te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des sems can rnams la 'thab cing rtsod par 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi ldang bar bcil te /
translated: The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom has pacified the causes of sentient beings fighting and quarreling, the afflictions such as attachment and so on, and does not let them arise.

original: sems can de dag thams cad bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa rnams  par byang ba'i chos thams cad la yang dag par bskul te spyod yul du bcug pa'i phyir bdud la sogs pas bar chad byed nus par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa rnams  par byang ba'i chos thams cad la yang dag par bskul te spyod yul du bcug pa'i phyir bdud la sogs pas bar chad byed nus par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Because he has encouraged all those sentient beings to practice all the dharmas of purification such as the four dhyānas and has caused them to engage in the sphere of activity, it is taught that he is unable to be harmed by demons and so on.

original: de la bag la nyal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bag chags kyi tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la bag la nyal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bag chags kyi tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: Here, “latent states” are the afflictions such as attachment and so on that remain in the form of latent propensities.

original: kun nas ldang ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa de dag mngon du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa de dag mngon du 'byung ba'o //
translated: “Arisings” are the actual occurrence of those afflictions.

original: koo shi ka de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'di la yon tan de dag 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa'i phan yon tshe 'di la 'byung ba
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'di la yon tan de dag 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa'i phan yon tshe 'di la 'byung ba
translated: “Kauśika, when bodhisattva great beings practice the bodhisattva practice, these good qualities arise in this life” is the benefit that arises in this life, which is that Māra and so on are unable to create obstacles.

original: gong du smos pa rnams mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gong du smos pa rnams mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching that concludes the above.

original: tshe rabs gzhan la yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i phan yon tshe rabs phyi ma dag la 'byung🔽ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan la yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i phan yon tshe rabs phyi ma dag la 'byung🔽ba bstan pa'o //
translated: “In other lives, too, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood” and so on teaches the benefits that arise in future lives of practicing this perfection of wisdom.
