analyzed: sogs pa 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa nyid mtshan ma can du spyod pa yongs su 'dul ba dang nga rgyal med par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, it has been taught that the six perfections and so on, which are the antidote to the practice of the mundane perfections and so on, which are practiced with signs and with the three spheres impure, are the practice with signs that tames and eliminates pride.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum @312b ba rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bco brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum @312b ba rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bco brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eighteenth chapter of the extensive commentary on the perfection of wisdom in one hundred and fifty verses, called The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Śatakratu, head of the gods:

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, a son of good family or daughter of good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and properly pays attention to this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de g-yul du phyin pa'i tshe lus la mtshon tam mdas phog cing zug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de g-yul du phyin pa'i tshe lus la mtshon tam mdas phog cing zug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la
translated: Kauśika, by this method that son of good family or daughter of good family, when they go to battle, will not be struck by weapons or pierced by arrows.

original: sogs pa'i sgo nas nan tan du byed cing /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgo nas nan tan du byed cing /
translated: This is because they take up, bear in mind, and so on, this perfection of wisdom.

original: g-yul ngor 'gro ba'i tshe yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di skabs gang yang rung ba nas ci lobs pa kha ton du byas te song na de dgra las rgyal zhing mtshon gyis mi phog pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yul ngor 'gro ba'i tshe yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di skabs gang yang rung ba nas ci lobs pa kha ton du byas te song na de dgra las rgyal zhing mtshon gyis mi phog pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: When going to war, if one recites this perfection of wisdom, whatever one has learned, at any time, then the benefits of victory over the enemy and not being struck by weapons are taught.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang gal te rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang gal te rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, moreover, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family takes up and upholds this profound perfection of wisdom, and so on,

original: de  ltar byung ba'i phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tshad med grangs med pa de dag kyang rig sngags 'di nyid la bslabs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs
analyzed: de  ltar byung ba'i phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tshad med grangs med pa de dag kyang rig sngags 'di nyid la bslabs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs
translated: and the limitless, countless tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas in the ten directions who have come about like that, they too have trained in just this knowledge-mantra and have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyams su blangs te /
analyzed: par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyams su blangs te /
translated: Up to “the Buddha has attained enlightenment” explains the benefit of practicing by way of upholding, holding, etc. this perfection of wisdom.

original: sngags kyi tshul du dmigs shing brten te bcangs na gzhan gyis dug dang mtshon la sogs pa'i gnod pa sna tshogs byas kyang gnod pa de dag thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul du dmigs shing brten te bcangs na gzhan gyis dug dang mtshon la sogs pa'i gnod pa sna tshogs byas kyang gnod pa de dag thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: If one visualizes and relies on it in the manner of mantra, then even if others do various harms with poison, weapons, etc., all those harms will not be able to injure.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung bar ma byas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung bar ma byas /
translated: Kauśika, moreover, this perfection of wisdom has not been taken up,

original: kha ton ma byas klag pa dang kun chub par ma byas tshul bzhin yid la ma byas kyang gang na bris shing 'chang ba'i khyim mam /🔽grong ngam / grong rdal lam /
analyzed: kha ton ma byas klag pa dang kun chub par ma byas tshul bzhin yid la ma byas kyang gang na bris shing 'chang ba'i khyim mam / grong ngam / grong rdal lam /
translated: has not been recited, has not been read, has not been mastered, has not been properly paid attention to, and yet in whatever place it is written out and kept,🔽in that house,🔽town, city,

original: grong khyer der /
analyzed: grong khyer der /
translated: or village,

original: mi'am mi ma yin pa glags lta bas glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi'am mi ma yin pa glags lta bas glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: neither humans nor non-humans looking for an opportunity will find an opportunity.

original: koo shi ka de ltar gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te bcangs na de la yang tshe 'di'i yon tan dang legs pa de dag yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te bcangs na de la yang tshe 'di'i yon tan dang legs pa de dag yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Kauśika, in the same way, whoever writes out this perfection of wisdom and keeps it, they will have those good qualities and benefits in this life.”

original: 'di bklag cing mnyan pa la sogs pa'i nan tan ma byas par glegs bam du bris te bcangs pa tsam gyis kyang mi dang mi ma yin pa gnod pa bya bar glags lta ba rnams kyis glags mi rnyed @313a * //
analyzed: 'di bklag cing mnyan pa la sogs pa'i nan tan ma byas par glegs bam du bris te bcangs pa tsam gyis kyang mi dang mi ma yin pa gnod pa bya bar glags lta ba rnams kyis glags mi rnyed @313a * //
translated: This is the explanation of the benefit that those who do not apply themselves to reading, listening to, and so on this perfection of wisdom, but just write it out and keep it as a book, cannot be harmed by humans and nonhumans who look for an opportunity to harm.

original: pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the benefits of the perfection of wisdom

original: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na snying po byang chub pa'am snying po byang chub kyi 'khor tam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na snying po byang chub pa'am snying po byang chub kyi 'khor tam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, it is like this. For example, at the site of awakening or in the retinue of the site of awakening, and so on, up to

original: koo shi ka de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Kauśika, why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid sa'i phyogs de sems can thams cad kyi mchod rten du byas pas me tog dang phreng ba dang spos dang byug pa dang phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan mang pos phyag bya ba dang 'dud pa dang phu dud du bya ba dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid sa'i phyogs de sems can thams cad kyi mchod rten du byas pas me tog dang phreng ba dang spos dang byug pa dang phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan mang pos phyag bya ba dang 'dud pa dang phu dud du bya ba dang /
translated: clothing, parasols, and banners, and is bowed to, paid homage to, revered,🔽and honored.

original: rim gro bya ba dang / bkur stir bya bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi dang mi ma yin pas glags mi rnyed pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rim gro bya ba dang / bkur stir bya bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi dang mi ma yin pas glags mi rnyed pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to “it is so” teaches the example of not being found fault with by humans and non-humans.

original: byang chub kyi snying po gang du dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po gang du dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
translated: The place of enlightenment is where the tathāgatas of the three times fully awaken to buddhahood,

original: sems can gyi don sna tshogs mdzad par gyur pa'i sa phyogs de'am /
analyzed: sems can gyi don sna tshogs mdzad par gyur pa'i sa phyogs de'am /
translated: and where they perform various benefits for sentient beings.🔽In that place,

original: de'i nyan kor na 'khor  ba'i  sems can byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa yan chad la yang /
analyzed: de'i nyan kor na 'khor  ba'i  sems can byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa yan chad la yang /
translated: or in its vicinity, even for sentient beings of cyclic existence who are included in the animal birth-state,

original: mi'am mi ma yin pa la sogs pas gnod par bya mi nus pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris te bzhag pa'i khyim mam /
analyzed: mi'am mi ma yin pa la sogs pas gnod par bya mi nus pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris te bzhag pa'i khyim mam /
translated: It is not possible for humans or non-humans to harm them. In the same way, if this perfection of wisdom is written out in book-form and kept in the house,

original: grong der yang mi dang mi ma yin pas glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: grong der yang mi dang mi ma yin pas glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as the gods and demons cannot harm the place where the mantra is written, in the same way, in the house or town where this perfection of wisdom is written out and kept, neither gods nor demons can find an opportunity.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śakra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu byin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du bgyis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu byin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du bgyis te /
translated: Blessed One, if a son or daughter of good family were to write out this perfection of wisdom, make a book of it,

original: bcangs la zhes bya ba nas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'di las byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rin po che sna
analyzed: bcangs la zhes bya ba nas / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'di las byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rin po che sna
translated: carry it on the crown of their head,🔽and so on up to:🔽the knowledge of all aspects of the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly awakened ones, has come from this.🔽The relics of the tathāgata who has passed into parinirvāṇa, placed in a stūpa made of the seven precious substances,

original: bdun gyi mchod rten du bcug gam /
analyzed: bdun gyi mchod rten du bcug gam /
translated: or in a stupa with seven sections.

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi snod du bcug ste /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi snod du bcug ste /
translated: and having placed it in a vessel made of the seven precious substances,

original: mchod cing rim gro byas pa bas kyang /
analyzed: mchod cing rim gro byas pa bas kyang /
translated: and having worshipped and served it,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te bzung ba dang / bcangs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nan tan byas pa lhag par bsod nams che ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te bzung ba dang / bcangs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nan tan byas pa lhag par bsod nams che ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: the merit of writing out this perfection of wisdom, and of taking it up, etc., is greater.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śakra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rim gror mi bgyid /🔽bkur stir mi bgyid /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rim gror mi bgyid / bkur stir mi bgyid /
translated: Blessed One, those people of Jambudvīpa who do not honor,🔽do not revere,

original: phu dud du mi bgyid /
analyzed: phu dud du mi bgyid /
translated: do not worship

original: mchod par mi bgyid pa de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod pa de ltar mthu che bar ma 'tshal @313b tam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mchod par mi bgyid pa de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod pa de ltar mthu che bar ma 'tshal @313b tam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: this perfection of wisdom, they do not know that the worship of the perfection of wisdom is so powerful.

original: de bas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa de lta bu ni ches nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling 'di na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mchod
analyzed: de bas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa de lta bu ni ches nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling 'di na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mchod
translated: This passage explains that in this Jambudvīpa there are few sentient beings who make offerings to and honor this perfection of wisdom,🔽who have great faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, who are free of doubt, and who have a mind that is very confident.

original: cing bkur stir byed pa dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la dad pa che ba dang / nem nur med pa dang / shin tu rton pa'i sems can dge ba ni nyung shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod cing rim gror mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: cing bkur stir byed pa dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la dad pa che ba dang / nem nur med pa dang / shin tu rton pa'i sems can dge ba ni nyung shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod cing rim gror mi byed pa dang /
translated: There are many inferior sentient beings who do not make offerings to and honor the perfection of wisdom,

original: dkon mchog gsum la ma dad cing the tshom za ba dang / mi rten pa'i sems can dman pa mang pa gtan tshigs dang bcas te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la ma dad cing the tshom za ba dang / mi rten pa'i sems can dman pa mang pa gtan tshigs dang bcas te bstan pa ste /
translated: who do not have faith in the Three Jewels, who doubt, and who do not rely on them.

original: de la kun du sbyor ba gsum zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang gsum la bya ste /
analyzed: de la kun du sbyor ba gsum zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang gsum la bya ste /
translated: The three fetters are the afflicted view of the self, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme, and doubt.

original: nyon mongs pa de gsum gyis sems can rnams grol thar bar mi 'gyur zhing 'khor bar kun du sbyor ba'i phyir kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //🔽dam pa ma yin pa'i cha kun du sbyor ba lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de gsum gyis sems can rnams grol thar bar mi 'gyur zhing 'khor bar kun du sbyor ba'i phyir kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o // dam pa ma yin pa'i cha kun du sbyor ba lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems rnams so //
translated: These three afflictions are called fetters because they fetter sentient beings to cyclic existence, preventing their liberation and freedom.🔽The five fetters that are lower part are the afflicted view of the self, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme, doubt, desire for desire realm objects, and malice.

original: bla ma'i cha kun du sbyor ba lnga ni gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: bla ma'i cha kun du sbyor ba lnga ni gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams so //
translated: The five fetters that are upper part are attachment to the form realm, attachment to the formless realm, excitation, pride, and ignorance.

original: koo shi ka ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan bsgribs pa med pas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can tshad med grangs med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spyod kyang
analyzed: koo shi ka ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan bsgribs pa med pas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can tshad med grangs med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spyod kyang
translated: “Kauśika, with my unobstructed buddha eye I see that in the world systems in the eastern direction, numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, sentient beings are practicing for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pas de las gcig gam gnyis shig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pas de las gcig gam gnyis shig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: but, lacking the skill in means of the perfection of wisdom, only one or two of them will stand on the irreversible level,

original: de las phal cher nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de las phal cher nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: while the majority of them will stand on the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.”🔽And so on.

original: koo shi ka ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan bsgribs pa med pas steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can tshad med grangs med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spyod
analyzed: koo shi ka ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan bsgribs pa med pas steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can tshad med grangs med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spyod
translated: “Kauśika, with my unobstructed buddha eye I see from here in this world system, in the ten directions, in each of the world systems in the east, in the south, in the west, in the north, in the northeast, in the southeast, in the southwest, in the northwest, below, and above, in worlds as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river, countless, limitless, immeasurable, inconceivable, incomparable, and inexpressible sentient beings practicing for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: kyang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pas de las gcig gam gnyis shig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur gyi /🔽de las phal cher nyan @314a * //
analyzed: kyang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pas de las gcig gam gnyis shig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur gyi / de las phal cher nyan @314a * //
translated: but not having the skill in means of the perfection of wisdom, only one or two of them will stand on the irreversible level,🔽while the rest will stand on the śrāvaka level

original: thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Kauśika, unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is for those who are not lazy, who have effort,

original: koo shi ka bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni le lo can brtson 'grus med pa /🔽bsam pa zhan pa /
analyzed: koo shi ka bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni le lo can brtson 'grus med pa / bsam pa zhan pa /
translated: who have a superior intention,

original: mos par dka' ba /
analyzed: mos par dka' ba /
translated: who are difficult to inspire,

original: shes rab 'chal ba can rnams kyis bsgrub par dka'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba can rnams kyis bsgrub par dka'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: The passage up to “difficult to practice for those with poor wisdom”

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na yang theg pa chung ngu la spyod pa ni mang gi /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na yang theg pa chung ngu la spyod pa ni mang gi /
translated: teaches that in the world systems of the ten directions, there are many who practice the Lesser Vehicle,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs dang ldan par theg pa chen po la spyod pa nyung zhing dkon pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs dang ldan par theg pa chen po la spyod pa nyung zhing dkon pa bstan pa'o //
translated: but few who practice the Great Vehicle with the method of the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'phags pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung zhing gnas par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'phags pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung zhing gnas par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: and the gods of the form realm,🔽and the supramundane noble beings, such as the stream enterer.

original: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm in this world system of a billion worlds, and so on, up to

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha la sogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung ba
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha la sogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung ba
translated: From “The unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening will appear in the world” is the teaching of Śatakratu, Lord of the Gods, encouraging the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm and so on to take up,

original: dang bcang ba la sogs pa byas na /
analyzed: dang bcang ba la sogs pa byas na /
translated: carry, and so on, this perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'jig rten na yun ring du gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'jig rten na yun ring du gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: “If you do that, the Buddha’s teaching will remain in the world for a long time and all the buddhadharmas will appear in the world.

original: khyed kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba la sogs pa byos shig ces bskul ma btab pa bstan pa'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: khyed kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba la sogs pa byos shig ces bskul ma btab pa bstan pa'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
translated: You should also take up, and so on, this perfection of wisdom.”

original: koo shi ka khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zung shig chongs shig ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zung shig chongs shig ces bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Lord said to Śatakratu, Lord of the Gods, “Kauśika, you should take up this perfection of wisdom, you should bear it in mind, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i nang du nyan thos kyi chos sam /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i nang du nyan thos kyi chos sam /
translated: “Kauśika, it is because in this perfection of wisdom are included all the dharmas of śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: all the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
translated: all the dharmas of bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang rung ste /🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad 'dus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing bcang ba la sogs pa byas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang rung ste / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad 'dus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing bcang ba la sogs pa byas na /
translated: and all the dharmas of buddhas,🔽up to all the dharmas that are dharmas on the side of awakening.”

original: lha ma yin gyi dgra slar ldog par 'gyur ba dang / lha'i bu dang lha'i bu mo dag tshe 'pho ba'i tshe ngan song du skye ba'i ltas byung na yang /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dgra slar ldog par 'gyur ba dang / lha'i bu dang lha'i bu mo dag tshe 'pho ba'i tshe ngan song du skye ba'i ltas byung na yang /
translated: “Kauśika, if you take up, bear in mind, and so on, this perfection of wisdom, the enemy of the asuras will turn back, and when the signs of rebirth in the lower realms appear to the sons of gods and daughters of gods at the time of their death,

original: ngan song du mi skye bar mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos pa tsam gyi @316a * //
analyzed: ngan song du mi skye bar mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos pa tsam gyi @316a * //
translated: they will not be reborn in the lower realms but will be reborn in the higher realms, and just by hearing this perfection of wisdom,

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas kyang rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pa rol tu phyin ba 'di nyid la bslabs nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas kyang rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pa rol tu phyin ba 'di nyid la bslabs nas /
translated: and the roots of virtue will gradually become the cause of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and the tathāgatas together with their retinues of the three times have also fully passed into nirvāṇa after training in this very perfection of wisdom.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon rnams smos nas /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon rnams smos nas /
translated: Having mentioned those benefits,

original: phan yon de lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyir brgya byin khyod kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba dang bcad ba la sogs pa byos shig ces brgya byin la gtad pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phan yon de lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyir brgya byin khyod kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba dang bcad ba la sogs pa byos shig ces brgya byin la gtad pa bstan pa'o //
translated: “Because it has such benefits, Śakra, you should also take up, recite, and so on this perfection of wisdom.”

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Śakra said,🔽“Bhagavān, this perfection of wisdom is a great knowledge mantra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rig sngags chen mo'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rig sngags chen mo'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so on up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ji ltar sngags kyi mthus dug dang mtshon la sogs pas mi tshugs shing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'jig rten na yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ji ltar sngags kyi mthus dug dang mtshon la sogs pas mi tshugs shing /
translated: Up to “the knowledge of all aspects exists in the world” is as follows. Just as by the power of a mantra one is not harmed by poison, weapons, and so on,

original: dgra las rgyal bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba la sogs pa byas pa'i mthus dug dang mtshon la sogs pas mi tshugs shing /
analyzed: dgra las rgyal bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba la sogs pa byas pa'i mthus dug dang mtshon la sogs pas mi tshugs shing /
translated: and one is victorious over enemies, in the same way, by the power of having taken up this perfection of wisdom and so on, one is not harmed by poison, weapons, and so on,

original: dgra las rgyal bar 'gyur bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid rig sngags yin zhing mthu che ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dgra las rgyal bar 'gyur bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid rig sngags yin zhing mthu che ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: and one is victorious over enemies. Therefore this perfection of wisdom itself is a knowledge-mantra and it teaches the benefits of its great power.

original: de la rig sngags chen mo zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la phan pa'i dngos grub thams cad thob par byed do //
analyzed: de la rig sngags chen mo zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la phan pa'i dngos grub thams cad thob par byed do //
translated: Here, “great knowledge-mantra” is because it causes one to attain all the powers that are beneficial in this life and the next.

original: bla na med pa'i rig sngags zhes bya ba ni rig sngags de'i gong na de dang 'dra ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i rig sngags zhes bya ba ni rig sngags de'i gong na de dang 'dra ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unsurpassed knowledge-mantra” is because there is nothing else like that knowledge-mantra above it.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i rig sngags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i rig sngags zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mantra called “equal to the unequalled”

original: mi mnyam pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub la bya ste /🔽bla na med pa'i byang chub ci dang yang mi mnyam pa de thob par byed cing /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub la bya ste / bla na med pa'i byang chub ci dang yang mi mnyam pa de thob par byed cing /
translated: The unequalled refers to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de dang mnyam par 'gyur ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mnyam par 'gyur ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “equal to the unequalled” because it has the power to attain that unsurpassed enlightenment, which is unequalled by anything, and to become equal to it.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' yod na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' yod na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, if there are bodhisattvas, the paths of the ten virtuous actions are designated in the world, and so on up to🔽the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas are designated in the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang yon tan che ba bstan
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten na gdags su yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang yon tan che ba bstan
translated: This demonstrates the great power and qualities of the bodhisattva who practices the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: pa ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' gang na gnas pa'i yul phyogs de na dge ba bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad spyod cing @316b dar bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' gang na gnas pa'i yul phyogs de na dge ba bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad spyod cing @316b dar bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when the bodhisattva practices the perfection of wisdom, in whatever country he lives, all the qualities of the Buddha, such as the ten virtues, are practiced and flourish there.

original: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yod na rtsi dang rgyu skar dang skar ma thams cad gdags su yod do zhes bya ba nas /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpes byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang yon
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yod na rtsi dang rgyu skar dang skar ma thams cad gdags su yod do zhes bya ba nas / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpes byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang yon
translated: Kauśika, it is like this: when the orb of the moon exists, all the herbs, planets, and stars are designated.

original: tan che ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tan che ba bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to: that skillful means for attaining omniscience should be known as arising from the perfection of wisdom. This teaches the greatness of the bodhisattva's power and qualities through the example of the orb of the moon.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni /
translated: The orb of the moon

original: bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: has the nature of nectar.

original: gza' dang rgyu skar la sogs pa'i rgyal po yang yin pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthu dang byin gyis rtsi dang sman rnams kyang mthu che bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gza' dang rgyu skar la sogs pa'i rgyal po yang yin pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthu dang byin gyis rtsi dang sman rnams kyang mthu che bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since it is also the king of the planets, stars, and so forth, the power and blessing of the moon’s mandala and the power of the herbs and medicines will be great.🔽And the planets and stars will have great power and splendor.

original: gza' dang skar ma rnams kyang mthu dang gzi brjid che bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa yod na dkar po'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos thams cad 'jig rten na gnas shing
analyzed: gza' dang skar ma rnams kyang mthu dang gzi brjid che bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa yod na dkar po'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos thams cad 'jig rten na gnas shing
translated: In the same way, when a bodhisattva has the skillful means of the perfection of wisdom, all the phenomena that belong to the bright side will remain in the world and flourish.

original: dar bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dar bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de ni tshe 'di'i yon tan 'di dag dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de ni tshe 'di'i yon tan 'di dag dang /
translated: Kauśika, moreover, a son of noble family or daughter of noble family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and properly pays attention to this perfection of wisdom will have these good qualities in this life and

analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan 'di dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They will also possess these good qualities in other lives.🔽From this point on, it is said that those who practice by upholding and so on this perfection of wisdom will possess these good qualities in this life and in other lives until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du tshe 'di'i yon tan dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang  ba la sogs pa'i nan tan byed pa tshe 'di la dug dang mtshon la sogs pa'i gnod pas
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du tshe 'di'i yon tan dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang  ba la sogs pa'i nan tan byed pa tshe 'di la dug dang mtshon la sogs pa'i gnod pas
translated: They will not die in this life through harm from poison, weapons and so on,

original: dus byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / rgyal po'i chad pa'i 'jigs pa med cing /
analyzed: dus byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / rgyal po'i chad pa'i 'jigs pa med cing /

analyzed: rgyal po'i 'khor gyi mi rnams dga' par 'gyur pa la sogs pa'i phan yon thob par 'gyur ba dang / tshe rabs gzhan la dge ba bcu la sogs pa dkar po'i chos thams cad dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ngan song du mi ltung ba dang / yan lag nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / mi dbul po la sogs pa rigs dman ba rnams su mi skye ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan phun @317a * //
translated: The benefits of this are that one will obtain such benefits as the joy of the king's retinue and so forth, in other lives one will not be separated from all virtuous dharmas such as the ten virtues, one will not fall into the lower realms,

original: sum tshogs pa dang / rdzus te skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya nus pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams thob par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sum tshogs pa dang / rdzus te skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya nus pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams thob par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: one will not have incomplete limbs, one will not be born in poor families such as those of humans and so on, one will have the complete marks of a great being, one will be born miraculously, one will go from buddha realm to buddha realm, one will be able to ripen sentient beings and purify a buddha realm and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher ba shad pa las le'u nyi shu pa'o /🔽// / de nas mu stegs can gzhan dang kun du rgyu ba dang / glags lta ba'i bsam pa can brgya tsam zhig bcom ldan 'das ga na ba de logs su dong ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher ba shad pa las le'u nyi shu pa'o / // / de nas mu stegs can gzhan dang kun du rgyu ba dang / glags lta ba'i bsam pa can brgya tsam zhig bcom ldan 'das ga na ba de logs su dong ba dang zhes bya ba nas /

original: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang /
translated: In the world systems above, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, there are as many blessed buddhas, together with their saṅgha of hearers, as there are pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattva great beings.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: All the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, as many as there are, have also taken up this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go zhes bya ba'i par du ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag go zhes bya ba'i par du ni /
translated: Because all of them have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing kha ton du byas na mu stegs can (chos kyi bar chad byed par glags lta ba rnams) kyis mi tshugs pa'i phan yon gtan tshigs dang bcas pa bstan pa'o //

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su ma bsngos pas pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan na gdod sbyin pa la sogs pa yang pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur bas na /

analyzed: kun rdzob du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos na pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one dedicates to the knowledge of all aspects in the conventional, it becomes a perfection.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul dang / ji ltar mi skye ba'i tshul dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa'i pha @319a * //🔽rol tu phyin pa lags zhes bya ba nas /🔽ji ltar gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul dang / ji ltar mi skye ba'i tshul dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med cing dmigs su med pas gnyis su
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul dang / ji ltar mi skye ba'i tshul dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa'i pha @319a * // rol tu phyin pa lags zhes bya ba nas / ji ltar gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul dang / ji ltar mi skye ba'i tshul dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med cing dmigs su med pas gnyis su
translated: He said, “Blessed One, how is the perfection of generosity dedicated to the knowledge of all aspects in the manner of non-duality, in the manner of non-arising, and in the manner of non-apprehension?🔽How is the perfection of wisdom dedicated to the knowledge of all aspects in the manner of non-duality, in the manner of non-arising, and in the manner of non-apprehension?”

original: med par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: med par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: In the ultimate, all phenomena are non-arisen and non-apprehensible, so one should realize them as non-dual.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa byas na pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba thabs ji ltar byas na 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das la dga' bos zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa byas na pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba thabs ji ltar byas na 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das la dga' bos zhus pa'o //
translated: If one practices generosity and so forth with the three spheres completely pure, how does one proceed with the method that will become a perfection?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽gzugs gnyis su med pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par stong
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / gzugs gnyis su med pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par stong
translated: The Blessed One replied:🔽With the mode of non-duality of form, and so forth, up to With the mode of non-duality of unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: All phenomena from form up to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment are ultimately of one taste in emptiness.

original: gnyis su med par rtogs par byas na /
analyzed: gnyis su med par rtogs par byas na /
translated: If one realizes them as non-dual,

original: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsdos pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsdos pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: generosity and so forth dedicated to omniscience in the conventional will become perfections.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gzugs gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gzugs gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He asks, “Blessed One, how is it that form is not two, and so on up to🔽how is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening not two, in the manner of not being two?”

original: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul gyis lags zhes bya ba'i bar du gnyis su med pa'i tshul zhes bya ba nyid chos gang dang gang dag stong zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul gyis lags zhes bya ba'i bar du gnyis su med pa'i tshul zhes bya ba nyid chos gang dang gang dag stong zhing /
translated: The phrase “in the manner of not being two” refers to the fact that all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: ji ltar gnyis su med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis su med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain in detail the meaning of nonduality,

original: bcom ldan 'das la dga' bos zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la dga' bos zhus pa'o //
translated: Subhūti asks the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replies,

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ste /
translated: “In this way, form is empty of form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gzugs dang pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gzugs dang pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is because form and these perfections are not two and cannot be made two.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis stong ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis stong ste /
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is empty of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Because unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and these perfections are not two and cannot be made two.”

original: ji ltar gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul gyis lags zhes dga' bos zhus pa'i @319b lan bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis su ma mchis pa'i tshul gyis lags zhes dga' bos zhus pa'i @319b lan bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: This is the reply to the question, “How is it by way of nonduality?”

original: don dam par gzugs la sogs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad chos de dag gi rang bzhin gyis stong la /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs la sogs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad chos de dag gi rang bzhin gyis stong la /
translated: In ultimate truth, all those phenomena, from form up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, are empty of the intrinsic nature of those phenomena.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The perfections are also empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong par ro gcig pa rnams la tha dad du dbye zhing gnyis su med pa'i phyir chos de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong par ro gcig pa rnams la tha dad du dbye zhing gnyis su med pa'i phyir chos de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: Since they are of one taste in being empty of intrinsic nature, they are not differentiated and are nondual. Therefore, they do not apprehend them as signs.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa byas nas /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: Having practiced generosity and so forth with the three spheres completely purified,

original: pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: they will become perfections.

original: dga' bo de lta bas na pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi thog mar 'gro ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dga' bo de lta bas na pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi thog mar 'gro ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Nanda, therefore, the leader of these five perfections is the perfection of wisdom itself, and so on up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi thog mar 'gro ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi thog mar 'gro ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: the leader of the knowledge of all aspects is the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: de ltar chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing gnyis su dbyer med par rtogs te /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing gnyis su dbyer med par rtogs te /
translated: Thus, having realized that all phenomena are ultimately empty of intrinsic nature and are undifferentiable in being nondual,

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni /
translated: they practice generosity and so forth with the three spheres completely purified.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pas /
translated: Because it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la sogs pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la sogs pa /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the forerunner of the five perfections and so forth,🔽and of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba yin no zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan lhag par bsngags pa sngar bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba yin no zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan lhag par bsngags pa sngar bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the perfection of wisdom that is praised as having superior qualities.

original: dga' bo 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: dga' bo 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Ānanda, it is like this:

original: sa chen po la sa bon btab pa rgyu rkyen tshogs par gyur na rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba yang sa chen po ni de dag gi gnas te /
analyzed: sa chen po la sa bon btab pa rgyu rkyen tshogs par gyur na rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba yang sa chen po ni de dag gi gnas te /
translated: when seeds are planted in the great earth and the causes and conditions come together, they grow. The great earth is their support.

original: sa chen po 'di la brten cing sa bon de dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa chen po 'di la brten cing sa bon de dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The seeds are supported by this great earth and they grow.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten cing /
translated: In the same way, the five perfections and so forth,🔽and all the qualities of the Buddha, are supported by the perfection of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par 'phel te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye zhing 'phel🔽bar 'gyur ba'i dpe sa chen po las blangs te bstan pas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par 'phel te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i dpe sa chen po las blangs te bstan pas /
translated: The passage from “these five perfections increase” up to “the knowledge of all aspects increases” is the explanation of the analogy of the great earth, from which all the buddhadharmas are born and increase, and which is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin par bstan to //🔽dga' bo rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brten cing pha rol tu phyin pa lnga rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin par bstan to // dga' bo rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brten cing pha rol tu phyin pa lnga rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus it shows that this perfection of wisdom is the principal cause of all the buddhadharmas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brten cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /🔽shes rab kyi @320a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brten cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /🔽shes rab kyi @320a * //
translated: “ Nanda, based on the knowledge of all aspects, the five perfections increase” up to “based on the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of all aspects increases.”🔽This shows that the perfection of wisdom is the principal condition for the arising of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi tshul gyis brten na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //🔽dga' bo de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag yongs su bsgrubs pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi tshul gyis brten na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'o // dga' bo de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag yongs su bsgrubs pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The manner in which the five perfections are accomplished by the perfection of wisdom is shown by the statement: “If one relies on the perfection of wisdom by way of the object to be focused on, namely, the knowledge of all aspects, which is the result accomplished by the perfections, then all the qualities of a buddha will increase.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba dang / yongs su 'dren pa dang / yongs su sgrub pa yin no zhes sngar bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba dang / yongs su 'dren pa dang / yongs su sgrub pa yin no zhes sngar bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: “Therefore, Ananda, it is the perfection of wisdom itself that accomplishes these five perfections,” and so on up to “it is the perfection of wisdom that accomplishes the knowledge of all aspects.” This is the summary teaching of the previously explained point that this perfection of wisdom is the forerunner, the leader, and the accomplisher of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gang bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las thos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gang bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las thos te /
translated: “Lord, I have heard from the Lord the good qualities of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang yongs su chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa'i yon tan gang ji snyed cig mchis pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang yongs su chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa'i yon tan gang ji snyed cig mchis pa dang /
translated: And I have heard from the Lord the good qualities of the sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who take up, bear in mind, read aloud, master, and properly pay attention to this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i yon tan gang ji snyed cig bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las bzung ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i yon tan gang ji snyed cig bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las bzung ste /
translated: And I have heard from the Lord the good qualities of this perfection of wisdom.

original: bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par bgyis pa dang / spel ba de dag thams cad bka' ma stsal te zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon gong du bshad pa las kyang rgya che zhing grangs mang ba dang /🔽dpag tu med pa bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par bgyis pa dang / spel ba de dag thams cad bka' ma stsal te zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon gong du bshad pa las kyang rgya che zhing grangs mang ba dang / dpag tu med pa bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: All those who have taken it up, recited it, mastered it, and promoted it, the Blessed One has not declared the qualities and benefits of the perfection of wisdom that are greater than, more numerous than, and immeasurably greater than those explained above.🔽 For the sake of opening the section on explaining the qualities and benefits of the perfection of wisdom that are greater, more numerous, and immeasurably greater than those explained above,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i yon tan 'dir yang ma bas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i yon tan 'dir yang ma bas na /
translated: since the qualities of this perfection of wisdom have not been explained here,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yon tan de dag thams cad bdag la bka' ma stsal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yon tan de dag thams cad bdag la bka' ma stsal te /
translated: the Blessed One has not declared all those qualities to me.

original: de zhib tu bshad pa'i rigs so zhes bcom ldan 'das la brgya byin gyis glengs shing bskul ba'o //
analyzed: de zhib tu bshad pa'i rigs so zhes bcom ldan 'das la brgya byin gyis glengs shing bskul ba'o //
translated: This is Śakra's discussion and exhortation to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / spel ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyis pas ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / spel ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyis pas ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One, by upholding, holding, reading, spreading, and properly paying attention to this perfection of wisdom, the ten wholesome ways of action appear in the world, and so on,🔽up to the Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One appears in the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @320b sangs rgyas kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba dang bcang ba la sogs pa byas pa'i yon tan dang
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @320b sangs rgyas kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba dang bcang ba la sogs pa byas pa'i yon tan dang
translated: This is the quality of upholding, holding, and so on of this perfection of wisdom.

original: phan yon dge ba bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / rgyal rigs che zhing tho ba la sogs pa mi dang lha'i rigs chen po rnams 'jig rten na yod par 'gyur ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa rnams 'jig rten na bzhugs par 'gyur ba rnams brgya byin gyis mgo tsam zhig glengs te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phan yon dge ba bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / rgyal rigs che zhing tho ba la sogs pa mi dang lha'i rigs chen po rnams 'jig rten na yod par 'gyur ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa rnams 'jig rten na bzhugs par 'gyur ba rnams brgya byin gyis mgo tsam zhig glengs te bstan pa'o //
translated: Śakra has merely mentioned the beginning of these.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byas pa de'i yon tan ni der zad par yang ma bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan thams cad bka' ma stsal to zhes🔽gsol ba'i lan du /
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byas pa de'i yon tan ni der zad par yang ma bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan thams cad bka' ma stsal to zhes gsol ba'i lan du /
translated: In reply to Śatakratu’s request to the Lord that he not teach all the qualities of the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang phan yon gong du bshad par yang ma zad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang phan yon gong du bshad par yang ma zad de /
translated: it is explained that the qualities and benefits of the perfection of wisdom are not exhausted by the above explanations.

translated: The

translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family is endowed with the practice of cleanliness, then by that practice of cleanliness those gods will come near, and so on up to🔽that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will experience a happy mind, a light mind, and a clear mind.”

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des ni sems bde ba dang / sems yang ba dang sems gsal ba yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di klog pa'i mi de khrus dang gtsang sbra byas te bklags na lha mthu chen po rnams 'ong zhing 'go bar 'gyur
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des ni sems bde ba dang / sems yang ba dang sems gsal ba yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di klog pa'i mi de khrus dang gtsang sbra byas te bklags na lha mthu chen po rnams 'ong zhing 'go bar 'gyur
translated: If that person who is reading this perfection of wisdom bathes and is clean and reads it, then the powerful gods will come and be present.

analyzed: ba dang / lha phra mo gnod par sems pa rnams gud du 'dong bar 'gyur ba dang / lha mthu chen po rnams lhags ni der ma klog par mi mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di klog pa'i sa phyogs gtsang sbra cher byas te mchod pa dang /
translated: and the minor gods who think to harm will go elsewhere; the powerful gods will come and will be inspired to read it there; they will have great devotion; they will make offerings and purify the place where this perfection of wisdom is read;

original: rgyan sna tshogs bri ba dang / lha rnams lhags shing gtsang sbra dang / mchod pa de ltar byas na klog pa'i mi de lus dang sems las su rung ba'i phan yon rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs bri ba dang / lha rnams lhags shing gtsang sbra dang / mchod pa de ltar byas na klog pa'i mi de lus dang sems las su rung ba'i phan yon rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: they will draw various ornaments; the gods will come and make offerings and purify the place; and if they do it like that, the person who reads it will have the benefits of a serviceable body and mind.

original: de nas nub mo nyal na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bsam pas mos par byas na sdig to'i rmi lam mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /

translated: Then, when they go to sleep at night, if they are inspired by thinking about this perfection of wisdom, they will not see bad dreams, and so on.

original: koo shi ka de ltar rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, a son of a good family or

translated: If they read this perfection of wisdom with pure thoughts, having made great purification, worship, and respect to it,

original: bsam pa dag pas bklags na rmi lam ngan pa mi rmi zhing /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pas bklags na rmi lam ngan pa mi rmi zhing /
translated: they will not have bad dreams.

original: rmi lam bzang po mthong bar @323a * //🔽'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam bzang po mthong bar @323a * // 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: They will see good dreams.🔽This teaches the benefit of not having bad dreams and of seeing good dreams.

original: rmi lam bzang po yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa dam pa'i chos ston pa mthong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de las pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du mdor bshad pa dang /
analyzed: rmi lam bzang po yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa dam pa'i chos ston pa mthong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de las pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du mdor bshad pa dang /
translated: The good dreams are seeing the blessed buddhas, who are adorned with the major and minor marks of great beings, teaching the excellent Dharma, and from those tathāgatas hearing in brief the six perfections up to the eighteen unshared qualities of the buddhas.

original: rgyas par bshad pa bdag gis thos pa rmi lam du mthong ba dang / byang chub kyi shing dang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi shing drung du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa bdag gis thos pa rmi lam du mthong ba dang / byang chub kyi shing dang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi shing drung du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
translated: The extensive explanation is the teaching on what he saw in dreams: the bodhi tree, the bodhisattvas going to the bodhi tree, those bodhisattvas attaining manifest enlightenment, having attained manifest enlightenment turning the wheel of Dharma,

original: chos rnam pa sna tshogs 'gro  ba mdzad pa rmi lam du mthong ba dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos ston pa'i sgra thos par 'gyur ba dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas mang po yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: chos rnam pa sna tshogs 'gro  ba mdzad pa rmi lam du mthong ba dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos ston pa'i sgra thos par 'gyur ba dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas mang po yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: and performing various kinds of Dharma activity for beings. He also heard the sound of the Dharma being taught by the bhagavān buddhas of the ten directions, saw many buddhas of the ten directions passing into parinirvāṇa,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa de dag rmi lam du mthong bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa de dag rmi lam du mthong bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: and saw in dreams the worship of stūpas of those who had passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: de dag bde bar nyal zhing bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di klog cing 'chang ba'i mi lus kyi nyams bde ba mang po myong bar 'gyur pa dang / zas dang gos la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams la chags pa'i shas chung bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de dag bde bar nyal zhing bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di klog cing 'chang ba'i mi lus kyi nyams bde ba mang po myong bar 'gyur pa dang / zas dang gos la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams la chags pa'i shas chung bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The passage beginning with “they will sleep well and wake up well” teaches the benefits of experiencing many physical comforts of a human being who reads and keeps this perfection of wisdom, and of having little attachment to requisites such as food and clothing.

original: shar phyogs nas steng gi phyogs kyi bar du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha dang klu la sogs pa mthu gtong zhing gzi mdangs skyed par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs nas steng gi phyogs kyi bar du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha dang klu la sogs pa mthu gtong zhing gzi mdangs skyed par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with “from the eastern direction up to the zenith” teaches the benefits of the buddhas of the ten directions, the bodhisattvas, and the gods and nagas bestowing power and generating radiance.

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo tshe 'di nyid la yon tan 'di dag yongs su bzung bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid nan tan du mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo tshe 'di nyid la yon tan 'di dag yongs su bzung bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid nan tan du mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The passage beginning with “Kausika, a son of good lineage or a daughter of good lineage who wishes to take up these qualities in this very life” teaches that one should earnestly listen to this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di phan yon che bas bklag pa dang mnyan pa la sogs pa nan tan du bya'o zhes gdams ngag tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di phan yon che bas bklag pa dang mnyan pa la sogs pa nan tan du bya'o zhes gdams ngag tu bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, since this perfection of wisdom has great benefits, one should earnestly read it, listen to it, and so on. This is the teaching of the instruction.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-second chapter, on the benefits, in the Great Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in 100,000 Lines.

original: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Śatakratu, head of the gods:

analyzed: koo shi ka @323b khyod kyis 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bus gang ba zhig kyang rnyed /
translated: “Kauśika, suppose you were to find a Jambudvīpa filled to the top with the relics of the Tathāgata,
