analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris pa zhig kyang la las byin na /
translated: and someone were to give you this perfection of wisdom written in book form.

original: de las gang blang bar bya zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de las gang blang bar bya zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Which of these two would you take?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung 'di dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba lags pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung 'di dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba lags pas na /
translated: “Blessed One, these relics of the Tathāgata are produced from the perfection of wisdom.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis rim gror bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis rim gror bgyi ba lags /
translated: the world with its gods, humans, and asuras will honor it,🔽will respect it,

original: bkur stir bgyi ba lags /🔽phu dud du bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: bkur stir bgyi ba lags / phu dud du bgyi ba lags /
translated: will venerate it,

original: mchod par bgyi ba lags /🔽bsrung zhing rim gro dang bkur sti dang phu dud dang / mchod par bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis gang ba rnyed de /
analyzed: mchod par bgyi ba lags / bsrung zhing rim gro dang bkur sti dang phu dud dang / mchod par bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis gang ba rnyed de /
translated: will make offerings to it,🔽and will guard, protect, and offer sanctuary to it.🔽The merit of making offerings to and venerating this perfection of wisdom in the form of a book is greater than the merit of making offerings to and venerating a world filled with the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: de la mchod cing bkur sti la sogs pa byas pa'i bsod nams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris pa la mchod cing bkur sti la sogs pa byas pa'i bsod nams che ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la mchod cing bkur sti la sogs pa byas pa'i bsod nams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris pa la mchod cing bkur sti la sogs pa byas pa'i bsod nams che ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the merit of making offerings to and venerating this perfection of wisdom in the form of a book is greater than the merit of making offerings to and venerating a world filled with the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad sgrub pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad sgrub pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: The relics of the Tathāgata are not the cause for accomplishing all the qualities of a buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad sgrub pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad sgrub pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the principal cause for accomplishing all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir sku gdung bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgya byin gyis gdams pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir sku gdung bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgya byin gyis gdams pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Because the relics of the Tathagata also come from this perfection of wisdom, the relics are superior to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to Śatakratu, head of the gods:🔽Up to “it is not the case that the perfection of wisdom is not the establishment of the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nye bar bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du brgya byin gyis 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis gang ba bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam gdams la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nye bar bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du brgya byin gyis 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis gang ba bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam gdams la /
translated: Above, Śatakratu said that a volume of the perfection of wisdom is superior to the world with its gods, humans, and titans filled with the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin la /
translated: In ultimate reality,

analyzed: bzang ngan du 'byed cing blang dor med pa las /
translated: He is without acceptance and rejection, distinguishing between good and bad.

original: brgya byin gyis blang dor can gyi chos su byas pa mi rigs par gal bzung nas /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis blang dor can gyi chos su byas pa mi rigs par gal bzung nas /
translated: It is not right for Śakra to make a Dharma that has acceptance and rejection.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar blang dor can du sems zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar blang dor can du sems zhes dris pa'o //
translated: Why do you think like that?

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is so, it is so.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su shes par bya @324a * //🔽ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su shes par bya @324a * // ba ma yin te /
translated: Up to The perfection of giving is not to be known as dual,🔽the perfection of giving is non-dual.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang la yang bzang ngan mi phyed cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang la yang bzang ngan mi phyed cing /
translated: Previously, Śāriputra taught the quality of not distinguishing between good and bad in any phenomenon of the perfection of wisdom in the ultimate,

original: blang dor med pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i tshig brgya byin gyis bzlas te /
analyzed: blang dor med pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i tshig brgya byin gyis bzlas te /
translated: and being without acceptance and rejection. Śakra repeated those words.

original: de de bzhin no zhes smras nas don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pha rol tu phyin pa drug car stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa la gnyis su med de bzad ngan dbye zhing blang dor can du shes par bya ba🔽ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes smras nas don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pha rol tu phyin pa drug car stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa la gnyis su med de bzad ngan dbye zhing blang dor can du shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Having said It is so, he taught that ultimately the six perfections, such as the perfection of wisdom, are of one taste in emptiness, without duality, and should not be understood as divisible into good and bad, or as objects of adoption and rejection.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One expressed his approval to Śatakratu, head of the gods, saying,

original: koo shi ka la legs so legs so de de bzhin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka la legs so legs so de de bzhin te /
translated: Excellent, excellent, Kauśika! It is so, it is just as you have said.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: From Excellent, excellent, Kauśika! It is so, it is just as you have said up to Excellent, excellent, Kauśika!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bzang ngan du dbyer med pa dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bzang ngan du dbyer med pa dang /
translated: Kauśika, it is because the perfection of generosity and the inconceivable element are non-dual and indivisible up to the perfection of wisdom and the inconceivable element are non-dual and indivisible teaches that the perfection of wisdom is indivisible into good and bad, and that the inconceivable element is indivisible into good and bad.

original: blang dor med pa'i don brgya byin gyis bshad pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis de de bzhin no zhes bstod nas de'i don 'khor rnams kyis bstan par shes par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings rnams la gnyis su dbyer med de /
analyzed: blang dor med pa'i don brgya byin gyis bshad pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis de de bzhin no zhes bstod nas de'i don 'khor rnams kyis bstan par shes par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings rnams la gnyis su dbyer med de /
translated: In the explanation of the meaning of non-acceptance and non-rejection by Indra, the Bhagavan praised him saying, “So it is!” In order to make the assembly understand the meaning of that, he said, “The dharmadhatu, suchness, the perfect limit, and the inconceivable expanse are indivisible into two.

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug car la yang gnyis su med pa'i phyir blang dor med pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis brnan te bstan pa'o
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug car la yang gnyis su med pa'i phyir blang dor med pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis brnan te bstan pa'o
translated: Just as they are of one taste in emptiness, likewise, the six perfections such as the perfection of wisdom are also indivisible into two. Therefore, they are free from acceptance and rejection.”

original: // de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, the lord of the gods Indra made a request to the Bhagavan, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi bar 'os pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas don dam par shes
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi bar 'os pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas don dam par shes
translated: This perfection of wisdom is worthy of worship by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la blang dor dang bzang ngan du 'byed pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la blang dor dang bzang ngan du 'byed pa med du zin kyang /
translated: This and the following passages show that, in the ultimate sense, the perfection of wisdom is beyond any distinction of better or worse, of acceptance or rejection.

original: kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs na /
translated: However, if one trains in the perfection of wisdom on the relative level,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus gsum du mngon par rdzogs @324b par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi stan la lha rnams mchod cing rim gro byed du 'ong ba'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang na bris shing 'chang ba la sogs pa byed pa'i phyogs der phyogs bcu'i lha dang klu la sogs pa yang de
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus gsum du mngon par rdzogs @324b par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi stan la lha rnams mchod cing rim gro byed du 'ong ba'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang na bris shing 'chang ba la sogs pa byed pa'i phyogs der phyogs bcu'i lha dang klu la sogs pa yang de
translated: bodhisattvas will attain perfect buddhahood in the three times, and the place where this perfection of wisdom is written down and kept will be honored and served by the gods, as illustrated by the example of the throne of Indra, king of the gods.

original: bzhin gshegs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung la /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung la /
translated: The Tathāgatas, the Śrāvakas, and the Pratyekabuddhas have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.🔽And all the requisites for the happiness of all beings have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ngo zhes nas mchod cing phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams la mchod par 'os par 'gyur ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i phyir mchod par 'os par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ngo zhes nas mchod cing phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams la mchod par 'os par 'gyur ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i phyir mchod par 'os par gyur pa dang /
translated: The relics of the Tathāgata are worthy of worship because they have come forth from the perfection of wisdom.🔽And the attainment of the knowledge of all modes by the Bodhisattvas has come about through training in this perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes par gyur pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bslabs pa las gyur ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing bcangs pa la sogs pa bya ba dang
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes par gyur pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bslabs pa las gyur ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing bcangs pa la sogs pa bya ba dang
translated: Therefore, this perfection of wisdom is worthy of worship because it has been written out, etc.

original: / mchod cing rim gro la sogs pa bya bar rigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: / mchod cing rim gro la sogs pa bya bar rigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: is taught.🔽Blessed One, therefore, from these two parts, I would take just this perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bas na cha de gnyis las bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to zhes bya ba ni gong du 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis bkang ba zhig kyang rnyed la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bas na cha de gnyis las bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to zhes bya ba ni gong du 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis bkang ba zhig kyang rnyed la /
translated: This is the summary answer to the question, If I were to find a Jambudvipa filled with the relics of the Tathagata,

original: la la zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris te byin na de gnyis las gang blang zhes dris pa'i lan mjug bsdus te /
analyzed: la la zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris te byin na de gnyis las gang blang zhes dris pa'i lan mjug bsdus te /
translated: and if someone were to give me this perfection of wisdom written in book-form, from the two, which would I take?🔽From the two, I would take just this perfection of wisdom, in terms of conventional truth.

original: de gnyis las kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing bzung ba la sogs pa byas nas bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par che ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing bzung ba la sogs pa byas nas bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par che ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: Having written and kept this perfection of wisdom, etc., the benefit of the especially exalted great merit is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di blangs te chos kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i yid kyis kha ton bgyid pa de'i tshe 'jigs pa'am bag tsha ba'i mtshan ma tsam yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di blangs te chos kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i yid kyis kha ton bgyid pa de'i tshe 'jigs pa'am bag tsha ba'i mtshan ma tsam yang /
translated: Blessed One, whenever I take up this perfection of wisdom and recite it with a mind included in the Dharma, at that time I do not see even the mere sign of fear or anxiety.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di blangs te chos zab mo la dad cing yid ches pa'i bsam pas bklags shing kha ton byas na 'jigs shing bag tsha bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu'am🔽mtshan @325a * //🔽ma tsam yang mi 'byung ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di blangs te chos zab mo la dad cing yid ches pa'i bsam pas bklags shing kha ton byas na 'jigs shing bag tsha bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu'am mtshan @325a * // ma tsam yang mi 'byung ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so on teaches the benefit of not giving rise to even the mere cause or sign of fear and anxiety when one reads and recites this perfection of wisdom with the intention of having faith in and confidence in the profound Dharma by taking up this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar 'jigs shing bag tsha ba tsam yang mi 'byung ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la don dam par mtshan ma dang / rtags dang / brjod pa dang / smos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jigs shing bag tsha ba tsam yang mi 'byung ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la don dam par mtshan ma dang / rtags dang / brjod pa dang / smos pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mere non-arising of fear and anxiety is due to this perfection of wisdom ultimately being without signs, marks, expressions, and mentions.

original: de la mtshan ma med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The signless is because it is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: rtags med pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags med pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The wishless is because it is free from the nature of things.

original: brjod du med pa ni tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inexpressible is because it is not the domain of words.

original: smos su med pa ni sgra'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smos su med pa ni sgra'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The indescribable is because it is not the nature of sound.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of meditative concentration and so on, up to the knowledge of all aspects should be applied.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma mchis pa zhig lags te mtshan ma mchis pa lags na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mtshan ma med🔽pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma mchis pa zhig lags te mtshan ma mchis pa lags na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mtshan ma med🔽pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Bhagavan, if the perfection of wisdom is signless, and so on, this teaches the reason that all phenomena, such as the perfection of wisdom and so on, are signless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yang chos thams cad mtshan ma med par rtogs nas sangs rgyas la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yang chos thams cad mtshan ma med par rtogs nas sangs rgyas la /
translated: The Tathagata's full, supreme enlightenment in unsurpassed enlightenment is also the realization of all dharmas as without a sign, and the Buddha's teaching of the Dharma without a sign to beings.

original: sems can rnams la yang mtshan ma med pa'i chos bstan pa dang sbyar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtshan ma med par mngon no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang mtshan ma med pa'i chos bstan pa dang sbyar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtshan ma med par mngon no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is seen to be without a sign when it is applied to that.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu
translated: Therefore, Lord, this perfection of wisdom of the gods, men, and Asuras, the world with its gods, men and Asuras and so on, is as explained above.

original: phyin pa 'di mtshan ma med pa yin pas 'di 'dzin cing klog pa la sogs pa byed pa la /
analyzed: phyin pa 'di mtshan ma med pa yin pas 'di 'dzin cing klog pa la sogs pa byed pa la /
translated: Since this perfection of wisdom is without a sign, when one takes it up, recites it, etc.,

original: 'jigs shing bag tsha ba'i mtshan ma tsam yang mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'jigs shing bag tsha ba'i mtshan ma tsam yang mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: not even the mere sign of fear and timidity occurs.

original: de'i phyir lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod cing bkur sti la sogs pa bya bar 'os pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod cing bkur sti la sogs pa bya bar 'os pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that one who possesses the qualities worthy of being worshipped and venerated by the world with its gods, humans, and demigods is one who possesses the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang la la zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang la la zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, Bhagavan, whoever upholds and possesses this perfection of wisdom...

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mchi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa byas pa dang / @325b glegs bam du bris te mchod cing bkur sti byas na ngan song rgyud gsum du mi ltung ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mchi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa byas pa dang / @325b glegs bam du bris te mchod cing bkur sti byas na ngan song rgyud gsum du mi ltung ba dang /
translated: up to...will go from buddha realm to buddha realm. If one upholds and possesses this perfection of wisdom and so forth, and having written it in a book, worships and venerates it, one will not fall into the three unfortunate realms.

original: theg pa dman pa'i lta ba can du mi 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa dman pa'i lta ba can du mi 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa dang /
translated: having the power to ripen beings,

original: bkur sti byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: and having the power to make offerings to and honor the tathāgatas and to go from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bltams pa zhig kyang stsal lo /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bltams pa zhig kyang stsal lo /
translated: “Moreover, Bhagavān, if this world realm of a billion worlds were filled with the tathāgatas’ relics,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang bris te stsal na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang bris te stsal na /
translated: and if this perfection of wisdom were given,

original: bcom ldan 'das dkon mchog de gnyis las bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis bkang ste mchod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dkon mchog de gnyis las bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis bkang ste mchod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang
translated: The Lord, from these two Jewels, I would take just this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te mchod pa'i bsod nams che ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te mchod pa'i bsod nams che ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the benefit that the merit from writing out and worshipping this perfection of wisdom is greater than the merit from filling a three-thousand-great-thousandfold world system with the relics of the Tathagata.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du zhe na 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams te zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du zhe na 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams te zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Why is it so, O Lord? From this have come forth the Tathagatas and the relics of the Tathagata, up to: the perfection of wisdom and the Tathagata are not two, nor are they divided.

original: gnyis su bgyir mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams mchod par 'os par gyur pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i phyir mchod par 'os par gyur la de bzhin gshegs pa dang /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung la mchod pa byed pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: gnyis su bgyir mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams mchod par 'os par gyur pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i phyir mchod par 'os par gyur la de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung la mchod pa byed pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The tathāgatas and the tathāgata relics are worthy of worship because they have emerged from the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag kyang ngan song du mi ltung zhing mtho ris kyi longs spyod myong nas theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag kyang ngan song du mi ltung zhing mtho ris kyi longs spyod myong nas theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur na /
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who make offerings to the tathāgatas and the tathāgata relics will not fall into the lower realms and, after experiencing the enjoyments of the higher realms, will attain complete nirvana through the three vehicles.

original: de dag 'byung ba'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod cing rim gro byas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod cing rim gro byas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: How much more so for those who make offerings to and venerate the perfection of wisdom, the cause from which they emerge.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang 'dra ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang 'dra ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits of seeing the perfection of wisdom are explained as being similar to seeing the tathāgatas.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum la zhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa dang /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung zhing kun chub par byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum la zhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung zhing kun chub par byas te /
translated: The passage beginning Moreover, Blessed One, if one enters into the three kinds of miracles of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One and so forth teaches the benefits of equality of merit and virtue with the Tathagata's explanation of the twelve branches of scripture and this perfection of wisdom being upheld and mastered.

original: @326a * // gzhan la bstan pa'i bsod nams dang yon tan mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: @326a * // gzhan la bstan pa'i bsod nams dang yon tan mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught: If one teaches it to others, one will have the same merit and virtue as the Tathagata.

original: de la cho 'phrul gsum ni gzhan gyi yid la ci sems pa mkhyen nas de dang rjes su mthun par chos ston pa dang / rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams yid ches par bya ste chos ston pa dang / bden pa gnyis kyi sgo nas chos thams cad gtan la dbab par bkrol te gdams pa dang tshar bcad pa'i tshul gyis phan pa la gzud pa dang gnod pa las bzlog pa'i phyir chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: de la cho 'phrul gsum ni gzhan gyi yid la ci sems pa mkhyen nas de dang rjes su mthun par chos ston pa dang / rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams yid ches par bya ste chos ston pa dang / bden pa gnyis kyi sgo nas chos thams cad gtan la dbab par bkrol te gdams pa dang tshar bcad pa'i tshul gyis phan pa la gzud pa dang gnod pa las bzlog pa'i phyir chos ston pa ste /
translated: The three kinds of miracle are: teaching the Dharma in accordance with the thoughts of others, having understood what they are thinking; teaching the Dharma by means of various miracles, thus inspiring confidence in sentient beings; and teaching the Dharma in order to introduce those to be trained to what is beneficial and to turn them away from what is harmful, by means of instructions that resolve all phenomena by means of the two truths.

original: rnam pa 'di gsum ngo mtshar che zhing rmad du byung bas sems can mang po dad cing 'dun par mdzad pas na cho 'phrul gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gsum ngo mtshar che zhing rmad du byung bas sems can mang po dad cing 'dun par mdzad pas na cho 'phrul gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: These three aspects are called the three kinds of miracle because they are so amazing and marvelous that they inspire faith and enthusiasm in many sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang shar phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis cho 'phrul gsum la gnas te
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang shar phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis cho 'phrul gsum la gnas te
translated: The passage beginning Moreover, Blessed One, the Tathagatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Awakened Ones of the eastern direction and so on explains that the Blessed Buddhas of the ten directions, as many as the sands of the Ganges River, abiding in the three types of miracles,

original: / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa dang / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bzung zhing kun chub par byas te /
analyzed: / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa dang / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bzung zhing kun chub par byas te /
translated: explain the twelve branches of scripture, and that the merit of any son or daughter of good family who takes up this perfection of wisdom, masters it,🔽and teaches it to others is equal to the merit of those two.

original: gzhan la bstan pa gnyis bsod nams mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la bstan pa gnyis bsod nams mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the benefits.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, in each of the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, to those thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas, from...

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing lang de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la mchod pa sna tshogs byas
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing lang de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la mchod pa sna tshogs byas
translated: Why is that?🔽From this come the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas.

original: pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris te mchod pa sna tshogs byas pa gnyis bsod nams mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam du bris te mchod pa sna tshogs byas pa gnyis bsod nams mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the benefit of making various offerings to as many thus-gone ones as there are sands in the Ganges river in each of the ten directions, and of making various offerings to this perfection of wisdom written in book form.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la bgyid cing gzhan la yang rgya cher ston pa des ni sems can dmyal ba'i rgyud kyi dogs pa ma mchis par bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la bgyid cing gzhan la yang rgya cher ston pa des ni sems can dmyal ba'i rgyud kyi dogs pa ma mchis par bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, a son or daughter of good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, properly applies their mind to, and teaches extensively to others this perfection of wisdom, should have no fear of the hells, and so on up to🔽all illnesses are cured.

original: nad thams cad rab tu sel ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab @326b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa byed pa mi tha mal pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nad thams cad rab tu sel ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab @326b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa byed pa mi tha mal pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not an ordinary person who takes up, bears in mind, and so on, this perfection of wisdom.

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that they are irreversible from the stages, having accumulated roots of virtue in the past.

original: de ni ngan song rgyud gsum dang theg pa dman par mi ltung zhing 'jigs pa thams cad dang nad thams cad sel ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ngan song rgyud gsum dang theg pa dman par mi ltung zhing 'jigs pa thams cad dang nad thams cad sel ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the benefits of not falling into the three lower realms, not falling into the Lesser Vehicle, and eliminating all fears and all illnesses.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, any son of good family or daughter of good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and takes it up, etc.

original: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ste zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing 'dzin pa la sogs pa byas na 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ba'i dpe
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ste zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing 'dzin pa la sogs pa byas na 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ba'i dpe
translated: The example of how one becomes fearless by writing out, taking up, etc., this perfection of wisdom, up to “from this have come forth the tathāgatas’ knowledge of all aspects,”

original: mi phyug po rgyal po la bstan pa las blangs te bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung bar mchod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir de dag gang bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: mi phyug po rgyal po la bstan pa las blangs te bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung bar mchod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir de dag gang bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: is taken from the story of a rich man who was taught by the king, and the tathāgata’s relics and the tathāgata’s knowledge of all aspects, etc., are objects of worship because they have come forth from the perfection of wisdom. Therefore, they are not even a sixteenth part of the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa 'di nyid mchog tu gyur pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das grong ngam grong khyer ram /
analyzed: pa 'di nyid mchog tu gyur pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o // bcom ldan 'das grong ngam grong khyer ram /
translated: This very perfection of wisdom is the teaching of the supreme benefit.

original: grong rdal lam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: grong rdal lam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Bhagavan, in a village or town or city or country where this perfection of wisdom is being written down,🔽up to it should be seen as if a Buddha has appeared in the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dar ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra bar blta'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yul phyogs gang na bris te 'chang ba la sogs pa byed pa'i yul phyogs der mi'am mi ma yin pa la
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dar ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra bar blta'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yul phyogs gang na bris te 'chang ba la sogs pa byed pa'i yul phyogs der mi'am mi ma yin pa la
translated: In whatever country this perfection of wisdom is written down and kept, in that country, humans and non-humans and so on will not cause harm,

original: sogs pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ba dang / 'dzin cing 'chang ba'i mi de theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi don sgrub par mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: sogs pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ba dang / 'dzin cing 'chang ba'i mi de theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi don sgrub par mdzad pa dang /
translated: and the humans who uphold it will have the fortune to pass into parinirvana through the three vehicles, and this perfection of wisdom will accomplish the purpose of Buddhahood for sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang na bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de na sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa dang 'dra ba'i phan yon rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang na bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de na sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa dang 'dra ba'i phan yon rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits of the perfection of wisdom being present in a world system are shown to be like the Buddha being present in person.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: dper na nor bu rin po che chen po mi dpogs rin chen bgyi ba mchis te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dper na nor bu rin po che chen po mi dpogs rin chen bgyi ba mchis te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For example, there is a priceless great precious jewel that accomplishes all that is to be done...

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che chen po de dang 'dra bar yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa ste sdig @327a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che chen po de dang 'dra bar yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa ste sdig @327a * //
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is like that divine great precious jewel, being the source of all good qualities, and dispelling all evil.

original: pa thams cad sel ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba dang 'dra bar sems can gyi don rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs par 'gyur
analyzed: pa thams cad sel ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba dang 'dra bar sems can gyi don rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs par 'gyur
translated: Up to this point, in the same order as mentioned above, the perfection of wisdom is like the appearance of a Buddha in the world, and various kinds of benefit for sentient beings will be accomplished.

original: ba'i dpe lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che las blangs te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ba'i dpe lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che las blangs te bstan pa ste /
translated: The example of the precious gem is taken from the divine substances.

original: lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che de gang du bzhag pa'i sa phyogs der mi ma yin pa'i gnod pa thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa dang / nor bu rin po che de mthong na nad rnam pa sna tshogs dang / mi dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs med par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che de gang du bzhag pa'i sa phyogs der mi ma yin pa'i gnod pa thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa dang / nor bu rin po che de mthong na nad rnam pa sna tshogs dang / mi dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs med par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Wherever the precious gem is placed, that place cannot be harmed by any nonhuman harm, and if one sees the precious gem, various illnesses and various nonvirtues will be eliminated.

original: nor bu rin po che de gang du bzhag par mun pa las snang bar 'gyur ba dang / tsha ba las bsil bar 'gyur pa dang / grang pa las dro bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can gdug pa rnams med par 'gyur ba dang / chu'i nang du bcug na yang chu'i rnyog ma thams cad dangs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che de gang du bzhag par mun pa las snang bar 'gyur ba dang / tsha ba las bsil bar 'gyur pa dang / grang pa las dro bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can gdug pa rnams med par 'gyur ba dang / chu'i nang du bcug na yang chu'i rnyog ma thams cad dangs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Wherever the precious gem is placed, darkness will become light, heat will become cool, cold will become warm, and malicious beings will be eliminated. If it is placed in water, all the turbidity of the water will be cleared.

original: nor bu rin po che de gos sna tshogs kyis dkris te chur bcug na yang nor bu rin po che de'i mthu dang byin gyis chu de gos de dang kha dog 'dra bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang sems
analyzed: nor bu rin po che de gos sna tshogs kyis dkris te chur bcug na yang nor bu rin po che de'i mthu dang byin gyis chu de gos de dang kha dog 'dra bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang sems
translated: Just as when that precious gem is wrapped in various cloths and put in water, the water takes on the color of those cloths because of the power and the blessing of that precious gem, in the same way this perfection of wisdom also removes all the harm of all beings.

original: can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad sel ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad sel ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus it is shown that it is the remover of all the harm of all beings.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Ananda said to Sakra, Chief of Gods:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi nor bu rin po che de dag gis ni lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che de'i grangs sam cha'am /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi nor bu rin po che de dag gis ni lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che de'i grangs sam cha'am /
translated: “Those precious gems in Jambudvipa do not equal a sixteenth part of that precious gem of the gods.

original: bgrang bar ram /
analyzed: bgrang bar ram /
translated: They do not equal a hundredth, a thousandth, a hundred thousandth part of it.

original: dpe'am rgyur nye par mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i dpe nor bu rin po che las blangs pa mi yul gyi nor bu rin po che phal ma yin gyi lha rdzas kyi nor🔽bu rin po che ste /
analyzed: dpe'am rgyur nye par mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i dpe nor bu rin po che las blangs pa mi yul gyi nor bu rin po che phal ma yin gyi lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che ste /
translated: It is not an ordinary precious jewel of the human realm, but a divine precious jewel.

original: nor bu rin po che de phal las khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las khyad par du 'phags shing /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che de phal las khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las khyad par du 'phags shing /
translated: By teaching that precious jewel to be superior to ordinary ones, it is taught that this perfection of wisdom is also superior to all the Buddha’s teachings such as the perfection of generosity,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don sgrub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don sgrub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and that it accomplishes the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das nor bu rin po che de snod la la zhig tu stsal ba las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nor bu rin po che de snod la la zhig tu stsal ba las /
translated: “Blessed One, if that precious jewel is placed in some vessel,

original: snod de nas byung yang snod de ni nor bu rin po che de'i yon tan gyis yad du mchi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: snod de nas byung yang snod de ni nor bu rin po che de'i yon tan gyis yad du mchi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Although it comes from that vessel, that vessel is made beautiful by the good qualities of that precious gem.

original: @327b gzhan yang snod de la mos pa skyed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: @327b gzhan yang snod de la mos pa skyed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, one should develop devotion for that vessel...

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'i snod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'i snod de /
translated: Blessed One, those relics of the Tathagata are vessels of the precious perfection.🔽Therefore, those relics of the Tathagata are worthy of worship.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag ni mchod pa mnga'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rtag tu btang snyoms la gnas pa dang / mi nyal ba'i chos nyid la thug gi bar gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi yon tan tshad med cing brjod kyis mi lang bas chos de dag gi gzhi dang snod du gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung yang mchod par 'os pa yin na chos de
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag ni mchod pa mnga'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rtag tu btang snyoms la gnas pa dang / mi nyal ba'i chos nyid la thug gi bar gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi yon tan tshad med cing brjod kyis mi lang bas chos de dag gi gzhi dang snod du gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung yang mchod par 'os pa yin na chos de
translated: This passage explains that the relics of the Tathagata are worthy of worship because they are the basis and vessel of those dharmas, the boundless and inexpressible good qualities of the Buddha dharmas from the perfection of wisdom up to the dharmata of never lying down, always abiding in equanimity and so on.

original: dag nyid lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes nor bu rin po che'i snod las dpe blangs te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan che ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dag nyid lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes nor bu rin po che'i snod las dpe blangs te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan che ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The qualities of the perfection of wisdom are shown to be greater than those of the precious jewel, using the example of a vessel made of precious jewels.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchas pa'i snod de zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchas pa'i snod de zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Bhagavan, those relics of the Tathagata are the vessel of the perfection of wisdom, which is free from defilement and free from purification.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das kyang /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das kyang /
translated: Therefore, even though the Tathagata has passed into Nirvana,🔽those relics of the Tathagata are worthy of worship.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag ni mchod pa mnga'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag ni mchod pa mnga'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa dang /
translated: Up to here, those relics of the Tathagata are the perfection of wisdom, which is free from defilement and purification, free from arising and ceasing, and free from conceptualization.

original: blang ba  dang dor ba med pa dang / dbri ba dang bsnan pa med pa dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa dang / chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa zab mo de lta bu'i snod dang gzhi yin zhing chos zab mo de lta bu'i bag chags yod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das kyang sku gdung de dag la mchod pa'i gnas su gyur pa bstan pa'i
analyzed: blang ba  dang dor ba med pa dang / dbri ba dang bsnan pa med pa dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa dang / chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa zab mo de lta bu'i snod dang gzhi yin zhing chos zab mo de lta bu'i bag chags yod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das kyang sku gdung de dag la mchod pa'i gnas su gyur pa bstan pa'i
translated: Because they are the vessel and basis for such profound Dharma, and because they have the habitual tendencies for such profound Dharma, the relics of the Tathagata are shown to be objects of worship even after the Tathagata has passed into Nirvana.

original: sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab cing gnyis su med pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab cing gnyis su med pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the profound perfection of wisdom and the non-dual qualities.

original: gzhan yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur yongs su bltams pa lta zhog gi zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur yongs su bltams pa lta zhog gi zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Furthermore, let alone the billion world systems filled to the brim with the relics of the Tathagata, it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams la yang rim gro dang / bkur sti dang phu dung dang mchod pa bgyis par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bkang ste /🔽mchod cing bkur sti byas pa bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams la yang rim gro dang / bkur sti dang phu dung dang mchod pa bgyis par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bkang ste / mchod cing bkur sti byas pa bas /
translated: The passage from “Kauśika” up to “they will make offerings to the relics of the Tathāgata” teaches that the merit and benefits of upholding and so on this perfection of wisdom are greater than making offerings to and venerating the relics of the Tathāgata.🔽The passage from “Kauśika” up to “they will make offerings to the relics of the Tathāgata” teaches that the merit and benefits of upholding and so on this perfection of wisdom are greater than filling as many worlds in the ten directions as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River with the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing bcangs pa la @328a * //🔽sogs pa'i bsod nams dang phan yon che ba gtan tshigs dang bcas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing bcangs pa la @328a * // sogs pa'i bsod nams dang phan yon che ba gtan tshigs dang bcas par bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage from “Kauśika” up to “they will make offerings to the relics of the Tathāgata” teaches that the merit and benefits of upholding and so on this perfection of wisdom are greater than making offerings to and venerating the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba yin la /
translated: The passage from “Kauśika” up to “they will make offerings to the relics of the Tathāgata” teaches that the merit and benefits of upholding and so on this perfection of wisdom are greater than filling as many worlds in the ten directions as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River with the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung la mchod cing bkur sti byas pas ni /🔽lha dang mi'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa myong nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung la mchod cing bkur sti byas pas ni /🔽lha dang mi'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa myong nas /
translated: The passage from “Kauśika” up to “they will make offerings to the relics of the Tathāgata” teaches that the merit and benefits of upholding and so on this perfection of wisdom are greater than making offerings to and venerating the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma rdzogs par mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma rdzogs par mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: It is simply that they pass into nirvāṇa without having completed the roots of virtue.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing bcad pa la sogs pa'i phan yon ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur  ba dang lha dang mi'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing bcad pa la sogs pa'i phan yon ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur  ba dang lha dang mi'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa
translated: The benefits of upholding and reciting this perfection of wisdom are that one will complete all the qualities of a buddha, such as the six perfections, and will experience the perfect happiness of gods and humans.

original: myong nas / sems can yongs su smin par bya ste /
analyzed: myong nas / sems can yongs su smin par bya ste /
translated: Having done so, one will ripen sentient beings.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas /
translated: Having gone beyond the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,🔽one will enter the bodhisattva levels, complete the bodhisattva activities, such as the superknowledges, and travel from buddha realm to buddha realm.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu shin tu bstsags pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu shin tu bstsags pa dang /
translated: One will gather the causes for all the qualities of a buddha.

original: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang ldan la /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang ldan la /
translated: They will possess all the excellence of gods and humans.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams la yang mchod cing bkur sti byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams la yang mchod cing bkur sti byas par 'gyur te /
translated: And they will make offerings and honor the relics of the Tathagata.🔽Thus, the benefits of upholding, carrying, and so on the perfection of wisdom are that all the qualities of a Buddha will be perfected, and the aims of self and others will be fulfilled.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzung zhing bcangs pa la sogs pa'i phan yon ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir che'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung la mchod cing bkur sti byas pa ni bdag 'ba' zhig gi don du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzung zhing bcangs pa la sogs pa'i phan yon ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir che'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung la mchod cing bkur sti byas pa ni bdag 'ba' zhig gi don du 'gyur bas /
translated: Making offerings and honoring the relics of the Tathagata is only for one's own aim.

original: de lta ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not like that.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad dang grangs ma mchis pa dag na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad dang grangs ma mchis pa dag na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Bhagavan, furthermore, in the worlds of the ten directions, which are innumerable and unlimited, there are innumerable and unlimited sentient beings.

original: de bas na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing
analyzed: de bas na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing
translated: Therefore, son or daughter of good lineage who practices the perfection of wisdom should cultivate the recollection of the Buddha as the nature of phenomena.

original: bcad ba la sogs pa byas na /
analyzed: bcad ba la sogs pa byas na /
translated: The explanation of the benefits of taking up,🔽reading, and so forth this perfection of wisdom,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku rnams mthong ba dang / mchod pa byas par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku rnams mthong ba dang / mchod pa byas par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: is that one will see the bodies of the tathāgatas dwelling in the immeasurable and countless world systems of the ten directions and will make offerings to them.

original: de la chos kyi sku ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The dharma body is the nature of the nonconceptual dharmadhātu.

original: gzugs kyi sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang @328b sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang @328b sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The form bodies are the enjoyment body and the emanation body.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The body of gnosis is the nature of the mirror-like gnosis, the gnosis of equality, the discriminating gnosis, and the all-accomplishing gnosis.

original: chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bsgoms na sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku bsgom par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bsgoms na sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku bsgom par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “One should cultivate the recollection of the Buddha as the true nature” means that if one cultivates this profound perfection of wisdom, one will cultivate the Dharma body and the gnosis body of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong bar 'tshal bas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong bar 'tshal bas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Moreover, Blessed One, a son or daughter of good family who wishes to see those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones” and so forth.

original: 'dus ma byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bgyi'o zhes brgya byin gyis smras pa chos nyid gang yin pa zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis
analyzed: 'dus ma byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bgyi'o zhes brgya byin gyis smras pa chos nyid gang yin pa zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis
translated: In order to explain in detail what reality is, Śakra said,

original: smras pa'o // bcom ldan 'das gnyis po 'di dag ni chos nyid de gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa'o // bcom ldan 'das gnyis po 'di dag ni chos nyid de gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: “Bhagavān, these two are reality. What are they?🔽The reality of conditioned phenomena and the reality of unconditioned phenomena.”

original: 'dus byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid ces bya ba de yang ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid ces bya ba de yang ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The reality of conditioned phenomena is the characteristic of the nature of wisdom, and the reality of unconditioned phenomena is the characteristic of the emptiness that is the nature of all phenomena, which is the absence of arising and cessation. This is the brief teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das de la 'dus byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang lags she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la 'dus byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang lags she na /
translated: Blessed One, what is the reality of conditioned phenomena?🔽The wisdom of inner emptiness, up to the wisdom of all supramundane phenomena is called the reality of conditioned phenomena.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang zhes bya ba nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi ye shes gang lags pa de ni 'dus byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin 'dus byas kyi🔽chos nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang zhes bya ba nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi ye shes gang lags pa de ni 'dus byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin 'dus byas kyi chos nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reality of conditioned phenomena, which has the nature of wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la dmigs pa'i ye shes rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la 'dus byas kyi chos nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bco brgyad la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la dmigs pa'i ye shes rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la 'dus byas kyi chos nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that observes all the qualities of the Buddha such as the eighteen emptinesses, and the virtuous, non-virtuous, contaminated, uncontaminated, mundane, and supramundane phenomena, which is associated with conceptual thoughts, is called the reality of conditioned phenomena.

original: de la 'dus ma byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang lags she na zhes bya ba nas 'di ni 'dus ma byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang lags she na zhes bya ba nas 'di ni 'dus ma byas chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: “What is the intrinsic nature of unconditioned dharmas?”🔽up to “This is called the intrinsic nature of unconditioned dharmas.”

original: don dam par chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that the nonexistence of the arising, ceasing, etc. of all dharmas ultimately is called the intrinsic nature of unconditioned dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That is so!🔽up to “They have attained, are attaining, and will attain🔽pratyekabuddha

original: rang byang chub @329a * //
analyzed: rang byang chub @329a * //
translated: enlightenment.”

original: thob po 'thob po 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing bcangs na chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran par 'gyur ba de bden te /
analyzed: thob po 'thob po 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung zhing bcangs na chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran par 'gyur ba de bden te /
translated: The meaning of this is that if one thus takes up and holds the perfection of wisdom, one will be mindful of the Buddha in terms of the intrinsic nature.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis so so'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te thob par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis so so'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te thob par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavan Buddhas of the three times, and the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, have attained their respective fruits in dependence on this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po thams cad rgya cher bstan te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po thams cad rgya cher bstan te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are taught in detail,🔽and that is taught by the method of worldly convention, not ultimately.

original: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi tshul gyis bstan gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te so so'i 'bras
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi tshul gyis bstan gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te so so'i 'bras
translated: The Bhagavan Buddhas of the three times and so forth have attained their respective fruits in dependence on this perfection of wisdom.

original: bu thob par yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs su med pa la sogs par rtogs nas so so'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bu thob par yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs su med pa la sogs par rtogs nas so so'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The sons who have attained the fruit have realized the meaning of this perfection of wisdom as signless, non-apprehensible, and so on, and have attained their individual fruits.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ring du song ba ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ring du song ba ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Why is that?🔽This perfection of wisdom is not far-reaching, up to it does not abandon the dharmas of ordinary beings.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams 'dor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par pha rol dang tshu rol la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams 'dor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par pha rol dang tshu rol la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that this perfection of wisdom is ultimately free from all signs of this shore, the other shore, and so on.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol ba bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol ba bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śatakratu said, Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection, up to it does not abandon the dharmas of the Buddhas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dmigs pa'i tshul du nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa bas kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dmigs pa'i tshul du nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa bas kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not stand in the manner of an objective mental support.”🔽🔽In this way, those who practice this perfection of wisdom know the minds and conduct of all sentient beings on the conventional level.

original: thams cad kyang shes la /
analyzed: thams cad kyang shes la /
translated: The passage from “The perfection of wisdom does not stand in the manner of an objective support” up to “The perfection of wisdom does not stand in the manner of an objective support” indicates that those who practice this perfection of wisdom know, on the conventional level, the minds and conduct of all sentient beings.

original: don dam par sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'i tha snyad la sogs par yang dmigs pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'i tha snyad la sogs par yang dmigs pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: On the ultimate level, they do not observe sentient beings, the conventions of designating sentient beings, and so on.

original: de ltar bdag dang sems can la sogs pa mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i gang zag rnams la bdag med par rtogs te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang sems can la sogs pa mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i gang zag rnams la bdag med par rtogs te /
translated: Thus they realize the selflessness of the persons imputed by the tīrthikas, such as the self and sentient beings.

original: gang zag du mi dmigs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pas chos su mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang zag du mi dmigs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pas chos su mi dmigs te /
translated: They do not observe the person. They realize the selflessness of all phenomena, such as forms, and thus do not observe phenomena.

original: de ltar gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs shing /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs shing /
translated: Thus they realize the selflessness of both persons and phenomena.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rgyu yang yin la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rgyu yang yin la /
translated: They are also the cause of nonobservation.

original: kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa thams cad shes par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa thams cad shes par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang yin te /
translated: It is also the cause for knowing all the minds and mental activities of all sentient beings on the relative level.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyi @329b ga'i yon tan che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyi @329b ga'i yon tan che ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it has the great qualities of both the relative and the ultimate.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
