analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is a great perfection.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?🔽Because it does not have that kind of intrinsic nature, which would be the object of observation, the observer, and the observed.

original: de ni 'di ltar gang gis dmigs par bgyi ba dang / gang la dmigs par bgyi ba dang / gang du dmigs par bgyi ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid de la ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang gis dmigs par bgyi ba dang / gang la dmigs par bgyi ba dang / gang du dmigs par bgyi ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid de la ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why there is no observation of either the individual or phenomena.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin cing dmigs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / gang la dmigs par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gang du dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po de lta bu don dam par med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dmigs pa'i tshul du nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin cing dmigs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / gang la dmigs par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gang du dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po de lta bu don dam par med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dmigs pa'i tshul du nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who apprehends signs and objectifies, the perfection of wisdom that is to be objectified, and the world system in which the thing to be objectified is to be objectified, do not exist ultimately. Therefore, the perfection of wisdom does not stand as an object.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin te /
translated: Kauśika, that is so!

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des mi dmigs pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yun ring por spyad pas des byang chub kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des mi dmigs pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yun ring por spyad pas des byang chub kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has practiced the perfection of wisdom for a long time in a non-apprehending way, by that [practice], does not even apprehend awakening,

original: sangs rgyas lta ci smos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lta ci smos /
translated: let alone a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos lta yang ci smos zhes bya ba ni gong du brgya byin gyis chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i don bshad pa de bden no zhes bstod nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos lta yang ci smos zhes bya ba ni gong du brgya byin gyis chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i don bshad pa de bden no zhes bstod nas /
translated: The phrase not to mention the qualities of a buddha is a praise, saying, What you have explained about the meaning of the non-apprehension of all phenomena is true.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des tshe rabs snga ma la yang dmigs su med pa'i don yun ring du bshad pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des tshe rabs snga ma la yang dmigs su med pa'i don yun ring du bshad pas /
translated: The bodhisattva has explained for a long time the meaning of non-apprehension in his previous lives as well.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis don du gnyer ba'i mchog bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis don du gnyer ba'i mchog bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: If even the unsurpassed enlightenment, the supreme goal of the bodhisattvas, is not apprehended,

original: de las gzhan yang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la sogs pa gzhan la mi dmigs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la sogs pa gzhan la mi dmigs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: then it goes without saying that other things such as the buddhas and the qualities of a buddha are not apprehended. This is a summary teaching on the meaning of non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śakra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyi /
translated: The Blessed One, do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ma lags pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan la mi spyod dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ma lags pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan la mi spyod dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or do they not practice the other perfections?

original: gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan cher bshad pa brgya byin gyis thos nas /
analyzed: gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan cher bshad pa brgya byin gyis thos nas /
translated: Having heard the extensive explanation of the qualities of the perfection of wisdom above,

original: 'khor rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug car 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug car 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: Śakra asked in order to dispel the doubts of the assembly and to initiate a discussion on practicing the six perfections with the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po kun la yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do zhes bya ba @330a * //🔽nas shes rab kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po kun la yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do zhes bya ba @330a * // nas shes rab kyang mi dmigs /
translated: Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings practice all six perfections without apprehending them.🔽Up to: wisdom is not apprehended,

original: shes rab dang ldan pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: one who possesses wisdom is not apprehended,

original: shes rab 'chal pa yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug car la 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod kyi /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug car la 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod kyi /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “nor does he apprehend a person of deficient wisdom” is that he practices the six perfections with the purity of the three spheres.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la spyod pa ma yin no zhes brgya byin gyis zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la spyod pa ma yin no zhes brgya byin gyis zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: The answer that the Lord gave to Śatakratu’s question is that he does not practice only the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka 'on kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'on kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: “Kauśika, moreover, the perfection of wisdom is the nonapprehension of form, etc., up to the perfection of wisdom is the nonapprehension of the knowledge of all modes.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the perfection of the bodhisattva, the great being, who views dharmas. It is the forerunner in the completion of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos rnam par lta ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sngon du 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas yongs
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos rnam par lta ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sngon du 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas yongs
translated: The meaning of this passage is that the six perfections are practiced with the purity of the three spheres.

original: su rdzogs par byed pa yang shes rab kyis chos thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa kun gyi gtso bo yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: su rdzogs par byed pa yang shes rab kyis chos thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa kun gyi gtso bo yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: Since it is also wisdom that brings the others to completion, in that it brings about the realization that all phenomena are unobservable, the perfection of wisdom is taught to be the chief of all the perfections.

original: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na 'dzam bu'i gling gi shing rnams lo ma sna tshogs can zhes bya ba nas khyad par ram bye brag mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na 'dzam bu'i gling gi shing rnams lo ma sna tshogs can zhes bya ba nas khyad par ram bye brag mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: Kauśika, it is like this: the trees of Jambudvīpa have various leaves, and so on up to: no difference or distinction can be observed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan bas gtso bo yin pa'i dpe shing dang grib ma las blangs te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan bas gtso bo yin pa'i dpe shing dang grib ma las blangs te bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches, by means of an example of a tree and its shade, that the perfection of wisdom is the chief of the other perfections.

original: shing gi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa sna tshogs las ni /
analyzed: shing gi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa sna tshogs las ni /
translated: From the various colors, shapes, and so on of trees,🔽the names of the trees and their specific types can be distinguished,

original: shing gi ming dang / rigs bye brag tu dbyer rung gi / shing de dag la brten te 'byung ba'i grib ma rnams la ni /
analyzed: shing gi ming dang / rigs bye brag tu dbyer rung gi / shing de dag la brten te 'byung ba'i grib ma rnams la ni /
translated: but the shadows that arise in dependence on those trees

original: shing gi rigs dang ming gi bye brag dbyer mi rung ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shing dang 'dra ste gtso bo yin gyi /
analyzed: shing gi rigs dang ming gi bye brag dbyer mi rung ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shing dang 'dra ste gtso bo yin gyi /
translated: Just as it is impossible to distinguish the different types and names of trees, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom is like the forest, being the principal one.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams ni grib ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams ni grib ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The other perfections are like the shade,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: arising from the cause of the perfection of wisdom.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol ba /
translated: Śakra said:🔽Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is endowed with great qualities,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa'i slad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa'i slad du /
translated: because it perfects all good qualities.

original: yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to: it is endowed with limitless good qualities.

original: yon tan kun du mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pas /
analyzed: yon tan kun du mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pas /
translated: Thus, since the perfection of wisdom is the principal one among all the perfections,

original: yon tan chen po dang ldan pa dang / yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa dang / yon tan kun du mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan chen po dang ldan pa dang / yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa dang / yon tan kun du mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the possession of great qualities, the possession of immeasurable qualities, and the possession of infinite qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du bgyis te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du bgyis te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Blessed One, if a son or daughter of good family were to write out this perfection of wisdom, make a book of it, and then🔽give it to someone else,

original: gang la las shes @330b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te /
analyzed: gang la las shes @330b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te /
translated: and if someone else were to write out this perfection of wisdom,

original: chos kyi dga' bas gzhan la byin na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: chos kyi dga' bas gzhan la byin na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and give it to someone else out of love for the Dharma,

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams cher 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams cher 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: the son or daughter of good family would generate a lot more merit.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
translated: “Blessed One, if a son or daughter of good family were to write out this perfection of wisdom, make a book of it,

original: bdag gis bcangs shing spyad pa bas kyang /
analyzed: bdag gis bcangs shing spyad pa bas kyang /
translated: and then carry it around, and if they were to practice it,

original: bsod nams che ba las dpe blangs nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la byin te spyod du bcug pa bsod nams che ba bstan pa'o //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du gzhan gyi drung du song ste /🔽bshad cing bstan pa dang zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te /
analyzed: bsod nams che ba las dpe blangs nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la byin te spyod du bcug pa bsod nams che ba bstan pa'o //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du gzhan gyi drung du song ste /🔽bshad cing bstan pa dang zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te /
translated: The merit of giving it to others and having them worship it is greater than the merit of worshipping the relics of the Tathagata oneself.🔽The merit

original: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / sil snyan sna tshogs kyis rim gror bya'o //🔽bkur stir bya'o //
analyzed: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / sil snyan sna tshogs kyis rim gror bya'o // bkur stir bya'o //
translated: and with flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, ribbons, and various musical sounds.🔽They should honor it.

original: phu dud du bya'o //🔽mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa byas pa dang / glegs bam du bris te /
analyzed: phu dud du bya'o // mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa byas pa dang / glegs bam du bris te /
translated: They should respect it.🔽They should make offerings to it.”

original: gzhan la byin pa'i bsod nams dang phan yon snga ma bas kyang don dang tshig gzhan la bstan cing bkrol te gsal bar byas pa'i phan yon bsod nams dang phan yon che ba bstan pa ste /

translated: The benefits and advantages of teaching and explaining this perfection of wisdom in other words and meanings, and of writing it out in a book and giving it to others, are shown to be greater than the previous benefits and advantages.

original: de ltar ston pa phan yon che ba'i gtan tshigs kyang de ltar ston pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra bar ston pa'i bya ba byed pa dang / don dam par bstan par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa phan yon che ba'i gtan tshigs kyang de ltar ston pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra bar ston pa'i bya ba byed pa dang / don dam par bstan par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Thus, the teacher is shown to be a great benefit, and the bodhisattva who teaches in that way is shown to be the same as the Buddha Bhagavān, performing the activity of the teacher.🔽The perfection of wisdom, which is the ultimate teaching,🔽and the bodhisattva who teaches it are shown to be non-different.

original: ston par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gnyis tha mi dad pa bstan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs pas /
analyzed: ston par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gnyis tha mi dad pa bstan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs pas /
translated: By training in this perfection of wisdom,

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis so so'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa yang /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis so so'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa yang /
translated: the individual results of the buddhas of the three times, the bodhisattvas, the śrāvakas, and the pratyekabuddhas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan cing bshad pa las thob par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan cing bshad pa las thob par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: are attained from teaching and explaining this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar bshad pa bsod nams cher 'phel lo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa bsod nams cher 'phel lo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the merit of the explanation greatly increases.

original: koo shi ka ngas don de nyid kyi dbang yang dag par mthong ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka ngas don de nyid kyi dbang yang dag par mthong ste /
translated: “Kauśika, I see the very same meaning

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @331a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @331a * //
translated: and have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect

original: pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhes bya ba nas /🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhes bya ba nas / nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: buddhahood, and so on up to🔽the sons of enlightened heritage or🔽daughters of enlightened heritage in the Vehicle of the Hearers

original: rigs kyi bu mo dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: or the sons of enlightened heritage or🔽daughters of enlightened heritage in the Vehicle of Solitary Realizers should honor, venerate, show respect for, and make offerings to this very perfection of wisdom with flowers,

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
translated: garlands, perfume, ointments, scented powder, clothing, parasols,🔽victory banners, ribbons,

original: sil snyan sna tshogs kyis rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / phu dud du bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: sil snyan sna tshogs kyis rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / phu dud du bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: and various musical sounds, what need is there to mention that the sons of enlightened heritage or🔽daughters of enlightened heritage in the Great Vehicle should honor, venerate, show respect for, and make offerings to this very perfection of wisdom with flowers,🔽garlands, perfume, ointments, scented powder, clothing, parasols,🔽victory banners, ribbons,🔽and various musical sounds?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par sangs rgyas pas chos gang la mchod cing brten par bya snyam du dgongs na yang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par sangs rgyas pas chos gang la mchod cing brten par bya snyam du dgongs na yang /
translated: When the Tathagata has attained full enlightenment, what Dharma should he honor and rely upon?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
translated: He should rely upon this perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag gis mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur pas /
analyzed: bdag gis mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur pas /
translated: Since I have attained full enlightenment,

original: 'di nyid la ngas rim gro dang / bkur sti la sogs pa bya'o snyam du bsams te /🔽'jig rten nang dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: 'di nyid la ngas rim gro dang / bkur sti la sogs pa bya'o snyam du bsams te / 'jig rten nang dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: I should honor and respect it.🔽There is no one in the world equal to me,

original: nga las lhag pa su yang med de /🔽nga lta bu yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rim gro dang / bkur sti bya bar sems na de las gzhan pa bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pa rnams kyis mchod cing /
analyzed: nga las lhag pa su yang med de / nga lta bu yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rim gro dang / bkur sti bya bar sems na de las gzhan pa bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pa rnams kyis mchod cing /
translated: much less superior.🔽If I, who am like this, think that I should honor and respect this perfection of wisdom,

original: bkur sti la sogs pa bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: bkur sti la sogs pa bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: what need is there to speak of those who aspire to unsurpassed enlightenment, or those who have entered the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who should make offerings and honor it?

original: de lta bu'i don chen po gzigs nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i don chen po gzigs nas /
translated: Seeing such great meaning,

original: don de nyid dbang du bya ste /
analyzed: don de nyid dbang du bya ste /
translated: The meaning of that is to be taken as follows.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la /
translated: This perfection of wisdom

original: mchod cing rim gro la sogs pa lhag par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mchod cing rim gro la sogs pa lhag par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: is taught to be the one to be worshipped, served, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽The bodhisattva-mahāsattvas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: have arisen from the perfection of wisdom.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis /
translated: Those who follow the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob bo 'thob bo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob bo 'thob bo //
translated: have attained the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas.🔽They will attain

original: 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di theg pa gsum char gyi /
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di theg pa gsum char gyi /
translated: it.🔽This perfection of wisdom

original: rgyu'i gtso  bo yin pas /
analyzed: rgyu'i gtso  bo yin pas /
translated: is the principal cause of all three vehicles.

original: de'i phyir  mchod cing bkur sti la sogs pa byas na bsod nams lhag par che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir  mchod cing bkur sti la sogs pa byas na bsod nams lhag par che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if one worships, serves, etc. it, the merit is extremely great.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-third chapter in the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in 100,000 Lines.
